review.reviewText: Perfectly located to reach all the major attractions we wished to visit without the need for a car

review.title: Great location • Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Only stayed here one night then headed to wine country. Can walk to Fishermans Wharf from hotel.

review.title: great hotel with great room.
review.reviewText: great hotel with great room. Limited support for dining outside of their limited hours,  Very limited drink/food support outside of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Increased dining and drink/coffee/beverage support in lobby

review.title: Great Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for our 3 day trip to San Fran, we were able to get around quickly, with easy access to the cable cars, MUNI (bus), UBER or Lyft services.
review.positiveRemarks: Really enjoyed the friendly staff, quick and easy check in.  The rooms were clean and provided us with everything we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms could use a safe for those travelling with passports.
review.locationRemarks: Embaradero Street, close to Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, Chinatown

review.title: Reasonably nice hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: No major complaints, no major wow factor either. Lots of extra charges for using the gym, internet and the price for breakfast was outrageous, felt nickled and dimed.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra charges for necessary services and ammenities
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, near to many attractions

review.title: Nice hotel. Needs refurbishing
review.reviewText: Hotel is getting old. No room service   Great location

review.title: Nice hotel, despite issues with internet
review.reviewText:
Be aware they charge you an additional daily fee on top of your reservation fee for the "spa, business services and coffee".  a rip off.

The internet on my room didn't work and after i spent 45 minutes speaking to the reception, their internal IT guy and the external company, they still could not make it work.   I had to leave the hotel to have a conference call on a place with internet.

Other than that, it is a good place and well located.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet service wasnt working on my room when i arrived and took them until the end of the day to fix it.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: The Stanford hotel is ideally situated, it is close to a lot of the tourist attractions. The staff was helpful and welcoming and the hotel was in good condition. My husband and I enjoyed our stay and would love to go back.

Room was very quiet!  Great location, but be prepared to walk up & down steep hills. The entrance is convenient for drivers.  There is a drive and turn around off the street that is great for loading and unloading. We were hit with a daily "Urban Bundle Fee and Tax" after we checked out that we were not expecting. The hotel told us that it was a new charge (that started after we had booked several weeks ago).

review.title: Close to cable car and wharf
review.reviewText: Just stayed for one night in way to Hawaii. Room was very clean and the bed comfortable. Hotel staff were friendly. We jumped on cable car to the wharf and actually walked the hills back.
Very friendly staff! That was my favorite part of my stay!

review.title: Stanford court
review.reviewText: Good hotel with a good location to the centre of San Francisco

review.title: too pricey for the area
review.reviewText: overall fair nothing exciting about this place. Probably other hotels nearby have better prices
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms, amenities, parking prices too high
review.locationRemarks: did not look around

review.title: Nice hotel and perfect location.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time in SF and plan to return again in the near future.
review.negativeRemarks: The TV reception is bad in our room and the ice machine should be on every floor.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping in China Town, Union Station, Fisherman Wharf, Japan Town, bike tour over the Golden Gate Bridge, and great restaurants nearby.

review.reviewText: Clean hotel with life fitness gym equipment. $60 to park in the hotel garage FYI. Awesome staff.
great location and excellent velet parking！！！！I love it. it is very near to union square and china town.

review.title: Great location and staff
review.reviewText: Great location and staff.  Walking distance to Wharf and Pier 39
Very clean and spacious for San Francisco.

review.title: Modern
review.reviewText: I'm from the rural east coast so visiting San Francisco was a great experience. The hotel was nice and offered some great amenities like heated towels, nice soaps and shampoos, fridge, safe, large bathroom with the commode and shower separate from the vanity area. The bed was very comfortable with nice linens. My only complaints would be the extra fees for parking - $52.00 per day on top of the hotel fee, no free coffee in the lobby but you can go across the street to the Fairmont and get a good cup at the little cafe, which you will want to do anyway because the room coffee is terrible, a microwave in the room would have been nice to heat up our leftovers from dinner and you will definitely want a set of ear plugs because the trolley goes by all day and night ringing it's bell.

review.title: Quick Getaway
review.reviewText:
Great location 
Staff was nice
Housekeepers were even better 
Would have been nice to have a fridge and microwave
Nice hotel very clean would stay there again. Very clean comfy beds. Great location and friendly staff.
Terrible experience. Shower condition is really bad.

Shabby facilities 
Food fair 
Ugly carpet in hallway

review.title: Disappointed and over priced
review.reviewText: This was a very expensive hotel with good positioning but poor amenities and s bit run down.

review.title: Brand new hotel Right next to Pike Place
review.reviewText: Great modern hotel. Super friendly staff. Will charge for everything but the air. Parking super expensive

review.title: Great location with friendly staff.
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent. The lobby has a very modern feel with "fun" furniture. The room was large for a hotel that is a century old. The Stanford sits on the corner of Powell and California streets. The cable car lines cross right there giving you access to cars going in all directions.

review.title: Exceptional Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very clean, the bed was fantastic.  The staff were very professional and friendly.  The concierge was also very helpful and advised us on different areas to go.  The hotel is situated in a central spot so that we could find our way around very easily.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very helpful and friendly.  The bar staff was were exceptional.
review.negativeRemarks: No very happy with everthing
review.locationRemarks: The cable car crossing was just outside the hotel so that it was easy for us to go places.

review.title: Terrible service.
review.reviewText:
Room no ready at check in time and no word of apology from the reception desk nor from the manager on duty. Found hair clippings on bed sheets. 
Room not made after 4:00pm. Coffee pods not replaced. Next room guests played very loud music around midnight and when I called the reception desk to complain no one picked up . Instead, I had a voice mail to leave a message. Several power outlets in the room did not work and had to be fixed.

review.title: Very nice hotel on a hill by two Cable Car routes.
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and modern. Very handy location to downtown and Cable Car routes.  It is on a hill, but unless cable cars are full, you don't have to climb them.  The lobby is great, with lots of seating, TVs, and great morning coffee.  On the eighth floor, it took until mid afternoon for our rooms to get cleaned, so sometimes when we came back after after a morning outing, we had to leave the room in order for cleaning to take place.  The desk people were great, although I did not like that we were asked to pay for a package deal that included Internet.  To their credit, they did wind up waving the fee, because our booking receipt implied that Internet was free.  Overall, I would certainly stay here again and do recommend it.

review.title: Cable car access
review.reviewText: Write at intersection of cable cars.  Convenient access.  Good gym

review.title: Great location..should higher end
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at Stanford Court many times. Seems to change owners/operators every two to three years. This time they chose a theme of bay area music artists in the lobby and elevators.  Loud annoying music from bands like Journey...cheesy and disturbing.

Rooms have been renovated but not modern or higher end..  food is non existent besides breakfast which is buffet, very expensive and terrible 

Lots of extra charges in bill so be prepared to pay extra $100 per day including something called an urban package which the staff cannot explain.
Great staff great location rooms are clean definitely worth the stay
Great hotel. Old but well kept.  Rooms  are smaller.  Thought the location was fine. Located on a loud busy street.

review.title: Excellent hotel, fantastic location
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time in San Francisco, Alcatraz a must double decker bus excellent. Roxanns for breakfast fantastic, 2 blocks from hotel.

review.title: San Francisco Hotel on Trolley line
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and staff were exceptional.  My grandson left his retainer, and they located it and mailed back to me.
review.negativeRemarks: No lunch served in hotel
review.locationRemarks: It is located at the trolley line on California Street

review.title: Has declined in category
review.reviewText:
Hotel used to be a solid five-star hotel but it has come down a notch in category.  My biggest gripe with the stay is that I paid up for a premier room which supposedly had a bay view and what that meant is that if you stood at one edge of the window and looked diagonally you would catch a glimpse of the bay. Standing squarely in front of the window and looking out treated us to a view on the outside wall of the Fairmont Hotel across the street. I felt ripped off. The room also faced California street and even thought we were on the floor below the top, we had to hear the noise of the tracks at night.  The rooms are small and somewhat dated.  I'm guessing that there are better places in town at the $300 per night price point.

The breakfast was ok.  Good fresh fruit offering, the rest just ok, including the setting, with the tables set out in the middle of the lobby with a shower curtain on one side separating the tables from the buffet line.  Looked kind of low budget.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean and staff was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast could be better, and the room setup better.  They could be clearer regarding the meaning of what a premier room is.
review.locationRemarks: Location is right on Nob Hill, you get your exercise climbing the hill every time you come back.

photos.caption: View of the Stanford from its neighbor, the Fairmont

review.title: Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: What's not to love about the Stanford Court hotel? Our room was enormous, plenty of space for a comfortable six day stay. The location is unbeatable, at the top of Nob Hill with everything you could want or need nearby. Our beds were soft and luxurious, we felt well rested each day. Best part? Caviar app had tons of places who delivered to hotel room door so if you were tired from walking up and down San Francisco's notorious hills you can stay in! I loved this hotel and can't wait to go back. Tonga Room is across the street and too cool to skip, make sure you stop in for a cocktail in the rain.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location but lacking the elegance and historical charm of the old guard Nob Hill hotels. Trying to be edgy and hip but fails miserable.  Staff is nice and friendly. Restaurant is a don't bother. Room was clean upon arrival but not well serviced during stay  .

review.title: Superb Location
review.reviewText: This is a well located hotel.  My two chief complaints were not having room service and not having ice machines on every floor.  However, my room (paid upgrade) was good sized and well designed.  The bar/dining area was pleasant.  A personal dislike:  the front doors--ticky, tacky design--please change them.  The water required to flush a toilet is way too much.  No longer is the Stanford Court on a par of excellence and chic with the Mark, the Fairmont or the Huntington but I liked it very much and will stay there again.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, conveniently located. Staff is friendly and welcoming. Beds are luxurious and comfy. Loved our stay at Stanford court!

review.title: Close to tourist attractions
review.reviewText: Our overall hotel experience was great! Forced valet parking and fee is ridiculous!! Would definitely look to stay elsewhere with lower fee. Personally, I believe it is wrong to charge guests to park their vehicle when they are staying at the hotel!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly, hotel was very clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower or eliminate required valet fee!
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Easy walk to China Town, Union Square, Wharf, North Beach, etc.

review.title: Nice place in San Fran.
review.reviewText: Nice place . Good service.  Nice room.  Friendly staff.

I am not a fan of this hotel. The bath was not clean you could See the hair from the guest before. The wall was not clean I hope ist was only coffee and nothing else. One of the windows was fixed with tape. The People from the car service were nice. When you don't upgrade your breakfast than the Ladys there are not kind anymore
Location convenient , nice city view . Breakfast is simple but yummy, and waiter are helpful

Clean and comfortable. Staff really went out of their way to accommodate my friend and I for our birthdays. Room had an amazing view, was clean, and comfortable. Hotel doesn't have room service. However, their lounge and cafe is amazing. The food was fresh and drinks were delicious. Highly recommend.

review.title: Close
review.reviewText: I love the location close if I want to go every where

review.title: Felt like Royalty
review.reviewText: Excellent service.  Everyone knew their job well.  The rooms were clean, comfortable and well equipped.  The breakfast was a bit costly but good.  Everything went smoothly and they were very helpful in the hotel with any needs and also, out and about town you can call them for assistance.  Would go there again!!
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on Nob Hill and close to everything.

review.reviewText: We had a really good experience, it was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: Staff were very helpful and accomodating. The location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was promised but turned out to be two limited to two items
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Easy access to shopping restaurants  city center

review.reviewText: Great location, spacious rooms, friendly and helpful staff who went the extra mile to make sure that the guest was taken care of.
I loved the Stanford Court hotel.  The staff was fantastic and always going above and beyond with anything I needed.

review.title: Nob Hill Hotel
review.reviewText:
All good except location of our room.
On busy front to California Street super noisy.
Food service not available except for limited hours. Staff very nice and was willing to move us to another room, but time did not allow.

review.title: Awesome location with amazing views
review.reviewText: The guest staff was incredibly attentive and accommodating. Loved the comfortable beds and complimentary filtered water. The view from our room of the cathedral and the bay was breath taking. Will definitely stay here again.

room is clean.
location is good.

A little higher price.

review.title: Business Trip
review.reviewText: I stayed here for a business trip and was pleasantly surprised with how nice it was. The hotel is beautiful and the room was updated nicely and very clean. The bed was comfortable and I liked that I had a choice of pillows. The room was a bit noisy at night because of the trolley running outside my window but they provide ear plugs and it stops at around 11 or 12 so it wasn't too bad. The shower head was a bit low but I'm not terribly tall so it worked ok for me. I know my colleague had a problem with that because he is 6'5. Breakfast is super expensive so we ate else where. All rooms in San Fran are over priced but I was happy with my stay so I guess the price was worth it.

review.title: Close to better hotels
review.reviewText: Rude staff, especially the concierge. When calling the fact that I was going to speak to his manager in a complaint, he said "add this to your list" - and then walked away to the back room - leaving me and five people standing in line . . . . . .
review.negativeRemarks: professional manner.

review.title: Stop looking and book here.
review.reviewText: Very cool hotel with over the top professional staff. Only complaint is price to valet but its san francisco and parking is a premium.

review.title: Rude
review.reviewText: Something is wrong with management. Not pleasant.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Certainly not a 4 star hotel ! Upon check-in was told we would be upgraded to a small suite. While the room was spacious, sofa & iron & ironing board were only furnishings I would not expect to find in a standard room. What was missing was drawer space for folded clothes. Other amenities pretty much typical of any hotel room,coffee maker,hair dryer, small fridge , phone ,safe & tv which only received about 1/2 of channels listed on room brochure. First floor elevator up button was missing, so you had to go to lobby before you could go up. Soda machine would only except coins or credit card, no bills ! Breakfast was overpriced for typical tourist, we walked across the street & ate for less than half what the Stanford charged. A continental breakfast would have been nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was really comfortable , & hotel employees were extremely helpful & courteous.
review.locationRemarks: Great location , cable car available at front door. Easy walk to China Town, Union Square, local cafes and restaurants , and shopping (downhill).

review.title: Nice Hotel close to down town and fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Im really pleased we decided to stay at this hotel.At the time I was looking at 2 hotels and this was dearer one.  Im now so pleased I paid the extra and stayed here. The rooms are very large with plenty of space with a lovely big bathroom with shower and bath! Bed was super comfortable and loverly soft pillows. The airconditioning worked very well and kept our room nice and cool. We had a room on a low floor at the front of the hotel, yes you do hear traffic and the dinging of the trams going by. Im a very light sleeper but I have to stay the noise did not in no way effect our stay. The hotel provided earplugs which I used so these probably helped. Each morning we went down to the lobby where we had free coffee, water and fresh juices. I thought this was a lovely touch and helped us start our morning well. The free use of Apple computers was great too, especially when having to check in our airline flights! The staff were all so helpful. The consearge was fantastic, I asked one day how to get to the golden gate bridge, he gave me a map and all lists of transport and numbers of busses etc. The doorman was always happy, friendly and greeted us each time we left and arrived to the hotel. I have to say this is one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. Unfortunatly they didnt acknowlege my email though saying I was on vacation to celebrate my daughters school grades, this saddened me, I felt they could have at least mentioned it! Overall a great trip though & Id stay here again
review.positiveRemarks: Free coffee, tea and juices. lovely to have a coffee maker in room too. Great there was an iron amnd ironing board even though i didnt need to use it.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the tiling in bathroom was abit old and could do with a refresh!
review.locationRemarks: In Nob Hill. It was about 20 mins walk to fishermans wharf and 10 min walk to Union Square. Cable car stop just opposite hotelwhich was a bonus!

review.title: Bad manners
review.reviewText: Steve, the guy checking us in - I must ask - why must you be so unprofessional and mean? Is it to make me not notice the tired and worn out carpet that plagues the hallways?

review.title: Stan court hot
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel. We recommend staying 
there. Everyone was so helpful and nice and accommodating
Wonderful!..great location and very helpful staff!

review.title: Awesome location atop of nob hill
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for four nights. This was our first trip to San Francisco and we weren't sure about its location. Upon arrival we realized it was in a fantastic location. It was only a couple minutes walk to Union square. It was also only a 30 minute walk to the fisherman's wharf. 
The room was big. It was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel staff were also fantastic, we went to watch the Golden State Warriors one of the nights, and the staff suggested that we take the bart. We were a little unsure as we are unfamiliar in the area, however we took his word for a cheaper and quicker commute over to Oracle Arena and it was easy. Everything about our experience at this hotel was great and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a brilliant hotel in a nice location.
Next time we are in San Francisco we will certainly be staying here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer room service

review.title: Upscale hotel for a great price
review.reviewText: This hotel had everything we wanted. Location. The cable cars are right out front. Do not walk to the hotel. Crazy hills. Clean room, comfy king bed and great wifi.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect location, friendly and helpful staff, clean and very comfortable rooms. Will stay there again.

review.title: Clean efficient 3 star hotel
review.reviewText: Wife and I love hiking with  appropriate gear.  The hotel is located almost at the top of Nob Hill and going shopping or for a meal near Union Square makes for a rather arduous climb back to the hotel.  The first couple days it was fun but it begins to wear on you about the third day .  Certainly not for hotels fault but location makes this hotel less popular for us.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location in Nob Hill right on two cable car lines and walkable to many places.

review.title: Vacation and work
review.reviewText:
My second time here.  Few things I like:
1. Location to cable car line and lovely safe spot in a city that does not always feel safe at night.   
2. Nice room. 
3. Good breakfast if you "trade up" to the 14.00 version.  

Not my favorite:

A.  This hotel, like many Expedia hotels, plays the "gee Your room isn't ready game" all the way up to check in.   I'm east coast and I don't want to fly seven hours to hear that.  

B. Free continental breakfast?  Wait til you find out what that means lol.   A real insult.  Just offer free coffee and don't insult your paying guests with the scrimpy "two cold item only" speech.   That's just maddening.  

C. Little noisy.  Street noise is common.  Bring a sound machine or use the complimentary ear plugs that come with the room.   Very minor-not a huge deal.
This was a great hotel in an amazing location. I would recommend to anyone going to SF.
Great hotel in a great location in SF. I would recommend to any friend or family going to San Fran.

This was my first hotel stay in San Francisco. Location was fantastic! It was close to the tour starting points and had great shopping in the area. Staff were pleasant and helpful. There was only a small blip. My first night there 4/28, the fire alarms went off and there were no announcements. There really should have been something announced as there were people outside their rooms in the hallway, probably from out of town, unsure of what to do. Other than that, I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely book again the next time I am in Cali!
Excellent location. Very welcoming staff. Would stay there again.

review.title: short visit
review.reviewText: pleasant stop after a Baja trip.  Convenient location to restaurants, shopping and public transit.  Rented a car nearby to visit Muir Woods - get there early for parking, even on a rainy day.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room with comfortable chairs, a rarity at most hotels.  Nice bathroom and comfortable bed.  Location worked well for us.
review.negativeRemarks: greeting at desk could have been a bit friendlier to tired travelers.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: Good hotel option for being the city. Central location. Would definately stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Parking is expensive, $56/night.

review.title: Nice hotel. Extremely bad TV.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with an extremely poor TV system with no guide. Would not stay there again.
The hotel staff was courteous. Our romm was comfortable and clean.

review.title: Trendy and Friendly
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located for any kind of trip. My room was a corner gem, with awesome view even from a 3rd floor. Staff was very attentive and made my stay a great one.

review.title: Great location and very comfortable
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is a very comfortable hotel in close walking proximity to many of San Francisco's sites. The hotel room that we had was large and comfortable, clean and well equipped. We loved the views of the city and the bay and will definitely consider this hotel if we were to come back to this great town.

review.title: Very quiet and comfortable room.
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff.  Very quiet room and comfortable bed.

review.title: Trying much to hard to be hip
review.reviewText:
The Stanford Court used to be one of the great hotels in San Francisco.  But it seems that some marketing guru got ahold of it and advised them to be more "relevant" -- and then told them that the way to do that was to paste on a thin veneer of standard-issue stuff like graphics and music (right down to text-message snippets like "lol").

Ugh.

What they failed to do was to pay attention to delighting their guests.  The staff is really first-rate -- no complaints there -- but the overall amenties, look-and-feel, and food service are mediocre at best.  A four-star hotel without room service?  A breakfast buffet?  No espresso drinks?  Not whining on the yacht, just saying that these are the ante for being a four-star hotel.

The rooms are tired, but serviceable.
Excellent location. Helpful and friendly staff. Clean, well-appointed rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel, perfect location.
review.reviewText: the hotel is conveniently located at the intersection of two cable car lines, so it's perfect to discover San Francisco in any direction. The neighborhood is nice and calm, and only 4 blocks away from Union Square.
Just a quick night stay. Enjoyed it but wouldn't have paid full price for it

review.title: Home away from home...
review.reviewText: I spent nearly two weeks at the Stanford Court and it was great. It was comfortable and everyone was helpful and kind. I am definitely going to stay there again! (I would recommend getting a clipper card for the tram. The hotel is at the top of Nob Hill and climbing that hill at night can be challenging ;-)
review.locationRemarks: Head down to Uncle Vito's (two blocks down Powell Street) for some great pizza!

review.title: Very nice hotel San Francisco Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: A potentially outstanding hotel in San Francisco Nob Hill profits from a magnificent location dominating the city downtown and North Beach. The hotel pretends to be prestigious and in part it accomplishes its mission in almost everything except for the staff, which tends to expand, lacking the ad hoc formality, courtesy and competency.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff and personnel's courtesy.

review.title: Vaca
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was friendly and rooms were clean. Breakfast served daily was nice but expensive at $18 per person for continental pastry, cereal and toast and coffee.

review.title: Fantastic location.  Over the moon staff.
review.reviewText: Needs hot tub afterwards touring up & down hills.  Needs a 4* restaurant.  Great art on changing screens.  Maid under par.  All other staff are absolutely 5*.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: We have no complaints other than it wasn't as nice as we expected. Loved the location.

review.title: Always love staying here.
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is great.  It's a bit further away from the touristy things which is what I prefer.  You can be at any of them within a 5 minute uber ride but its far enough away that you don't get all of the crowds and everything that makes you hate tourist traps.  The hotel staff is amazing and my favorite bartender Renee is still there.  I always recommend Stanford Court and encourage you to try them as well.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Nice, spacious clean room. Bed seemed smaller than a queen though. Close to everything...
Had a great stay here with our family. We had four adults and the room was large enough for everyone.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great staff! Didn't have a full service restauant or room service. Furniture in room had stains.

review.title: Beautiful Property, Spotty Service
review.reviewText:
I love the Stanford Court and have stayed here a number of times. It's a beautiful hotel but service systems need improvement.

There was a significant line and wait to check in. I felt like I was at Safeway where they don't staff enough registers either.

Valet parking has a nifty online system to order up your car except that it called me to the valet stand almost 29 minutes before my car was ready. I would have preferred to wait in my room vs. the cold drafty hallway next to the valet stand.
review.negativeRemarks: Service systems including check-in and valet.

review.title: Ok hotel but area is not good!
review.reviewText: My room was on the 2nd floor and facing the side of the trolley. Really noisy and bad location for a room. The hotel was ok but not the amnetities you would expect from a 4 star hotel.  The room look a bit dated. No room service! I would not recommnend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms and somehow sound proof the rooms near the trolley or at least those rooms should be deeply discounted.

review.title: Centrally Located
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located in the city and at walking distance to most of the location we wanted to visit.  The room was nice and clean, however the noise from the lobby carried through the entire building since our room over looked the inside of the hotel.  Overall the staff was helpful and accommodating and the room itself was very comfortable.  We are definitely staying at this location again, however on our next visit I would look for parking deals and a room that has a city view.
review.negativeRemarks: Better rates for valet parking.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and the Union Square are at walking distance.  Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf are a short car drive away.

review.title: At the intersection of two cable car routes!
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel; but breakfast was too expensive!
The location is excellent at the peak of San Francisco's many hills!

review.title: Solid 3 Star Hotel!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was conveniently located. We walked everywhere from seeing the sights to eating at the various restaurants. The hotel itself was a very solid 3 star hotel for us. The staff didn't do anything special. We did have one employee walk in our room with only one quick knock at the door. They didn't say house keeping and we actually opening the door as they knocked. Weird thing was they already cleaned our room. They also left their cleaning supplies in our room on another day and our window was left open on another occasion. The furnishing were okay and the headboard needed repairing or replacing. It was cracked all along the pad and it did look pretty bad. The rest of the hotel looked nice enough but it's definitely not a 4 star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks:
House keeping had issues w/leaving windows open, leaving supplies and walking in the room w/o announcing themselves
Headboard needed to be replaced
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to several restaurants and top spots for touring

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location within easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach, Embarcadero and Union Square.  Located right on the cable car line and also an easy place to find a cab.  We were traveling with two children and the room was big enough to where we could comfortably relax in them without being on top of each other.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great and the room was large.  Nice views and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The room decor is worn down and the concierge couldn't give us kid-friendly food recommendations beyond Cheesecake Factory and Rainforest Cafe.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is within a 30 minute walk of Chinatown, Little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf and Embarcadero.  A different walk every morning!

review.title: Convenient safe clean and friendly place.
review.reviewText:
The Stanford Court  affords a visitor all  the nice amenities of a much more expensive hotel.
The hotel is well maintained and pleasant and has the most wonderful staff of people.
We will come back.

review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

Love the ease of walking 'Grace Cathedral other local hotels.

Downtown.

review.locationRemarks: Suggest taking a cab/uber up Nob Hill, however if you choose to walk the front desk will have water waiting for you.

review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco, this was the perfect place to stay.

review.title: Lovely hotel

review.title: Great facilities

review.title: Favorite San Fran hotel

review.title: I had a wonderful 6th floor corner room.
review.reviewText: The room had a great view of the city. A beautiful modern room.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is a great spot in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel, well located
review.reviewText:
Staff personnel was excellent, friendly and committed to excell our expectations. The Concierge got all reservations we asked for.
The only think we didn´t like is they dont have a real restaurant, they offer some dishes at the bar, but the offer is limmited in a limited time schedulle
review.positiveRemarks: Well located, very close to Union Square, Chinatown, cable car stop is just steps away
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant offer
review.locationRemarks: Visit Union Square shops, plenty restaurant and bar offer nerby

review.title: Affordable Nob Hill Hotel
review.reviewText: What an incredible value.  Old style San Francisco in a modern setting.  Literally right next door to the Intercontinental and across the street from The Fairmont, Stanford Court holds its own against these two pricier hotels.  Staff is super friendly and helpful, rooms clean with nice historic touches.  Walking distance (albeit down steep sloping sidewalks) to Union Square and cable car right outside.  Wish I could have stayed longer, but was only in town for one night.  This will be my go-to place for all my overnight city visits as well as recommending to friends and family.
review.locationRemarks: Located in a perfect spot - top of Nob Hill.  Walk to Union Square (steep downhill) and cable car to Embarcadero right outside.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff, really nice room
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel - only comment I would make is that if you get a room with a great view, chances are you're also getting a room from which the trolley noise can't be missed.  Small sacrifice.
review.positiveRemarks: great staff, great room, comfy bed
review.negativeRemarks: trolley noise was a small nuisance

review.title: Pleasant hotel in a nice neighbourhood.
review.reviewText: Second tme at Stanford Court. Quite a few attractions within walking distance or short ride away (Union Square for shopping, Financial District, China Town, North Beach for Italian cuisine).if you are a fitness enthusiast, you can even challenge yourself to walk to Fishermans Wharf. Stanford Court is in a hilly part of town so put on your running shoes or hop on the cable car right outside the hotel.  Also used rideshare to get around which was inexpensive and extremely convenient. Would stay in this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are clean and the staff are really pleasant and accomodating.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was not included in our package. It was very expensive to have breakfast in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Walk, or take cable car/ cab/ rideshare to many local areas of interest: Union Square, Financial Disctrict, North Beach, Fishermans Wharf.

review.reviewText: Very nice area and close to many shops and restaurants.

review.title: Beautiful Landmark
review.reviewText: The Stanford is a location with some history to it.  After staying at the Westin San Francis and the Sir Francis Drake before, it was high on my list of places to be.  Staff was excellent, and the general appeal high.  Even our ground level room was very quiet.  Our room was on their lower end and a bit small, but pleasant and with a very comfortable bed.  The location is hard to beat, unless you;re afraid of walking a bit uphill.  There is always "Uber" or the Cable Car, though...  Speaking of which, there are two lines passing (if need be stopping) right at the corner of the hotel.  The floors felt a bit dated, but that's all I can complain about.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Staff, Ambiance, Bicycle rental possible.
review.negativeRemarks: Update here and there
review.locationRemarks: China Town, Union Square both around the corner.  Almost anything is walkable in SF for me anyway...

review.title: Loved taking the cable car too the top of the hill
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, nice breakfast. Room was good. Place could use a bit of a refresh.

review.title: A tourist hotel at best, not for business
review.reviewText: This hotel is trying too hard to be a hipsterish, boutique place in the body of a grand old Nob Hill hotel. It kind of fails at both. It's not a good place for business travelers. The place feels faded, my room was tiny and scuffed up with what felt like remaindered furniture from the 1990's.  Less than half the TV channels worked. The hallway carpeting was filthy in many places.  Noise penetrates the room easily.  Most astonishing, there's really no restaurant.  The breakfast in the lobby bar is a thoroughly mediocre, over-priced buffet with a handful of choices. I didn't even dare try the dinner in the same location, which had only 3 or 4 entrees anyway.  There's no lunch -- it's clearly a tourist-oriented hotel that assumes everyone will be out pretty much all the time.  Valet parking is very expensive and very slow. The staff is pleasant.  Location is great, of course.  But overall, it seems like a lot of effort was put into branding and image, and very little into the physical quality of the place.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything could be improved.  The cleanliness and the quality of furnishings in the room.   And the lack of a real restaurant is astonishing.
review.locationRemarks: It's Nob Hill in San Francisco...fantastic location, so everything you might want to do and see in San Francisco is nearby.

review.reviewText: Nice place.  Clean, good staff and the best elevator music!

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Near Union Square and Chinatown. Hotel on top of Nob Hill. Challenging walk up Nob Hill, great workout.
my husband and I where not happy with the condition of the room the paint was peeling off above the bed also the shower handle came off so was difficult to get the shower working

review.title: Nice location, very nice and kind all the staff
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly, good location and rooms are clean

review.title: Disappointing return
review.reviewText: No room service. No good restaurant .Where did the Fornace Oven go? Brazillian carpet. Just a total let down after many stays several years ago. No Ambiance . No attention to detail and a lackluster entrance. What happened?
review.negativeRemarks: Must have room service and a good restaurant

review.title: Great location; next you Union Square.
review.reviewText: Staff was nice and location was great! Would stay there again.

review.title: Friendly, attentive staff, great location.
review.reviewText: Located at Union Square on a quieter less commercial block, Stanford Court was a pleasure. Just be sure you have comfortable sneakers as the hill can be quite steep, but a great workout. Always love a visit to San Fran, and my stay at Stanford Court was no exception.
Nice hotel. Parking entrance not very well marked. Great staff.

review.title: Good hotel for business
review.reviewText:
Excellent and fast staff. 
Convenient location. 
Complimentary WiFi and nice working lounge area 
Lack of room service can be inconvenient

review.title: A comfortable stay in the city by the bay.
review.reviewText:
Staff are friendly and accommodating. 
The room we had was very nice albeit a touch noisey with the San Francisco traffic (our window looked out on to the street). 
The hotel is at the top of a hill so getting down to union square / shops (like Macy's ect.) was about a 4 block walk which was absolutely fine for us. 
The hotel restaurant is very nice with happy staff.
Nice hotel on Nob Hill. Just a quick overnight stay. Clean and quiet.

review.title: Excellent hotel close to the cable car stops!
review.reviewText: Stayed here last weekend with besties. Our room was spacious and the hotel staff were very friendly. The hotel is located within walking distance to Chinatown, and there are two cable car lines passing by the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to explore its neighborhood :)
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Cable Cars!

review.title: Room service is really pad .
review.reviewText: The Clenar room was so unprofessional . The room after clean was not arranged .

review.title: Beware of security...
review.reviewText: Do not disturb sign on door. Sleeping inside. Security wakes me up to do a "wellness" check. A note under the door would have worked... Or an email (since they bill themselves as being tech savvy). Or even a phone call if their need to check on my wellness was so urgent... Called the manager to discuss, but nothing to report as I received no callback.

review.title: Hotel for business week in the city
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine, but not for the price we had to pay - big convention in town so prices were high everywhere for all hotels
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, modern rooms, updated, great flat screen TV, comfortable beds
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice to have a bathrobe, no lunch is served at the hotel so have to leave, breakfast is either $18 or $28, staff was B-
review.locationRemarks: Nice location on Nob Hill, but very tough to walk up the huge hill from Union Square

review.title: Central to everything!
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is a lovely hotel with an an excellent location. The rooms were clean and spacious and the decor was elegant. It was a short walking distance Chinatown, Union Square and fairly close to Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach. The hotel is in a safe and nice neighbourhood, with a yummy little Italian Cafe near the hotel called 'Uncle Vito's', which is great for a tala way after a long day.
review.negativeRemarks: Nil
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown, Union Square with a cable car stop right out the front of the hotel.

review.title: Nice looking hotel in the Knob Hill area
review.reviewText:
- Booked for 4 person/4 nights however towels & toiletries are only setup for 2 person. 
- Big washroom however the tub was slow to drain when water is maxed.
- A busy hotel - should add more staff for check-in/customer service.
The hotel looks nice, clean and in a great area.

review.title: Great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed for seven nights and found our room very spacious and comfortable. The only negative note should be of concern to families with small children. The second to last day, our toddler discovered than the bottom half of the windows easily open. We assumed that they were bolted shut and were horrified when she was leaning out at 7 stories high! We spent our last two nights with furniture pushed up against the 2 windows, and not really sleeping well. Anyone with toddlers knows how resourceful and stubborn they can be with new discoveries. We would recommend this hotel with a huge beware to guests with little ones.
Good Hotel and Location, it's very centrally located and quiet.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Stanford Court. The proximatety to the local attractions was perfect. I only wish there was a true dining room. They had bikes for the guests to use on a first come basis. This was awesome! Truly a nice touch.

review.title: Great hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Stay for a week of vacation over Christmas and was very pleased with the hotel.  Room was a very good size for being an older hotel.  I've stay at the Mark Hopkins and the room was half the size.  Very friendly staff (Jorge in the lounge was fantastic).  Check in was fast and easy, valet service was great.  Very close to restaurants and Union Square or Chinatown.  Only thing I didn't like was the shower head was really low and made taking a shower complicated.  Also, one night that we ate in the lounge, there was a super obnoxious bartender working that talked the whole time at the top of her lungs.  Politics (far Left), movies, personal life, etc.  Just on and on VERY loudly.  Was quite a distraction to the point of being funny.  Other than that, a great experience overall and I would stay here again without a doubt.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice size room for this part of town.  Friendly staff.  Close to food, shopping, sights.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower head must have been installed by a 4ft tall plumber.
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants, Union Square and Chinatown.  Grace Cathedral is breathtaking.

review.title: Enjoyed the hotel & staff. Rooms a little small
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly & helpful! The rooms were always cleaned well. Accommodations were great and location was great too.
Room had limited space and bathroom had limited privacy.

review.title: no room service!
review.reviewText:
It was a difficult stay with no room service as one of us was recovering from surgery. There were not a lot of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were clean and spacious. The beds were very comfortable. However, the doormanchose not to open the door very often.
The hotel was reasonably priced.

review.title: Very nice Nob Hill hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: This hotel has a lot of good qualities.  It's location at top of Nob Hill means its centrally located to lots of points of interest, buses and trolleys.  The hotel staff was helpful, attentive, and friendly.  The theme is somewhat minimalist, moderne so more metal and tile then warm wood in lobby area.  If you are looking for old world SFO this is not the place. We were given exactly the type of room and location requested and room was very nice with an outstanding bay view.  The one consideration of being on the Powell side of hotel is the intermittent trolley noise until 1 am but, to some extent, this is part of the ambience.  In particular, the bathroom has a very long counter with sink so there's plenty of room to put everyones toiletries.  Since several days were very rainy, another very big plus were the huge umbrellas available on request at the registration desk with a deposit.
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary coffee and tea is only available until 10.30 am.  Perhaps the hours could be extended into afternoon.
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill at intersection of Powell and California.  Anchor Steam brewery tour (about $20 taxi ride), Golden Gate Park (45 min bus ride)

review.title: Excellent hotel all around
review.reviewText: The Stanford court hotel was one of the best hotels that I've stayed at in the city. It was perfectly located with excellent staff and all around phenomenal quality that surpassed our expectations. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! Thanks for a great stay!
Relaxing stay close to Union square, China town, and Columbus ave.

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently located
review.reviewText:
We decided to treat ourselves to an overnight in the city after a family gathering.  We couldn't have chosen a better hotel for our treat -- the staff, particularly Linda at the front desk, was extraordinarily nice and helpful!
Our room was clean and sooo comfortable to come home to on a rainy Sunday.  The hotel is located just a few
blocks from Union Square with the cable car just about at the front door - how convenient is that?!
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that could be improved is the cost of continental breakfast.  It was pricey for what you got.

review.title: Amazing staff
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We arrived late at night and the man who checked us in (Jeffery, I think) was above and beyond in ensuring that we were comfortable. He even upgraded our room! Moreover, my friend and I asked if we could heat up some leftover late night food one night, and they brought us a microwave to our room! I was blown away by their accommodating staff. 

The hotel was also very close to Union Square shopping, the BART, and Chinatown. Very convenient to get around! It is on the top of a VERY steep hill, however. Luckily, it is right off the Powell-Hyde streetcar, so if you can not handle the workout, there is that option.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Chinatown, close to the BART

review.title: Honeymoon trip
review.reviewText: Real nice and great staff in a great location could have better window fixtures in the room I was in couldn't open the windows to enjoy the cool weather of San Francisco.
Staff was great, wish they had room service or a hotel resteraunt

review.title: All good, but there are better options downhill
review.reviewText: The main issue with this hotel it is the location. It is at the highest peak of Powell St. and if you don't have a car there are many options for the same price closer to Union Square.

review.title: Hotel was dope. The hill sucks to walk up
review.reviewText: Great place, no lunch room service , bar food was pretty good. Lady bartender acted like I was under 21 or & I couldn't afford my bill lmao!

review.title: It was just ok...
review.reviewText: So the hotel is on top of nobble hill and omg to drive up there was no joke. Parking was $52 per day for valet and we couldn't self park because the hotels on nobble hill don't have self park options due to the hills. That was an unexpected expense that should have been noted. Our room was nice but the head board had a rip in it and when I asked the front desk about it they say they were remodeling :-/ also we paid for the bay view and its was a tiny view and you couldn't keep your windows open because the hotel across the street could see in, so I do feel like we wasted our money for the view. The staff was very friendly, lounge was nice. Overall it was an ok hotel I wouldn't stay there again.
The location and Staff was excellent. Right on Nobb Hill.

review.title: Stanford court
review.reviewText:
Wonderful hotel well located and great standard. Within easy reach of attraction and close to shops and eateries.
Highly recommended!
Great hotel, comfy beds, top location and thoughtful recommendations

First time visiting San Francisco and staying at this location. Everyone was courteous and efficient, from the valet parking to front desk. I will definitely stay here again when I visit  SFO in the future. Thank you!

review.title: Bed is way too soft!
review.reviewText: Great walking distance, friendly staff. Bed was  too soft and hurt my back. Other guests I spoke to said the same thing.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to St. Francis Hospital
review.reviewText: We stayed here the night before my surgery.  It was very nice and clean.  The Hotel staff was so polite and accommodating ,  we would definatly stay again if we are ever in the area
Great room with lots of space! Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Very pretty entry way & lobby.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Room heater was too loud at night that made sleeping difficult.

review.title: Good hotel on top of the hill
review.reviewText: If you don't mind to walk up and down the hill during the stay, this is a good choice.

review.title: Vey nice, clean and easy to find!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it!  The only two downsides were the trolley came up and down outside our window, but they provided us with ear plugs! The other was the breakfast was very expensive for what was offered. The hotel staff was friendly, room was clean, wifi worked well and door men were good.

review.title: Nice hotel Excelent location
review.reviewText: Place is very clean, staff is nice, location is great very close to Union. One trolley and you'll  be at the San Francisco bay. Pretty good choice to stay.
Good hotel. Nice location. Nice lobby. Pleasant and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room furniture needs some updating. Worn out a bit.

review.reviewText: This hotel has a great and friendly staff.  I would highly recommend staying here.
Loved the valet parking, room and staff....all good.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is high on Nob Hill.  It's well located and you can easily walk down to Fisherman's Wharf, the Embarcadero, the Financial District, Union Square, Civic Center or the Mission District.  The trek up from the BART can be trying on the calves and thighs, but you can take the Streetcar (at $7 a ride), which stops right by the hotel.  I'd recommend this area, because it's much more pleasant than Union Square or the Financial District.  (But be prepared if you plan to walk everywhere - though you'll get some great exercise.).  The hotel itself is very pleasant, with all the amenities you would expect.

review.title: Nice hotel with good location
review.reviewText: nice view , accessible to union square ,  friendly staff . Better breakfast needed

review.title: Central Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Was really well maintained. Rooms were fairly large for San Francisco. Good food but only serves food during certain times. You can easily walk to tons of different restaurants and bars. Overall a great experience.

review.title: My new favorite hotel
review.reviewText: The bed was so comfortable that I ended up booking an extra night! Love this place

review.title: Posh & Affordable
review.reviewText: Absolutely the best value in San Francisco. Cannot wait to return. The price was the best of all. Just loved our room and the entire setting. Have been staying there since 1975.
review.negativeRemarks: It was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Top of the Mark with a glass of wine looking down on the Grace Cathedral and all the sailings on the Bay!

review.title: Quite a change from the old Stanford Court
review.reviewText: The old Stanford Court was elegant and distinctly reflected an ambiance of wealth and exclusivity.  New Stanford Court aims at reflecting San Francisco's colorful literary and counter cultural history.  Rock and roll in the elevators and photos of local landmarks. Lively atmosphere.  As long as you don't regret the old days, it's a fine place to stay

review.title: nostalgic reVisit
review.reviewText: They removed the historic Redwood Room. A shame to lose an iconic tavern and lounge.

review.title: Only positive thing
review.reviewText: The location was great which is the only positive thing I can say. I paid for 2 queen beds and was given 2 double bed room. Front desk staff did not seem happy. Room not restocked, trash left in room. I would not recommend many other hotels to stay at
review.negativeRemarks: Service by front desk especially evening staff. Maid service needs to be retrained
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel. The amenities were excellent and the staff was very friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel in Nob Hill
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Stanford Court Hotel for our honeymoon for two nights and we really liked this hotel. The location was excellent and the view out of our 6th floor room was fantastic. The room wasn't large but wasn't small either. The bed was very comfortable. The two things that we didn't like about the hotel was that we noticed a weird smell when we first checked in, an overly sweet smell that was probably a cleaning agent. It wasn't unpleasant, just a weird smell that we weren't anticipating. The other issue was the shower - it was an older shower and the shower head was weirdly low -- only someone 5 feet or under would be able to actually stand under the shower. Since my husband and I are 5'9" and 5'8", that was a bit of an issue. The shower head wasn't adjustable so we weren't able to take a normal shower. 

Those are pretty minor items, though, because the room itself was very comfortable and the neighborhood was so convenient. There was a cable car stop right outside of the hotel that went downtown which was very convenient. Also, we ate in the hotel bar when we checked in late and the food was delicious.

Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if they do something about the shower heads. :)
review.positiveRemarks: Location, the view, and the bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower heads.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill has a lot of history. We were close to the Grace cathedral, to the cable car museum and to Chinatown.

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Parking is a significant problem in San Francisco, but at the Stanford it couldn't have been easier.  The valet parking worked our great, especially since you pull off the street under the hotel, right at the lobby, hop out and they'll take care of it from there.  We noticed at some other hotels, people had to stop on the street in front of their hotel in busy traffic while exiting and dealing with their vehicle.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast in the hotel was very good, but certainly pricey as most everything is in San Francisco.

review.title: Excellant hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel to stay in San Francisco, and very centrally located

review.title: Budget? hotel in an upmarket location.
review.reviewText:
The good: great location, friendly staff, quiet (courtyard room), sunny, high ceilings, free wifi, windows opened so didn't need noisy air conditioner, hallway walls look to have been recently painted, good water pressure although my wife said that the hot water ran out one morning.
The not so good - worn and soiled hallway carpets (especially soiled near elevators and housekeeping rooms or closets), elevator wood paneled interior banged up, staff is friendly but not always helpful, $53 parking (there $33 parking under the nearby cathedral), dirty windows, soiled bed skirt, damaged bed headboard, bed in our room (844) not comfortable, floor lamp not working, bedroom furniture soiled and worn, lots of dated granite surfaces in the room, asked for six extra pillows and received two, asked for four more pillows and received two, hotel looks to have had a face lift sometime in the late 1990's, tired bathroom fixtures.
My wife stayed here a few times (mostly in the 1980's) when the hotel was elegant and well kept. The hotel is today far from elegant or well kept. Look elsewhere if you want pampering and aren't able to overlook the soiled carpets and worn furniture. This is very much a budget hotel experience in an up market location. If you choose to stay at the Stanford Court but crave a bit of elegance, you can go next door to the Mark Hopkins or to the Fairmont just across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: The good: great location, friendly staff, quiet (courtyard room), sunny, high ceilings, free wifi, windows opened so didn't need noisy air conditioner
review.negativeRemarks: The not so good - worn and soiled hallway carpets (especially soiled near elevators and housekeeping rooms or closets), elevator wood paneled interior
review.locationRemarks: Great location on Nob Hill (read paucity of urban campers). Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square all within walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in chic Nob Hill. Close to cable car line and cable car museum.  Very clean, nice duvet comforter and king size bed.

review.title: Middle of town
review.reviewText: Great hotel, just wish that I would have booked with kayak, or somebody else, for a better rate!
review.positiveRemarks: i had a very large corner room, with a decent view!
review.negativeRemarks: if i say, you just block my opinion again!
review.locationRemarks: Everything is near by for this hotel, if you enjoy walking a little!

review.title: SFO Nob Hill location
review.reviewText: enjoyed SFO - a lot of hills to walk from Nob Hill location - biked across Golden Gate Bridge -good food
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very good - fitness room very nice - elevators fast
review.negativeRemarks: coffee in morning
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill location means a lot of steep hills up and down to walk unless use car or taxi everywhere

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Really pleased to have chosen this hotel, fantastic location right by a trolly stop (although hard to get on as always full up at our stop). Check in ladies were efficient rather than friendly.  Very nice room, great shower, nothing to fault. Great and plentiful breakfast although on the pricey side.  Only complaint was their horrendous parking charges. Valet parking only at the hotel - with taxes $60 per night - as we were there 2 nights we parked the car at another car park just up the road for half the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the ipads dotted around the bar/breakfast area for customer's use.
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce silly car parking charges.
review.locationRemarks: Great location right by a trolly stop but very easy to walk to all the main areas, China Town, Little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf - steep hills though!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Right on the California and Powell cable car lines. Easy access to most places around the city. Cute little neighborhood. Nice, updated hotel. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

review.title: Great location, a little worn
review.reviewText: Excellent Nob Hill location but for a relatively newly remodeled place, it's already looking worn. The standard rooms are quite small and lack charm, but it does the job and appeared to be clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Nob Hill location, friendly and helpful staff. Restaurant food and drinks were great for a hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Furnishings seem cheap. Need wine glasses in room (this is California!) as well as a radio or speaker without having to call front desk.

review.reviewText: The lobby looks very nice, very different from the room. No room service and the corridor smells pretty bad.

review.title: Vaca to San Fran
review.reviewText: Clean, modern, close to everything. Uber'd to the places we couldn't walk to. Bar popcorn was fabulous.

review.title: Nob HIll Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, facilities were all well kept but some stuff was dated; such as the bathrooms and light fixtures.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms need a redo.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill might be a little overrated.  While the views are nice, the Trolleys are way to busy to be usable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, up at the top of a very steep hill, it was a long uphill walk from the BART (esp if lugging suitcases), would recommend taxi from airport or taxi from the BART to the hotel.  Comfy beds, nice rooms, good staff.  All in all a very good area, lots to do, lots of cabs, cable car etc.  Didn't have the hotel breakfast, looked good but expensive. Easy downhill walk to Chinatown, and Union Square. Would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Had a weird smell in the hallways and bathroom.  We played "guess the smell" but couldn't figure it out.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Everything about the stay was pleasing except on two occasions had to make a special request to get room cleaned and serviced. Also the room setup made it difficult to view the TV from the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: More room to hang clothes and more dresser space to put clothes a way. Also the refrig in the room was limited as to what you could put into it.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to many sites but most require a walk up hill to return to hotel.

review.reviewText: Just across the street to Fairmont, the cost is much reasonable.

review.title: DING DING DING DING !!!
review.reviewText: We were sooo amazed by the view our room had. We thought how nice of the hotel to put us in this nice room without trying to upsell it to us like most hotels like to do. Well aparently the nice rooms must be the ones facing the inner courtyard cuz the ones next to the street have to put up with the insanely loud noise from the street trolley till midnite !! No wonder they leave you a couple of earplugs on your nightstand! Not only that but also the hotel happens to be almost on top of a very steep hill. Be in top shape in order to stay there or be ready to spend 5 bucks per person on the trolley to take you back to the hotel... indian train style ! Which means overcrowded n hanging by the side bars. Oh I forgot.. parking costs about 60 bucks a nite n no other place to eat neaby other than another overpriced lil italian restaurant ( likely cuz it's the only restaurant in the area you won't lose a lung trying to get to ). It was an awful experience. 4 nites of no sleep.  This place needs soundproofing windows bad ! Stay somewhere else.
Great location. Superior to property across street for far less money.

review.title: Nice hotel for price
review.reviewText: Lobby is nice but hallways leave something to be desired. Hotel room itself is nice for the price but the bathrooms could use some upgrades. Breakfast is extremely overpriced. You can walk a few blocks and get twice the breakfast at Hollywood Cafe for 1/2 the price.

review.title: 3 days in SF!
review.reviewText:
The room was small (facing inner courtyard), but for 2 small people like us it was ok. The bed was too soft along with the pillows (we only realised we could have call to change the pillow at the end of our stay). We were given a room next to the elevator, and heard lots of noise from people getting in and out of it. 
The internet was fast.
The staff was courteous and helpful with questions. 
The location was good, central to most neighbourhood, safe, but it is to be noted that it is on a uphill street. Hard to get to from powell bart transportation (arriving from airport) by walking. We did walk uphill as we didn't know and were really out of breath. It is better to take the cable up (but it was a long wait since there was a lot of people lining up at the terminus).

review.title: Good location for going to the asst. Tourist areas
review.reviewText:
Good hotel, with friendly staff. The rooms are small, but most things here are ....
Breakfast expensive...56.00 for 2

review.title: great hotel, very nice staff..
review.reviewText: Great experience here. Everyone was friendly and fulfilled our need as needed promptly
review.negativeRemarks: more items in breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Union square, chinatown

review.title: Friendly staff, Great Location, Beautiful Room
review.reviewText: The first thing you realize about Stanford Court is the amazing location. You are right on the trolley line and have an amazing view of the harbor as well as the city. When we checked in Steve made us feel like we made the right decision. He handed us cold water and gave us great restaurant suggestions. The room was clean and had a great view. The bed/pillows were comfortable and we felt like the stay was not long enough!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, romantic views and comfortable bed.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Overall I thought this place was excellent! They upgraded us to a suite and helped us find a great place to eat . The only thing that I was expecting was valet parking was 57 dollars and no free parking
Checked in for 1 night at the hotel for a conference. The bar and food was nice. Rooms were a little dated. Bed was comfortable.
It was a pleasant stay and location was good. They were very accommodating! We enjoyed our time there.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: We were close to everything.  We had a car.  We were in walking distance of Chinatown.

review.title: Great location and wonderful staff!
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is beautiful and staff are wonderful! The room itself was very clean and the bed was soooo comfortable. The only 2 small suggestions I have is the yellow carpet in the hallways could be replaced and the shower curtain could have been replaced. Overall it was a great hotel and we will definitely stay at the Stanford Court again!!

review.title: Very nice will be back again. Close to everything
review.reviewText: Everyone Very friendly and helpful! I will be back loved the location

review.title: Perfect hotel for a downtown SF stay
review.reviewText: Recently needed to stay a few days in San Francisco and wanted to find a reasonably priced hotel around the downtown area. This hotel had a perfect location with easy access to the trolleys and Union Square. If walking, be aware that the hotel is at the top of the hill around California/Powell, so it may be easiest to either wait for a trolley or take a cab/uber/lyft to get to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Very modern, nice decoration, overall pretty trendy.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit of an odd layout with the TV in the double-queen rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Super easy to hit up Union Square or any of the touristy areas around the ferry building and Pier 39.

review.title: Location Location
review.reviewText:
SF is a walking city. From this vantage you can walk to Union Square, Financial, Ferry Bldg, north Beach and China Town. 
Hotel was also quiet. Room was small but comfortable.
This is a great hotel. Perfect location for checking out all the amazing sites. Just bring comfy shoes because there are major hills in the neighborhood.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Centrally located in Nob Hill! The hotel has a very modern feel. Staff was very accommodating and attentive. Any requests were completed in a timely manner. Room was comfortable and clean. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends/family!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with beautiful views of the city.  It was a short stay for us, but very enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to downtown area. Close to fine restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Grace Cathedral is nearby.  The Big 4 restaurant is excellent!

review.title: Great hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Stanford Court for 5 nights.  We arrived early in the morning so very early for check in but our friends room was ready so we could hold our luggage there.  We were celebrating this trip and were given a room with a city/bay view.  The front desk and concierge staff were great to arrange travel and recommend dining choices.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great, in between Union Square and the Wharf.  Staff were friendly and the rooms were in good condition
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet was quite pricey!  Dining out was a better choice
review.locationRemarks: A quick walk downhill to Uniom Square or cable car ride to the Wharf. Cable car lines crossed  at the corner of the hotel which was very convenient.

review.title: In the heart of what's happenig!
review.reviewText: Great hotel with amenities, on transit line and close to what's happening in the city!

review.title: A superb experience
review.reviewText: Traveled with 2 teenaged girls an they loved the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: One woman at the reception area did not have  welcoming attitude
review.locationRemarks: Right near cable car stop, near Union Square.

review.title: One of Best View in City
review.reviewText: Our stay at Stanford Court was perfect for us.  Our stay was only one night.  We were comfortable, treated well and everything was easy and as promised. The entry into the hotel was very easy - an interior court yard to pull into - safe and easy.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location - up on Knob Hill.  The view was spectacular from our room.  The room was great with a very comfortable bed.
review.locationRemarks: The location of this hotel is perfect - you can hop on a cable car or walk to the many sites of San Francisco.  Centrally located - easily go anywhere

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, great location. Nice rooms and yummy breakfast!

review.title: High hopes--Big disappointment.
review.reviewText: We booked the Stanford Court Hotel thru Expedia--a 4 Star rating, good location in San Francisco. Our room was on the 6th floor. Hallway smelled musty and strange. Our room was small but nice at first glance, until we were in it for a while. It was obvious, no one had been up there in a very long time to check out the condition of the room, other than the housekeeping staff to give it a clean once a day, and not a very thorough one at that. There were spots on the carpet, food stains on the seat and dust on the base of the desk chair, the piping around the top-edge of the ottoman was tattered from age and wear, there were fingerprints and stains all over the front of the dresser/credenza/refrigerator unit and there was black (not grey) mildew along the grout on the top of the soap holder in the tub and more mildew in the tile grouting in the shower/tub. Does no one ever inspect those rooms? Then, upon pulling down the duvet, found a small, grey, sticky spot stuck to the bottom sheet.  When housekeeper came up to change the sheet as requested, she had a surly,insulted attitude and challenged me about the spot! Unbelievable! And try to reach the hotel from outside. You get caught in a loop and put on hold until you give up.  Could have been great, but WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE I'VE EVER HAD.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor, at least on the 6th floor. Quality control in the hotel.  Someone needs to look at those rooms and make improvements. Housekeeping staff.
review.locationRemarks: Good.  Trolley car stop right outside.  Nice area.

review.title: Nice hotel perfect location down town SFO
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel for our family vacation down town SFO.  Clean, good staff, close to all main attraction and public transportation.  Perfect for us.
review.locationRemarks: Public transport very close.  Many main attractions at walking distance (1-2 km).

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. Located on Knob Hill it was a great location. Intersection of all three cable car lines to get you too Fisherman Wharf, Financial District and Market Street. The staff was very friendly and helpful with any questions. The room was a bit crowded but very clean and quiet. We had the 'box breakfast' each morning which was enough to get us on our way. I would recommend the Stanford Court to anyone visiting SanFransico.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly the moment we got in and very accommodating.  Check-in was very easy.  When we got into our room, we didn't have a mini fridge to store our water so they brought one up for us right away.  Rooms were very clean, comfortable and a decent size.  The beds were very comfortable.  The place felt like home for the 4 days we stayed there.
review.locationRemarks: The Tonga room across the street at the Fairmont is an interesting place for drinks.  10-15 minute walk down to the Union Square area.

review.title: Nice Hotel on the hill near China Town
review.reviewText: It is a very nice hotel, very close to Chinatown. The rooms are clean, the staff is very friendly. If you want to have an experience of cable car, there is a stop in front of the hotel. Also there is a store very close to the hotel. The only bad experience is walking there is too hard.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very clean, big and we got room with awesome view to the city.
review.locationRemarks: It is 3 blocks away from Union square. Grace Cathedral and Kong Chow Temple are pretty close. And the hotel is located 2-3 blocks away from Chinatown.

review.reviewText: Stayed for a 2 night stopover in SF - good sized room - hotel a couple of blocks up from Union Square and on cable car route.

review.title: what a view
review.reviewText: one of our best hotel experiences...we will be back...frequently
review.positiveRemarks: centrally located...very friendly staff...very comfortable room...great view of bay
review.negativeRemarks: tv picture quality needs improvement
review.locationRemarks: restaurants, stores

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in the Nob Hill area.
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked in with Angela, to our daily quistions for Omar, our stay at the Stanford Court was effortless. The staff excell at meeting your needs. They were able to up grade our room and even on the 4th floor the views were wonderful. I highly recommend youmplan your stay to include the Stanford Court.
review.negativeRemarks: Honestly nothing.
review.locationRemarks: The Stanford court is a close to Union Square and a 5 minute taxi or cable car ride to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: The staff at the Stanford was excellent!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, the staff could not have been more accommodating.  Only thing I would have to say is you must be in good shape to climb the hill to the hotel but a taxi ride is just $10 to the Wharf or the cable car stop is right on the corner.  We loved our stay in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the room, the service.  We especially loved Omar for hooking us up with a rental car for the day and his expertise.  Ed was very great!
review.locationRemarks: We went everywhere, the only down side is the hill you must climb to the hotel but plenty of transportation options available.

review.title: Nice place well located
review.reviewText:
