This is a nice hotel, better than average, but I think it's pricey for what you get.  Wifi everywhere - expected in SF - but parking not included and no complimentary breakfast, only coffee.  The hotel is right at the crossings of two cable car lines so access to them and public transit is excellent.  Union Square is close and the walk to Fisherman's Wharf is just over a kilometer.  easy.

This is a standard hotel, good but nothing extra.  Signs everywhere were posted as if you were reading a text or a posting online, R U getting the hip factor?  No?  L8R.....  How old are we to afford this place?!  One thing that did dampen the stay was the reception and being given an accessible room when we clearly did not need it nor request it.  We asked to have it changed and were told that nothing was available, then told we could upgrade for more.  What?!  The shower head was 5'5"!  Instead of making a fuss, we just went with it.  That was after getting there at 3:15 pm for a 4 pm check in, told to wait in the bar (which was closed) and then not being able to get in until well passed 4.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, cable cars, Fisherman's Wharf, China Town

review.title: A Very Mediocre Hotel
review.reviewText:
Restaurant/bar is closed most of the time even to serve a drink or a light snack. Breakfast buffet is disappointing and ridiculously overpriced for what it offers.
My room was facing the driveway, where apparently garbage trucks were moving containers at random times of the day in addition to a constant stream of people

review.title: Nice old hotel but a little tired
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is a pretty nice older hotel in a good location, near the top of Nob Hill, but it is a little tired and in need of some tender loving care.  The room was quite large and comfortable, but for the price we paid I would expect the carpets to be clean (they were not) and for the bathroom to be mold-free (it was not).
review.positiveRemarks: Generally a nice hotel and in a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is tired and in need of some renos and a good cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: Very central, near Union Square.

review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff are all friendly and helpful.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText:
Hotel was in a good location lovely and clean
Cooked breakfast could be improved on
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast and tea selection in room
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stops right out the front

review.title: Nice hotel well situated
review.reviewText: Helpful staff, friendly, knowledgeable. Good location, near other wonderful hotels.

review.title: Small room, bathroom doors can't lock.
review.reviewText: Claims to be a 4 star hotel, it's more like 3 at best.

review.title: Last minute escape
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for what we needed. Safe environment with tons of great food nearby.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: We had beautiful rooms, very clean and quiet. The staff was so helpful and gave us some great suggestions for local places to eat. The hotel was centrally located and we were able to walk or take the trolley to places of interest. If we go back to San Fran, we would stay there again.

review.title: Great location on Nob Hill.  Rooms very nice.
review.reviewText: Only short coming with room was it was a disabled room which made the shower less than perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: no suggestions other than reserve disabled facilities for disable customers
review.locationRemarks: centrally located with all three cable car lines outside hotel door.  Union Square within walking distance

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Very good location. Expensive breakfast (better options in the neighborhood for same or lower price). 
The bathtub was in bad condition.
Great location.  Nice comfortable rooms.  Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: An SF favorite
review.reviewText: I moved from the Bay Area last year but still visit for work. The Stanford Court offers a good value for the money in a great location with a friendly staff. It is dependable, unpretentious and quirky in a manner that fits SF.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Stayed at the hotel for 5 nights.  Friendly and very helpful staff.  Rooms were great.  Comfy beds.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square!
review.reviewText:
Stayed the weekend in San Fran after work meetings.  Booked Stanford Court due to the reviews on Expedia.  Hotel is located at the top of Knob Hill about 3 blocks from Union Square.  Hotel is older, the carpet in the hallway could be updated.  Overall a pleasant stay located close to Union Square as well as the financial district and China town.  There is a trolley stop across the street from the hotel.  Walking up and down Knob Hill will make your breathless, I wouldn;t recommend the location for anyone older or out-of-shape.  Room was basic, clean, on the smaller side but the hotel was cheaper than most others in San Fran.  
No complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: carpet in hallway, no room service
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Chinatown, Financial District, Trolley stop across the street from hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, staff helpful and friendly
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice, complimentary coffee and juice in the morning was a perk for me, the location is on top a hill therefore coming home if you're walking is always uphil, my family got good exercise everyday we were there.

review.title: Hotel used for Holiday
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very helpful and polite.  The hotel appeared during my stay to be mainly used by business people rather than families.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location in respect to shops and facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel for me requires modernising and appears dated also the cleaning could be better. Our room would be noisy for some due to trolly buses.
review.locationRemarks: Everything you need is near by.

review.title: To high price for this hotel
review.reviewText:
Location is not the best in town.  Room comfort was medium.  Bathroom was ok.  The bed was bad! 
Breakfast was terrible!!!  Was the minimum you can get.  No changes . every morning was the same.  
Tv was also very limited.  The Only Wifi however was good.

Very disappointed with the way our holiday ended.When I had to check out a day early I was informed by staff that the hotel was happy to refund me for the early departure but could only
Be done after a confirmation from Expedia it was ok.
To now be informed that a person named Jeffrey from the hotel has now said no to the refund
After we had left is a very poor showing in customer service and a bad reflection on the hotel's
Administration.
review.negativeRemarks: Be a bit more forgiving in offering a refund for an unexpected earlier checkout by a full day and not offering a refund for that day.

review.title: Okay hotel. Doesn't live up to expectations
review.reviewText:
Small room. Shower head too low. Breakfast very expensive for a low quality buffet. Room noisy. 
Good bed. Great location.

review.title: Great hotel great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very central to everything. Staff are friendly, free bike rental was a positive. Rooms are clean. Overall the hotel is what you would expect for the price.

review.title: Great hotel in Nob Hill!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great.  Staff were super nice, free printer was really helpful, good wifi!  The room was very nice with a view, the only drawback was that the SF trolleys could get a little loud in the morning.  We were in the one room right on the corner so probably not generally an issue

review.title: Good location nice and comfortable
review.reviewText: Service was very good. Room was nice, comfortable and clean
Wonderful hotel in Nob Hill, close to everything. Beautiful rooms and lobby. Valet parking was a plus.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff that were very accomodating and knowledgeable regarding good restaurants and places.  Room was spacious and clean. Only suggestion- put in a small concession stand for snacks!! Only thing open at night is the bar, but a small space for vending machines or a concession stand would enhance the experience.

review.title: 40th Anniversary
review.reviewText: Simply wonderful, from check in to check out!! Have stayed many times here and highly recommend it!!

review.title: Fabulous hotel close to Union Sq and downtown.
review.reviewText: A really nice hotel. I enjoyed my stay. Staff was very friendly and courteous and helpful. I do however wish that they had more choices in the restaurant menu, but the bar and restaurant service was immaculate.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant menu choices
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is very close to union square and downtown financial district. Cable cars take you to Union Sq, Pier 39 and Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: A thumbs up on this one
review.reviewText: I thought I had purchased a package deal which included breakfast and WIFI. On checking in, I was told breakfast wasn't included. I showed my paperwork. They said it had printed out wrong. I'm not sure who is at fault here. I was given three vouchers for breakfast. Better than nothing, but a poor consolation when I expected seven. Other than that glitch, Stanford Court Hotel is a winner all the way round. The staff are friendly and helpful. The premises is clean and well maintained. My room, although not large, was well appointed, and the bed was comfortable. The coffee pot and safe were a nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location in a good area. The tram stops right outside the hotel. The cheapest way to travel is to purchase a 3-day pass at the nearest Walgreens
review.negativeRemarks: At booking, it needs to be made abundantly clear what is and is not included in the room rate.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to restaurants, China Town and Union Square. Ride a tram to Market St. and Fisherman's Wharf. So many things to do in the Bay area.

review.title: Great hotel, but Expedia screwed up
review.reviewText: Great hotel; great location and facilities. Expedia booked me a package, with flight for 3 nights, but only booked 2 nights hotel! EXPENSIVE!

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff, very clean room and close to shopping/restaurants. Easy to catch taxis, the cable car or bus. Valet was a little slow but overall, the staff was very welcoming and the hotel was extremely comfortable!

review.title: Convenient for everything
review.reviewText:
Convenient for everything
Very nice hotel, staff extremely pleasant and helpful.
Would recommend and would return.
Rooms large and clean
review.positiveRemarks: Nice bedding, clean rooms. Clean bright furnishings
review.negativeRemarks: Free breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: Near to everything

review.title: Great hotel, in great location
review.reviewText: Our room was perfect with view to SF downtown. It was facing south. Staff were very helpful and the room was super clean.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The location was perfect, right next to Chinatown. It's on steep hill FYI, a bit of trek back up. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Decor had great vibe, although bathroom wasn't immaculate and needs a facelift. Rusty shower curtain rod.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location.
review.reviewText:
Good trip to a couple. 
Stanford Court good hotel, and very good location.

review.title: Great deal for San Fran...
review.reviewText:
Nice, modern clean hotel, nice music in elevator featuring local artists. Very close to everything - shopping district, Union square, great restaurants and of course the cable cars. Free wi-fi. Concierge was great- got us tickets to Alcatraz even though it was booked out for weeks in advance.
Parking is ridiculously expensive (not just at this hotel)
review.positiveRemarks:
great location
free wi-fi (very hard to find in San Francisco)
hotel was modern and clean 
nice local music in the elevator
review.negativeRemarks:
Parking is very expensive
No room service
Very low pressure in the shower 
check in staff was initially impolite, unwelcoming, but warmed up after
review.locationRemarks: Great location- blocks from Union Square, cable cars and shopping district

review.reviewText: Loved the location of this hotel.  Easy to walk to many sites in the city.

review.title: The hotel was fine, but definitely not 4 star
review.reviewText: Rooms were spacious enough for a city and clean, but outdated, and lacking in lighting and simple conveniences like a towel holder for hand towels near the sink.  The hallways had a strange odor, but luckily that didn't carry into the room.  Location was fairly central, but at the top of a steep hill.  Staff was excellent and helpful.  Overall my stay was fine, but I wouldn't stay there again-- I have been to 3 star properties that were nicer.

review.title: Decent hotel close to cable cars and China Town
review.reviewText: A very decent hotel for the price. The rooms are on the small side but they are clean and the beds are comfy. Breakfast is extra and I was a little sad that they have an older style alarm clock only.  But the staff is very friendly and helpful and I liked the location.

review.title: 4th of July in the City
review.reviewText:
This hotel is centrally located. We stayed in a one bedroom two queen bed room. It worked well for both my wife and my teenage kids.

When we come back, we would definitely stay again.

review.title: Perfect location and wonderful staff!
review.reviewText: Great 4 days at the Stanford, SF.  The hotel food was excellent, friendly staff and the room was great.  Clean and comfortable.

review.title: Top of the hill
review.reviewText: Nice room clean room only problem is the tub wouldn't drain. Maintenance Came the next day to snake the drain

Comfortable bed, deteriorating decor in hallways, overnight stop
for airline personnel.

review.title: Would not stay here again
review.reviewText: The Premier room was supposed to have Queen beds.  They were full size.  The pillows & comforters were dusty.  The pillow top sheets didn't fit properly & wouldn't stay on the mattress.  The cordless phone was temperamental & wasn't charged so we couldn't call down to the front desk or to housekeeping.  One of the huge windows wasn't aligned so there was a large crack where cold air was coming in from the outside.  The warming towel rack light didn't work so you couldn't tell if it was on or off & if it was on, it was burning hot.   The whole room was just disappointing.  This hotel is definitely not worth the price.
review.positiveRemarks: The only good thing was the water pressure
review.negativeRemarks: All the decor needs updated.

review.title: Sale Price on Expedia Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel, located across the street from the Fairmont, was an incredible value at the sale price. We found it spotlessly clean, with a modern vibe and a staff working hard to please their clients. Our deluxe king room on the third floor was small but had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom and dressing area were fine. Only wish there had been a mini bar so we had access to a cold drink or a snack. There is food service in the lobby, but only at certain hours. When we went for ice, the freezer was empty. Other than for a short time late on Sat. evening, the hall was quiet. The only negative thing occurred when I had to extend my stay. The rate I was quoted was double what I had been paying. They were able to negotiate with me and a better rate was secured. It was still higher than what I would normally pay for a hotel but I didn't want to have to seek out a new hotel for 2 nights. I would definitely return to this hotel again at the sale price. I have to compliment the friendliness and caring attitude of the staff. Everyone we encountered was pleasant and willing to help. I would have given it an excellent rating in every category if they had honored my previous rate for the 2 extra nights. I felt the circumstances were unique. I needed to spend extra time making arrangements for a relative in hospice care.

review.title: Nice hotel safe location but ...
review.reviewText:
First the good:

1) Rooms were inviting and, aside from a smelly fridge, quite clean.  
2) The location was safe & at the intersection of multiple trolley lines.
3) Staff was very pleasant.
4) Close to China Town.

Now the bad:

1) The area is totally dead after 6pm & whatever it is you want to see is probably someplace else.  Simply put other than Chinatown & the trolley there is almost nothing else to do within walking distance.
2) Food is crazy expensive in San Fran. & to make matters worse there aren't many non hotel places to eat within walking distance.  We ate at the wharf almost every night.
3) Speaking of eating ... The hotel really shouldn't pretend to serve food .  Three entrees ( including steak?!) isn't a menu.
 
There isn't much the hotel can do about it but, if I had it to do over again, I would find some hotel on the wharf.  That's one of the better places to be in the evenings.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant is hopeless and the carpet really should be changed.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown.  That's really about it & this is the problem.

review.title: Great location on nob hill
review.reviewText: A wonderful 4 day vacation great staff very clean and quiet

review.title: Outstanding hotel, fantastic location!
review.reviewText: Every staff member was very helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable. The hotel is impeccably clean, and comfortable. Valet service, a delicious restaurant, and other amenities are available.   The location is wonderful! Stanford Court is close to shopping, restaurants, and city attractions.  Chinatown, downtown shopping and restaurants are a walk away. A visit to North Beach, the financial district, shopping, restaurants, and Fisherman's Wharf are also easily accessible with the cable cars that pass in front of the hotel. I would gladly return to the Stanford Court again, and recommend it highly!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly, professional, and helpful. The hotel was very clean with comfortable amenities. The location in the city is perfect!
review.negativeRemarks: No improvements needed
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars pass in front that can take you to Lombard Street, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf.  Downtown shopping, restaurants, and Chinatown are near!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We loved the Stanford Court. The location was perfect for catching the cable car in either direction. The beds are feather beds and are very comfortable. Great hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant and bar could open earlier for lunch.
review.locationRemarks: You can catch the cable car to the ferry building, fisherman's wharf, Union square and you are walking distance to Chinatown.

review.title: Great service, no resort fees
review.reviewText: Staff and concierge were very friendly and accommodating.  The TV menu was different to other hotels and when we couldn't find the 'free to air' channels for the news, they immediately contacted the room, apologised, gave instructions on how to access the channels and also gave us a breakfast voucher for the inconvenience.  We aren't one to complain, so to have this type of response to a minor issue gave us confidence in the hotel and made our experience in San Francisco all the more enjoyable and relaxing.  When it came to local attractions etc. (e.g. we'd left our booking for Alcatraz late), they gave us good (& correct) advice on the best way to secure a seat on the ferry.  They really set a solid base to make our trip to San Francisco pleasant and it was much appreciated.
review.positiveRemarks: No resort fee shock (no resort fees at all - wifi was also included free), excellent service.
review.negativeRemarks: Free to air TV channels on the main TV menu, but that's really nit picking!
review.locationRemarks: Located on one of the cable car stops in San Francisco.  All local sites readily accessed via local transport pass highly recommended & cost effective

review.title: Great hotel central to most areas of SF
review.reviewText: Great hotel, the staff kindly put me on the 7th floor at check in so I got amazing views of the city skyline. Ridiculously comfy bed and air con very much appreciated! The maid service were awesome, I was never up very early but no matter what time I went out they always came back and serviced my room, so it was clean and tidy every day. The hotel is right on the cable car line, so it's very easy to zip up and down the hills if you don't fancy the walk. Not far into the main areas of the city, 15 minute walk to Market Street or the Ferry Building  - longer coming back because it's all uphill! But that can't really be avoided anyway you stay and it certainly keeps you fit. Really happy with the hotel and the staff, would recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfy, great wi-fi, good staff, central
review.negativeRemarks: The bath was very shallow - get bigger baths!
review.locationRemarks: Grace cathedral, Top of the Mark, Market street, restaurants, Westfield shopping centre, Ferry building, Lombard St., cable cars, Powell Bart Station

review.title: Horrible Service
review.reviewText:
We rang several times to confirm we had a room with 2 beds, but when we checked in this was not the case.

The manager was never available to take our complaints, we tried 5 times to make contact. We even left messages at the front desk for the manager which were never returned.

One staff member told us "you are lying, this hotel does not have rooms with 2 beds, you did not call" despite on their own website advertising rooms with 2 beds. We requested to speak to the manager but this staff member refused.

Eventually we received a rollaway, which we had to pay for, and was very uncomfortable and made lots of noise from its springs.

This was a horrendous stay. I will not stay here again no matter how desperate I am. You cannot treat your paying customers like this. Would rather stay on the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Fire all the staff, hire a new manager.
review.locationRemarks: Location was central

review.title: It is located close to the downtown, but uphill
review.reviewText: It is located too much uphill. So if you plan to walk a lot, it will take some energy to walk back to the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: There is a cable car going from the downtown to the Fisherman's Wharf and back. It is an easy way to get around. Close distance to the downtown.

review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was fairly central and easy to navigate from. The food at the hotel was subpar and not worth the money. Multiple concierge staff were not helpful with directions, transportation options or restaurant recommendations. The hotel seems poorly managed and the customer service is lacking.
review.negativeRemarks:
Customer Service
Helpfulness and friendliness of the concierge
Food quality

review.title: Stanford Court #Rocks!
review.reviewText: Everything about #Stanford Court was great:  location, location, location; effortless check-in and check-out; sleek lobby with web cam monitors showing real time street action; wonderful room; zip cars; bicycles.  I would stay there again in a minute!

review.title: Good for the weekend
review.reviewText: Clean comfortable room. Great for quick weekend trip

review.title: Beautiful hotel with the perfect location.
review.reviewText: "The hotel staff was friendly throughout our entire 4 day stay.  The hotel room was comfy and clean.  It was great being able to just walk out of our hotel and be right there in the midst of everything important and to be within walking distance or a cable car ride from all the tourist attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: location, price, friendly staff, location, location
review.negativeRemarks: perfect the way it was
review.locationRemarks: number one aspect of our entire stay! Cable car stop was across the street, the hotel was central to everything, and great walking distance

review.title: Worth the hike up the hill!
review.reviewText: The staff could not have been more helpful and kind. The onsite breakfast was good. You can hop on the cable car right outside the hotel. It is quite hilly to walk around. Great experience, only weird thing was the hotel soap products, had an odd fragrance

review.title: Location good
review.reviewText: We thought this property was still a marriott and hoped to receive points for our stay, but staff was pleasant and upgraded us with a very nice suite with a  view of the Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Have stayed several times in past and like location for going to different destinations in the city.
review.negativeRemarks:
Ladies WANT magnifying wall mirrors when traveling and so do men.

Also, miss the wonderful breakfast room.  That is a big reason we booked you.
review.locationRemarks: We bought city passes and used the very efficient public transport system to go all over The city.  Very easy and fun way to see so many places.

review.title: EXCELLENT STAY
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great neighborhood. It was walking distance to Chinatown,Little Italy,Union Square, and it I was very comfortable walking at night. Hotel was clean and very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and knowledgable. Overall my stay was fantastic! !

review.title: Decent downtown stay
review.reviewText: I don't really have any complaints. Check in and check out were easy. Had a nice room. Staff was always super friendly. Ate at the bar once..food was good, but overpriced, as all hotel food and drinks usually are. In a good location in central downtown close to union square and in a safe area. The cable car line runs down Powell right next to the hotel, which is cool. Would stay again.

review.title: Noisy room with no air con and broken phone
review.reviewText:
Our room was very noisy from 6am to 12:30am because of the cable cars.  The phone was broken, so was the shower.  The air con was not on for the first 3 days of our stay.  After the first night, I called the manager on duty, who agreed to switch us to a quieter room if we would just pack up everything before we headed out for the day.  We spent half an hour to pack, but when we got back, our room was not changed.  We were told that if we insisted on moving, it would be to a much smaller room.  

I asked them why they did not tell us about the room size before telling us to pack my stuff.  There was no answer or apology.  Just stalling for another 15 minutes at the front desk. I ended up going back to the same room and spent another half an hour unpacking everything.  Very disappointing service!
review.positiveRemarks: Close to China town and Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitude and communication skills.
review.locationRemarks: China town, Union square

review.title: Nice hotel. Friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText:
Me and my 7month preggo wife spent 4 nights. We had a delux room woth a queen sized bed booked but when we got to the hotel the bed was a full sized and not queen. It was too small for me and my wife. We bought this issue up to the hotel and they were kind enough to switch us to a delux room with a king size bed.
Hotel is clean , and walking distance to all san fran locations. Union sq shooping center... The cable car running to fishersmen dwarf... Pier 39, walking distance to the bart train etc etc etc... Loved it... Thank you Stamford court :-)
It's a really fantastic hotel, next to cable station, easy to get to anywhere. And really good room with excellent cleaning, and all the staffs are great.

It was in the heart of the city!  The staff was very friendly and the rooms were beautiful. The gym had plenty of equipment to get your work out in. The bell guy was super nice. Breakfast served at 6:30am-11am.

review.title: Nice hotel close to city
review.reviewText: Nice but can improve; like having own transport to city hall, airport every 30 minutes or so

review.title: Stanford
review.reviewText: No cleaning of room and then they were very rude when told about this.

review.title: Hotel blocks from Union Square on trolley stop
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, big rooms, clean and superior staff.  Trolley stop is right outside the hotel and Union Square is walking distance.  Nice restaurants in the area.  I would definately stay here again.
great stay. Hop hotel with nice decor and friendly staff. Only complaint is the elevators are slow.

review.title: Not 4 stars at all
review.reviewText: Room was too small for 4 people, beds were uncomfortable, room was not clean, very dusty and stains on the carpet. Staff were nice though
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Located at the top of a steep hill so good to go down hill but bad to get back to, would suggest staying around union square nothing, more to do there

review.title: Beware. No hotel parking.
review.reviewText: Hotel is average and bed was nice. Only turn off for us was no parking. They offered to valet our rental so I let them. My mistake was not asking, but at checkout I discovered parking is 60$ a day! If you consider the 240$ a night plus parking it was overpriced for the facility. Not a bad facility just consider the total cost. Close to cable cars so it's easy but also noisy. Cable cars run until 1am and start back at 6am.

review.title: Good hotel and location; steep hills, no parking
review.reviewText: Overall I had a good experience at this hotel. The lobby and concierge areas are lovely.  The concierge desk was extremely helpful in providing info and discounted tickets on attractions in the area. Upon arriving at the room I found it to be a bit small but it was clean and comfortable. The hotel gym was really nice with machines, treadmills and elypticals, and weight rack.  I only ate breakfast at the hotel once and found it to be rather plain and pricy for what it was. Downsides include that there isn't any good parking around. To park a car at the hotel overnight is $60. I parked 2 blocks away in a church parking lot for $33. The location is good in terms of being nearby to most touristy attractions including walking distance from the Westfield Mall and Union Square. However, the hotel is located at the top of a series of steep hills so it sucks having to walk back.

review.title: San Francisco City break
review.reviewText: I was very pleasantly surprised with the quality of this hotel as there  were mixed reviews. It had been nicely renovated so clean and modern. The location was brilliant convenient for public transport downtown or walking to Union square and even 15 mins walk from the ferry building! Staff were welcoming and helpful but as we were only there 2 days and 3 nights we didn't really get to appreciate the lovely room which had a great bathroom area. Would recommend it!

review.title: Helpful and friendly staff
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived the staff was great- we were able to check in early which was wonderful after a long flight day from the east coast.  Throughout our stay the staff was helpful and friendly
review.positiveRemarks: rooms nice and clean. comfortable bed.  Friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: good information on the airport shuttle from Oakland airport.  I called;was told to catch the shuttle - upon arrival learned needed reservation

review.title: Nice Hotel in a Great Location.
review.reviewText: Been coming to this hotel for over thirty years. Management changes periodically, but the location doesn't change. And it is in an excellent spot, very central in the city. The hotel is well maintained, the staff is nice. Parking is way too expensive, but you can park at the Sutter Stockton garage two blocks away for a lot less money.
Not the Expedia Gold+ hotel I was looking for. I would rate this hotel a 3.5 max.

review.title: Best hotel
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel. Beautiful rooms. The staff was Amazing, helpful and friendly. No complaints. Will come again.
Nice hotel, but a bit expensive for what you get. Way up on top of a huge hill, makes getting downtown difficult. Service + Room is ok. Nice beer selection at bar.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: This was by far one of the nicest hotel for the price and great area!!!!

review.title: It was nice but not Outstanding
review.reviewText: The room was OK fur cramped for a double queen setup. I did not care for the bathroom arrangement as it was a bit cramped. All in all, it was a fair value for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice and the room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: I did not like the breakfast set up. I would prefer a restaurant with table service and more options. I would expect this at a hotel of this quality.

review.title: SMALL ROOMS , very small
review.reviewText: surprised how small the room are,  when to reception for a room change, they show me a room chart and told me I actually have one of the BIGGER room!!!!???? and I can pay for a upgrade? LOL
review.negativeRemarks: a lot, but they cant make the room bigger so nothing can be done,
review.locationRemarks: can walk to just about anywhere interesting in SF, and being on top of the hill, you walk down to everywhere, but don't try to walk back to the hotel,

review.title: Stanford Court Renewal
review.reviewText: Right at the top of Nob Hill, shoulder to shoulder with the Mark Hopkins and the Fairmont at the corner of California and Powell (Cable Cars at the front door).  Nicely refurbished with a friendly staff.  Will stay again.

review.title: Great for business travelers
review.reviewText:
Very helpful and knowledgeable front desk staff

Excellent for working from road -- no charge internet, well appointed and configured lobby and restaurant for working

Unfussy and unpretentious layout and staff

Food options acceptable, but could use more healthy options

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to The Masonic Theater
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Cable car noise may be an issue for others. It wasn't for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown and Fishermans Whrf
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: China Town, Embarcadero, Wharf, Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: My mom and I spent the weekend here on a girls get away.  The hotel staff were very pleasant, and the location near Chinatown and Union Square gave us lots of options within walking distance.  The hotel was very clean.  They have a nice large lobby and restaurant area. Low key and comfortable, you could feel at home working here or having a glass of wine.  The room we had, a king bed, was fairly small but typical for a downtown room.  I felt like the rate I paid was a good value for the room.  Our room didn't get cleaned the day before checkout which was strange, when I called housekeeping they offered to come clean it but I opted for just fresh towels.
review.negativeRemarks: Mini fridge in room is a joke - doesn't get cold.
review.locationRemarks:
Chinatown
Union Square
Trolley runs right in front of hotel

review.reviewText: Wasn't expecting much and was totally surprised. Very cool hotel, everyone there is dressed well but casually so everyone is very approachable. Each person at the checkin desk has an iPad with their favorites in town like places to eat etc. there are iMacs all over the lobby for you to use at any moment. the rooms are nice. You hear everything going on outside but all in all loved this place.

review.title: Four Stars?
review.reviewText: I am puzzled as to how this hotel received a four star rating on Expedia.  The hotel has no room service, no turn down service, limited dining facilities, and the property was run down. There was thick dust on the furniture in my room, and it was not removed during the week I stayed at Stanford Court. The one redeeming quality of my stay was the kindness, courtesy, and helpfulness of the hotel staff. This hotel does not begin to compare with the other four star properties on Nob Hill.

review.title: 1st Time in Beautiful San Francisco
review.reviewText: We Stayed from 4/25 thru 5/2/2015, we had such a fantastic first time here in San Francisco. The staff at the Stanford Court hotel were terrific in advising us where to grab a bite to eat as well as the Concierge helping us with the car rental service. Our hotel room was on the 8 th floor, top floor. Overlooking the beautiful scenery around, it was a bit street noisy , however that was to be expected. Hearing the cable cars coming up and down Powell Street (dingDing) 😄 Hey what do you expect staying in the heart of the city😜. Overall we had a fantastic time, For those visiting and want to travel around without rental car, I would suggest getting the Muni (moony) pass, hop on the cable cars and the transit busses. Totally worth it. Especially with those steep steep hills😳.  Very happy we found this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location location and the terrific staff. Ooh yeah the so very comfortable beds too, surprisingly the beds were very soft and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Keep up the great job
review.locationRemarks: Literally down the street from Chinatown and the union shopping district and the cable cars being right outside this hotel.

review.title: great location in SF, great Staff!
review.reviewText: Best Area in SF and excellent, very helpful staff makes this hotel a great place when visiting the bay Area. The room needed some extra care but is in good condition. The room had an excellent view!.I would definitely consider it again. Location again.. GREAT!

review.title: Courtesy Van
review.reviewText: Would have been nice to have a courtesy van for nearby locations/restaurants.  Taxis not always available and while the walk downhill to many places is okay, the walk uphill back to the hotel would be quite difficult.
review.negativeRemarks: Improved towels and more towels
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Young and Modern
review.reviewText: Staff is friendly. Rooms are comfy and well planned. Easy in and out with off the street motor court under the building. Call for your car, talk to the management...just text your message.
review.positiveRemarks:
Motor court off street makes it easy to valet and check in. Variety of seating arrangement in lobby to relax or have
grab and go breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Near Grace Cathedral and Huntington Park

review.title: Great location; too minimalist
review.reviewText:
Nice impressive cool hotel with excellent rooms, bedding etc.  No room service and no robes and slippers not so nice.  I would recommend a minimalist approach to room service and perhaps a robe/slipper rental.  
Great location and nice views. I like the modern approach to things and the simplicity of most everything.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, rooms are nice, electric outlets, empty fridge for storage, desk, views, friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Add room service, robes, slippers, bigger bathtubs, more modern bathrooms.

review.reviewText: Very nice location, hotel staff was great. I would highly recommend if you don't want to be right in the city

review.title: Prime location!
review.reviewText: Just what we were looking for! I have already recommended to friends! $52 for valet but well worth the peace of mind!

review.title: Nice hotel, very well located
review.reviewText: The hotel is great but the staff is even greater. They were friendly and accomodating.   The check in was very fast so we got our room withing 10 minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: I would offer real upgrade for those who have the VIP card (expedia) but from what I saw, all the rooms were similar.
review.locationRemarks: There's a beautiful Cathedral near by that it is worth seeing.

review.reviewText: Nice view from the hotel on the hill, next to a cable car stop.

review.title: Very central, walking distance to everything
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. The cleaning ladies were very patient with us as we were constantly sleeping in and leaving the room close to midday. I would definitely stay here again as it is very central and walking distance to a lot of places. I like sight seeing and discovering places via walking.

review.title: Not for families more suited for business people.
review.reviewText: Stay was ok but rooms for four are only located internally with views of other internal rooms and car park roof was very disappointing! Dining options are very limited as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much seems as it is catering more for the business traveller.
review.locationRemarks: Not close to most attractions. Need to catch taxi or cable car if you can get on,  it as it is always full!

review.title: Good hotel for staying
review.reviewText: Quick check-in and checkout, room is nice, comfort and clean. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Price is reasonable.

review.title: Great hotel downtown San Francisco.  Good views.
review.reviewText:
Everything at this hotel was excellent.  Stayed in a Penthouse room.   Fantastic views.  
Good internet.  Great breakfast.

When we checked into the hotel, the hotel employee asked us what we were in town for. I told him that it was my boyfriend's birthday and our anniversary and they upgraded our room to a King bed with a gorgeous view of the city free of charge. In addition to that, he gave us some amazing recommendations of places to check out that were all wonderful! Unfortunately the vice president was in town staying across the street, so at one point we were stuck in the hotel for about 20 minutes while they blocked off the street because of him...we weren't allowed to go anywhere. Other than that, this hotel was FANTASTIC!
review.positiveRemarks: Free upgrades, wonderful recommendations for sights and food, and overall great rooms and service.
review.negativeRemarks: Trying to find a way to still let visitors get out of the hotel even if the vice president is in town and the road is closed.
review.locationRemarks: China Town, Little Italy, Cable car stop right outside of hotel, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square

review.title: great location, friendly staff.
review.reviewText:
Super nice staff. I arrived mid morning with my teenage boys expecting to have the hotel hold our belongings until the afternoon check in time.  The staff found a  room that was ready and allowed us to check in early, such a nice surprise. 
Location was great, I will definitely stay here again.
Hotel staff were all very pleasant. Dining was quite good.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, quiet, and very charming - an excellent value.
review.locationRemarks: Away from the hubbub of Union Square; but nearby and in an upscale location.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: 3 night, 4 day trip. Visited 2 college campuses (purpose of our trip) Muir Woods, Pier 39, Bay cruise, and China Town.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located, very clean, and good staff.
review.negativeRemarks: It cost more to park the car than it did to rent it.  A substantial expense not mentioned.
review.locationRemarks: See other comments

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: I just stayed at the Stanford Court for 6 nights.  I had the greatest time visiting San Francisco.  The staff could not have been more friendly.  Steve was a great help to me on many occassions.  He is a great asset to that hotel.  I borrowed a bike and rode over the golden gate bridge to Sausalito and had lunch.  I enjoyed breakfast downstairs in the cafe.  Their breakfast potatoes were really good.  I stayed in the hotel 27 years ago with my parents on my first trip to town and had a great time then as well.  It has gotten better with age.  Thank You!  I will be back.

review.title: nice hotel on the top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: very comfy, clean, staff is super nice. was upgraded to room with a view.
review.positiveRemarks: location, cleanness, upscale look and feel.

review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a great location. It is close to everything and you can (if you don't mind some hills) walk to just about everything there is to do. Or since it is located on the corner of the last to remaining Cable Cars you can just ride them as well. Again great hotel and will be back for sure.

review.title: Perfect hotel for a "girl's getaway" in SF
review.reviewText:
Being able to fly from LA to SF to see a ballet was a dream.  Actually it was a Christmas gift from my 2 daughters.  The Stanford Court was our choice of hotel because it had the amenities we felt we needed -- like 2 queen-sized beds in the room.  Location was also a factor.  The girls had not been to San Francisco since they were children, and were interested in retracing fading memories.  We rode cable cars, visited the wharf, Ghirardelli Square, the Ferry Building, and shopped Macy's in Union Square.  (The shoe selection puts all of LA to shame!)

Back in the hotel we were all grateful for the comfort of the room.  The chairs were perfect for reading and chatting, the beds were comfortable, and there was plenty of room (as well as plelnty of hangers in the closet) for our luggage.

We appreciated being able to take BART to and from the airport and able to use UBER when we needed to get from one destination to another.  A great dinner, a fabulous ballet at the War Memorial Opera House, and a charming afternoon tea all added to the perfect week end.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfort of the room, the location, the hotel staff -- all made our stay most pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Ride the cable cars, visit the wharf, visit the Ferry Building, have a sundae in Ghirardelli Square, have a great dinner at Frascati's on Russian Hill

review.title: great hotel in central location with very helpful
review.reviewText: it was great!.. wonderful location and clean rooms

review.title: comfortable bed , disorganized staff
review.reviewText:
We got there near mid-night. There was no valet, no staff at the entrance.  There was no indication where I should leave my car either. I had to go in and ask the staff. Check in took longer than expected. The staff kept getting me to sign with a pen that has no ink. 
I thought I paid extra for a room with a view, but got a room  facing inside the courtyard. Perhaps other guests' window count as 'view'.  I was too tired to call and ask. But with the price I pay and the view I got, I won't be going back. 
The one good thing is the bed. Very comfortable . 
Tried to check out in the room using TV, didn't work. Had to go down and wait in line. Txt to valet for car retieval worked . All in all, i wouldn't want to go back. Nor would I recommend it to others.

review.title: Not what it used to be
review.reviewText:
Sagging mattress about 4 inches thick.  Dirty baseboards. 
Nice view and fast valet response.  Neighborhood good and relatively safe.
Worst part - the mattress.

review.title: Nice Nob Hill hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at Stanford Court for my birthday and had a wonderful time.  Fortunately, our room overlooked Pine Street so we had a great view of the city lights in the evening.  My sister's room overlooked the "court" so she had  no view at all except that of the other rooms in the court area.  Those rooms were also a little smaller.  Otherwise, we enjoyed staying one block from where we were dining so we could walk to dinner and back and felt safe in the neighborhood.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Nob Hill restaurants, view of the city lights.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was really warm when we arrived and it took quite a while for it to cool down.  Also, we were surprised there was no fan in the bathroom!
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill, close to restaurants in the Fairmont Hotel

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient to restaurants on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Loved the location, wasn't thrilled about our room that overlooked the "dome" which we think could be a beautiful and actual court.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant and bar could be open a little earlier.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to the Fairmont Hotel restaurants

review.reviewText: We asked if a free upgrade was available.  Our large king was upgraded to a king suite with a view of the city!

review.title: Great spot other than cable car noise
review.reviewText:
We booked on expedia for my first stay. The front desk person put us in the room that was absolutely the farthest room from the lifts. The view was nice, but it had trolleys running right below. Double pane windows were not in evidence so big noise until mid night. Double bed, not the queen specified. 
Staff was friendly, but disappointing.

review.title: Nice hotel. Loud cable car
review.reviewText: All good by the cable car out the window. San Frqncisco treat, I guess

review.title: Perfect stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to everything. Walking distance (around 5-15 minutes) to chinatown, financial district and the shopping malls in market st. The stop for the trolleys are close to the hotel too.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the heated towel rack, the plug in socket on the headboards.
review.negativeRemarks: better noise insulation

review.reviewText: Great location. It is close to Union Square, and China Town. Room is clean and well appointed.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is right at the intersection where the two trolley lines cross.  Perfect for sightseers like us!  The room was comfortable and quiet.  The hotel staff was fantastic - very friendlyand helpful.  I know it's a minor thing, but the hotel plays the best music in public areas!

review.title: Great hotel with excellent location.
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing... friendly, helpful and so personable.  The accommodations were excellent.  The room, the dining, the bar and once again kudos to the staff.  Both cable cars right outside gave us access to so much.  We felt this was the perfect place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Not one thing.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to Nob Hill and great restaurants.  The easy access to cable cars allowed us to venture out so easy.

review.title: Great customer service
review.reviewText:
Excellent customer service.  The staff was very helpful, courteous and professional. 

We were given an upgrade at no extra cost

review.title: Great service, great hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed here with my boyfriend in March and the hotel staff were pleasant, professional, and friendly. I like the way the room is set up--different than anything I'd seen before, with the bathroom separated out of view from the bed area.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable bed (couldn't even begin to describe how well we slept), great service!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing--yes, it's at the top of a HUGE hill, but I like the exercise and love the view!
review.locationRemarks:
Close to Chinatown, Union Square, everything!
We walked from the hotel to Pier 39 and to Mission District (both of which are slightly farther walks)

review.title: Very nice place!
review.reviewText: Hotel was a last minute choice. I have stayed in many hotels in the city and this was more than I could have asked for. Great staff, clean hotel and perfect location. This hotel made me feel more classy than I ever could be. I will be back!!

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The room was very clean, comfy beds, and quiet. The parking is expensive in general in SF so I had to pay 59$ for it (hotel's valet, no self park in the facility), fast internet connection, very close to Union Square, China Town and Little Italy. Restrooms sliding doors are smart if you want privacy (2 doors: one for closet and one for the toilet.
Staff is excellent. Hotel is beautiful. My wife and I could not have picked a better place.

review.title: Okay Stay for Nob Hill
review.reviewText: If you choose to stay on Nob Hill in San Francisco, the convenience of the cable car lines right outside the door of the Stanford Court is a plus.  The hotel decor in the lobby is modern; but the room decor is a bit lacking.  Our room was so dark; a lamp near the beds would've helped tremendously.  Room cleanliness was lacking.  The pocket door to the toilet/tub area was disgusting with splatters (I don't even want to know), so it didn't seem that housekeeping was overly meticulous.  One day, housekeeping left us with only a tiny bit of toilet paper (I had to steal a roll from the housekeeping cart); another day, housekeeping didn't clean the room at all.  Returning late in the evening to unmade beds, trash remaining in the cans, and barely enough towels for the night did NOT make us happy.  Check-in felt a bit disorganized, as well.  Granted, we arrived early for check-in (1:00 or so), but the attendant at the desk said we could check into a room.  Unfortunately, she took so long (perhaps computers aren't her thing?) that another couple arrived at the desk to check-in and went up to their room.  That same couple passed us still at the counter as they left to go explore the city.  Then we were told that no rooms were available.  That required checking our luggage, of course.  Very frustrating for a first impression, to say the least.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience of location to the cable car line, in a part of SF that isn't overly touristy.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness; better attention by housekeeping; staff at the lobby desk that are comfortable/quick with technology
review.locationRemarks: Grace Cathedral is a short walk from the hotel; Thursday afternoons you can catch the free "evensong" performance of the choir, which is beautiful!

review.reviewText: Nice hotel,  comfy bedroom, quiet, but a little disappointed some of the hotel's staff are rude!
Glad I stayed there, room is always clean, staff is nice.

review.title: Disappointed in room quality
review.reviewText: No Mini Bar or room service available and meant to be a 4 star hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Offer Room Service and Mini Bar facilities

review.title: Very nice hotel close to everything in San Fran!
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome! The beds were really comfortable and clean. The shower and everything was on point. We stayed on the first level, there was not a lot of noise from the carts! Overall really awesome! I would recommend getting a 3 day pass for the cart so if you decide to go down the hill you can come up as many times!

review.title: Nice hotel good location
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at the Stanford Court hotel. Staff were very friendly, upgraded our room on arrival and moved us quickly when we had an issue with our window. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: We had a great stay and the room was comfortable, clean and spacious. Very friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The only downside was the 'included' breakfast. For two people we were given a voucher for two cold items (I.e. Pastry, muffin) and one drink. One dri
review.locationRemarks: Nob hill is supposed to be a nice area but when we visited we did not feel safe walking around.

review.reviewText:
This is a first class hotel.  All amenities are available and we found the entire staff to be efficient and always ready to be of service.  We had no problems.  We were allowed to check in early     
  (before noon), were given a room upgrade and received excellent advice from all the concierges every time we asked.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything except the steep hills we had to climb if we wanted to walk.  However, there is a cable car stop near thee hotel and taxis are reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to union square, Chinatown and many other places of interest.  There are many eating places nearby.

review.reviewText: The hotel was close to union square but not right in the middle of all the tourist noise. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful.

review.title: Really nice place to stay and Ina very safe area.
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of China Town, North Beach, Coit Tower, the Cathedral!  Or you can hop on the Trolley which is literally outside the door. Rooms were small but ample room for two and the room was really quiet too :-). Great night sleep!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything except cost of parking seemed high to me but may be standard for the City.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower cost parking :-)

review.title: Do not stay here.
review.reviewText: The bed was awful. Little bumps everywhere, stains and holes on sheets.

review.title: Great hotel and close to public transportation.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. If you are driving, car parking is a lot at $57 per day. Close to a lot of great areas. Staff are amazing and rooms big and very well appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Cozy room, modern styling, really nice staff
review.reviewText: Review Title says it all. Hotel deserves a 5 star rating. Great for business or leisure. Complimentary business services a plus. Lobby area seating is great for work or relaxation. Could be a plus or low for you but be prepared to walk up hills if you want to roam the area. Close to financial district embarcadero and other attractions in SF but could be difficult after a big meal at one of the many places to eat! Uber, Lyft and trolly services are your best friends. Feel free to use my code for a free ride on UBER or LYFT! Just download the apps on your smart phone. For UBER - karenb129. For LYFT - KAREN2686.

review.title: Location, comfort, good value (but not cheap)
review.reviewText: Right downtown close to attractions - meaning on the hills , but with cable cars going every direction and a 3 day MUNI pass, no worries if your knees can't take the climb. If you're sensitive to cable car noise, get a room higher up. I am on the more sensitive side, but found 7th floor to be nice & quiet. The room AC fan can be loud, but in January I needed neither heating nor or cooling. Staff outrageously friendly and helpful, hotel quite beautiful and well kept. Not cheap, but at least you get your money's worth. Wifi a bit weak on the 7th floor, but good enough for most necessities.

review.title: Great hotel close to all the sights!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, rooms are a good size and the price is right.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprise with this hotel. The location was great although walking up the hill is tough but it allows for fabulous views from your room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.
review.positiveRemarks: nice location but the overall feel of the hotel is comfortable and warm
review.locationRemarks: easy walk to Chinatown, Union Square and the cable cars are right outside the doors

review.title: Nob Hill Hotel
review.reviewText: Located next to the Fairmont and Mark Hopkins, this is a smaller hotel on Nob Hill.  It doesn't have all the luxury or amenities of its neighbors, but staff was very courteous and friendly, and the room was nice, clean and with a very comfy bed.  Our 3rd floor room had a view of the neighboring roof and AC units- apparently, this was the "class" of room we were allotted.  All in all, a pleasant stay at a argain rate.

Hotel is nice and the staff is great - location is good but parking is ridiculous (lucky didn't bring my car). The rooms are pretty spacious and clean but the pillows were lacking and therefore my sleep wasn't the best. It also lacks a real fridge (has a small beverage holding type fridge) and any real closet space (though there is hanging room in the bathroom that's partitioned off). Overall, good stay!

review.title: Noisy Cable car
review.reviewText: When check-in make sure you ask if they have a room that's away from the cable car or ask for a higher floor to keep the cable car noise to a minimum.
review.negativeRemarks: Free breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: 5-star treatment w/out the 5-star price. I would highly recommend staying here.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We got upgraded to a nice room with City View at check in.  Hotel staff are very nice as they are always there to open door for you and greet with a warm smile.  The hotel is in nice location that you can walk to nice restaurant.  We will come back.

review.title: Modern and Classy
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for two nights for a fun city trip.   We parked at the Grace Cathedral parking garage, it is a better deal than the one closer to the hotel at the Mark Hopkins.  The hotel felt very clean, safe, and easy to get around.  The style of the hotel is modern and classy, with a bit of a younger vibe.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff we interacted with were great.  The room was cozy, clean and very nicely decorated.
review.negativeRemarks: We had to ask for extra pillows, the downs ones were too squishy/flat, and the others were huge, square and hard! But with two down ones, it was fine.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is beautiful!  We walked to Chinatown, and North Beach. Grace Cathedral is right across the square, and you can see all around the city.

review.reviewText: Great location, close to China town, the bay, and all. Walking distance to pier 39 and many sightseeing landmarks. Very friendly staff. House town car to airport was equally priced as a taxi but more relaxed and convenient.

review.title: Terrific location
review.reviewText: Good, Good, Good, Good, Good, Good, Good, I have other things to do...
review.negativeRemarks: i don't know
review.locationRemarks: are you kidding, it's Nob Hill..

review.title: Good location, somewhat tired
review.reviewText: Historically -- this was a great place to stay.   I found it to be very inconsistent on this stay -- maid service did room differently each day, turn down came once out of 4 days, TV didn't work one day, elevator skipped my floor 20% of the time, no room service option etc.   In the big picture -- these are just annoyances -- but expect more from this place/price.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The room, staff, and amenities were very nice. We would definitely stay there again.  The bar drink prices are a little steep, but that's expected at a nice hotel.

review.title: Absolutely gorgeous!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for our one year wedding anniversary. It was a great location. We walked everywhere . Everyone was very friendly. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: I had an awesome experience staying here recently for a week. Our room had a wonderful view and we really enjoyed the rooms comfort and warmly vibe. The position is great (although at the top of a steep hill) which i must admit i paid $5 to get a cab up once or twice!! The hotel staff were so lovely and helped our friends get  Christmas hamper delivered to us so that our christmas spent away from family and friends was a little bit sweeter. All in all i would definitely recommend this is hotel to anyone!
Best hotel thats got the cable car running in front of it which makes it easy to get around town. Staff waa very nice n helpful too. Would love to revisit again next time.

review.title: Good Stay Overall
review.reviewText: We stayed I this hotel for four nights. Room was nice and clean. No outside noise, but guests next door were very loud for two nights interrupting our sleep. We even had to call a front desk to stop the "party".  They did react quickly and we were able to rest through the night. Next night was a similar scenario, same room was very loud. The biggest issue was that door connecting two rooms and allowing noise to escape. Not every hotel has this problem. Bathroom was fine, however shower fixture could have been better and placed a little higher. My husband 6'2" tall could not shower standing strait up but needed to bend over to wash his hair. I don't recall having such an issue before. Nice hotel overall though.

review.title: Amazing Location, Wonderful People, Beautiful Room
review.reviewText: This hotel is located at the cross roads for the two trolley lines so it is perfectly located. On arrival the baggage is all taken care of with no fuss and checkin is a breeze. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful offering some great tips on where to get great food and how to purchase a 3 day public transport pass ($26 great value). All this information is handed over during checkin whilst the staff member is organising keys etc. so it feels like checkin takes no time at all. The room was stunning. Huge and with a great outlook. The bathroom /dressing room was also large. The bed was super comfortable, very important after a big day of wandering the hills of San Francisco. The room and hotel in general are very clean. Loved staying here and would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.
review.positiveRemarks:
Everything.
- great checkin (staff member who checked me in was bang on perfect at his job)
- great room
- clean
- hotel location
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe some basic room service...good coffee etc.
review.locationRemarks: At the cross roads of trolley cars so easy to get to all key attractions. Short, one block, walk to catch buses to other areas.

review.reviewText: This is my second time at the hotel when in SF on business.  I went back and will continue to come back becuase the rooms are quiet (be sure to ask for a quiet one because of the proximity to the cable cars) and clean and the beds are super comfortable.

review.title: Great hote. Great people.
review.reviewText: It worked well for out stay. Conveniently located in the perfect area.

review.title: Nice hotel. Not as pricey as others in the area.
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and business like. The rooms were a bit cold for me but I like hot weather!
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the cleanliness and the hotel staff
review.negativeRemarks: There isn't any in house restaurant other than a small breakfast area. Staying in was not an option. But The Mark & Fairmont were nearby
review.locationRemarks: If you don't mind walking you have access to all of downtown San Francisco!!

review.title: Great hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: I agree with others that it is very well located. The cable cars going by all night was not a problem for us. It wasn't that loud or as bad as others describe. We were given a handicap room although none of us were handicap and the employee who gave us the room during registration said the only difference was that it didn't have a bath tub but it was much more spacious. Well, with four people in the room it was still very spacious but the restroom pretty much had no door. it was really embarrassing to even go to the restroom cause everyone can hear the business you were handling in there!! It was really funny and annoying at the same time. I wouldn't stay in a room like that again even if it's more spacious. However the hotel itself is very nice and modern. The lobby is definitely a comfortable space to hang out after a long day of walking and doing tourist stuff. Over good experience.

review.title: New years eve
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and excellent staff however the only downside is that they have no restaurant and no room service which I found surprising for the knob hill location and room rate. Besides this I highly recommend this hotel

review.title: Great location, quiet, easy walking to sights
review.reviewText: Modern hotel within historic exterior. Beautiful room with contemporary decor. Within walking distance of Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach. Elevators a little slow to arrive around check in time. Overall a very enjoyable experience.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was top notch! The elevators were VERY slow, when they were working! They were not working for two days! We were told to use the service elevators and the staff was more than accommodating and went out of their way to apologize for the inconvenience. However, I am disappointed that it took so long to fix them! Eight floors of people using one (the other wasn't working) service elevator made for some long waits in a kitchen area! The room was big and very nice. The housekeeping staff was also very prompt and friendly. The parking valets were very nice and getting a taxi or directions was super easy! They were my favorite people to deal with during my stay! I would recommend the hotel again, however, with the provision that the elevators are very slow.
review.positiveRemarks: The parking valets and the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators!
review.locationRemarks: The location was great, close to shopping and dining. The hill is VERY steep, but the exercise was great!

review.title: PARKING IS $52!!!! For actual guest!!!! Horrible
review.reviewText: Horrible!!!! Parking for guest are $52!!???? I couldnt cancel because they wouldn't return my money. I had to park by the church 2 blocks away!!!!!?????? And rooms are horribly small!!! Dont stay here!!!

review.title:
Great hotel 
Charmless
review.reviewText:
Broken elevators
Mediocre staff
Great location 
No services to speak of

review.title: Nice comfortable
review.reviewText: Everything is great but breakfast was very slow and gettin car was slow

review.title: Top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Great location, but you better be able to walk downhill and uphill (to/from Chinatown and Union Square)--very steep.  Good price compared to others on Nob Hill.  Elevators were not working one day (had to use freight elevators) and the car valet messed up on instructions.  Quiet, clean.  Near upscale restaurants and bars. Parking is expensive
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators were not working--not good for a classy hotel on Nob Hill.  It would be nice if a frig was standard (though you can request a complimentary.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill hotels, restaurants.  Chinatown and  Union Square within walking distance.

review.title: Not impressed at all !
review.reviewText:
It boasts of technologically advanced amenities ? What ??? 
An iPod Dock in the room and a heated towel rail ? Great never seen that before ! 
The shower ran slow the first night so standing in pool of soapy water after shower. 
$60 valet parking pretty excessive really even for San Fran ! 
Elevators very slow seemed like there was only one out of three working at any one time ! 
Basically nothing special, which is fine except for when they claim otherwise and charge for it. That is not cool !! 
I have to say too that in 2014 I would think they could figure out a better system or deal with the phone companies so that when someone's cell dies and you HAVE to make a call to someone you don't get charged $5 each connection just to get to voicemail ! 
Plenty of hotels have free local calls! 
Of course I should have checked but didn't think I had to these days,
Just shrugged off like it's a given by the clerk that I would be charged $10 for trying to call a local number, 
Anyway cleanliness and all that was fine just think they could do better if they are going to boast about how cool they are,

review.title: bed bugs
review.reviewText: my original review was rejected by expedia.  i wonder why?

review.title: Nice hotel with friendly staffs
review.reviewText:
Conveniently located, nice little hotel with friendly staffs.  Booked a studio suite for 2 adults and 2 children, upon check-in, was told that the beds were double beds and the hotel does not have roll-away beds to accommodate.  Had to give up room with a view to another facing walls.

Valet parking was pretty expensive, around $65/ day with tax... plus tips every time you pick-up and drop off your vehicle... after 4 nights, had to fork out an additional $300 for parking/valet.

Overall stay was very pleasant.  Friendly staffs, clean facility.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable room with friendly staffs.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to China Town, Union Square.  Take the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf right across the street - very conveniently located.

review.title: Beautiful place
review.reviewText: My only complaint is there was really no bar open or food service other than breakfast I had to pay for. The staff was so accomodating friendly and very very helpful!!!
Hotel was fine I'd say definitely eat of site. Our room was a deluxe 2 bdrm suite. I enjoyed the view

review.title: Nice hotel , nice location
review.reviewText: Overall, very good. The food was very good. Hotel room was clean.

Great hotel! Amazing city view. The hotel was excellent and in the heart of San Francisco, everything was close by. The only downfall was parking, only vallet was available for $52 a night. Other than that I had an awesome time.

review.title: Beautiful place
review.reviewText: Nice rooms staff was so friendly. Great area. My only complaint is no food service. Bar only open at wierd times? Had to go elsewhere for drinks and food.

review.title: Great location, HATE not having hot water.
review.reviewText: Great Nob Hill setting, clean enough although small room.  Pet peeve is not enough hot water and my peeve was definitely petted.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot WTer

review.title: Great hotel in the city
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was amazing. It's in the heart of the city, everything was so close. I was very pleased with our room and all it's amenities. Plus side to our room was the amazing city view. The only downfall to the hotel is parking. There is no parking in the hotel, valet is available for $52 a night. Parking on the street was relatively easy considering we were in the city.

Nice hotel. Rooms are small, but it is expected for being right in the middle of the city. Very clean but old. The carpet has seen better decades but you can tell that there is great effort towards keeping the hotel clean and comfortable.  And you can't beat the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet is very dated.
review.locationRemarks: It was all work.

review.reviewText: Apart from the light switch not working when I first arrived it was good

review.title: Enjoyable Stay!
review.reviewText: My sister-in-law and I stayed here and found it to be clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything, at the moment . . .
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants are nearby and very accessible!

review.reviewText: Didn't feel it was worth the cost. Ice maker on only the first floor and no room service in the hotel. Waited 45 minutes to get a razor brought to my room and finally came after I had already gone down and got my own. They did give me a $25 credit at the resturaunts for the hassle but when I used it the gentleman only took $15 from my bill even after me questioning.

review.title: great value and location
review.reviewText: If you are a light sleeper ask for a courtyard room. Great place. Would highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: location, very clean, helpful and happy staff. Complimentary bicycles !
review.negativeRemarks: street noise. They would benefit by offering some sound reduction sleep devices for the rooms facing the streets
review.locationRemarks: everything was incredibly close by; walk to union square, embarcadero, chinatown etc

review.title: Bring your Own Food!
review.reviewText: Staff was a excellent. Todd at the front desk was exceptional. All other staff was very friendly and courteous. The room was large, comfortable and quiet plus we had a nice view from the 7th floor. On the downside, elevators were slow and some not working at all. There is no room service. Breakfast downstairs is mediocre and expensive. The bar doesn't open until 5. There are no food vending machines but there is a store across the street that stays open fairly late. Given all the choices in the area, we probably would stay at a different hotel next time.
Cool hotel. Super friendly. Convenient for working.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee availability 24 hrs and healthy snacks 24 hrs
review.locationRemarks: Convenient in the middle of everything.

review.title: Great hotel if you're up for the climb!!
review.reviewText:
The Stanford Court is a great hotel up on Nob Hill, very close to union square.  By very close I mean 4 (very) uphill blocks).  The hotel itself is REALLY nice.  The only complaints I would have is that the rooms are quite small.  They are just as luxurious as most other hotels, and I imagine the reason they're more fairly priced is cause of the size and location.  

If you're up for the hike, walking up to nob hill is fun! but be prepared to take a quick shower once you get back to your room!

Overall, I loved staying here and would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the cleanliness and how friendly the reception was.  I was able to easily call a cab with the help of the front area attendant.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if there was breakfast included for the guests staying at the hotel. They're cheaper than other hotels, but not THAT cheap!
review.locationRemarks: The location is about 4 (downhill) blocks away from union square, near market street.  There is everything nearby, if you're up for the hike.

review.title: On the crossroad of Powell/California trolley
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the various staff, it was a very good experience. At the front desk, Girly (yes, her name) upgraded our room to a better view. It was fantastic to look out from the bed and see the bay and the Transamerica tower.  The room was clean, comfortable and quiet (except the trolley bells - which we loved). A dinner recommendation and reservation by Shon at the front desk led us to Tyler Florence's Wayfarer Tavern for a delicious dinner. The morning breakfast staff were friendly and helpful and the selections delicious (who can resist Nutella crepes and Denver omelets? The bellmen were great about holding our luggage, calling for cabs and making our airport shuttle reservation. The location is great, with Top of the Mark next door for drinks and a view, and the Fairmount the other side with the giant Gingerbread House to admire. The trolleys in any direction outside the front door with access to anywhere in the city. If you stay in SF for more 3 days or more, get the CityPass, with unlimited Muni rides on trolley, bus and entry to various museums and fun.
review.negativeRemarks: A hotel shuttle to and from the airport would be nice, but access and cost of the regular shuttles was not terrible.
review.locationRemarks: Location at the crossroad of Powell and California trolley lines. Easy even to walk downhill to Chinatown or downhill to Union Square.

review.title: Very nice and elegant
review.reviewText:
Considering where the hotel is, it is surprising to find it so nice in this densily populated city. If course, there are a few hotels in the block and in the area that are nice too, but chose this one, and am happy with it. 

One nice touch is how soft and supple the pillows and blankets are. I've been to some that had really cheap pillows and blankets that are a real turn-off. It was just really comfy and fluffy and light!

review.title: Great Location
