review.reviewText: Convenient location. Hop on either cable car outside the door.
review.negativeRemarks: Room needed more piazza. Not that attractive.
review.locationRemarks: Good restuarants in every direction just a short cable car ride from Hotel

review.title: Exceptional staff, comfortable & amazing location
review.reviewText: The staff was exceptionally friendly, the location was perfect right on top of nob hill, and the room was extremely comfortable and clean.  I have not had a nights sleep that good in a long time.  The views from the room were beautiful too.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill, beautiful location close to everything.  The trolly also runs by right out front, so you can easily hop on.

review.title: Great hotel but up the hill!!
review.reviewText: It was a very nice and comfortable hotel. The room was a good size, staff was very accommodating. The only down side to this hotel is that it's on top of 3 steep hills which was horrible to walk up several times a day. There is however a cable car that runs up and down but the wait for these cars can b much longer then just walking. It's $6 per ride or u can get a all day pass for $15. It was a serious workout walking up and down those hold!
A very pleasant stay.  The room was comfortable and quiet, the bed very comfortable, and the wifi fast.  I would stay again.
review.locationRemarks: On Nob Hill between at the intersection of California and Powell which both happen to have cable car lines on them.

review.reviewText: It is a very nice and cozy hotel. Staff is really courteous, they make you feel like in home.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Extremely clean and the most comfortable bed ever.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Centrally located, this sleek hotel is awesome for a nice city stay. Literally on the corner of two major cable car lines, and just steps away from bus routes, you can get anywhere in San Francisco quickly. The rooms are comfy, the service is top-notch. A little lacking in the food section, only limited to a few expensive things, and there's no room service. I do recommend it though, we're glad we stayed here!
Great location. Towel racks would be nice near the sink. Friendly, helpful staff.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Right on the cable car route and near great restaurants. Nice clean and comfortable rooms. Only complaint was the bar and dining facilities not enough staffing and the staff that was there were not helpful. Couldn't get anyone to serve drinks or dinner. Finally had to walk to the Mark Hopkins for drinks and dinner.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This was our first visit to San Francisco and we needed a location close to most attractions and sites of interest at a reasonable price - updated and clean. After cruising the reviews from many sites, we settled on Stanford Court and the choice didn't disappoint. The staff was friendly and very helpful, and the hotel and room was clean. We arrived early and fortunately a couple rooms were available. We were given a choice between a room without a view and one with a view, but with street noise. We took the room without a view - fine with us because it was quiet. Couple minor issues: limited space to unpack and store clothes (we had a King room and stayed 5 nights), pillows were as hard as a rock (changed out next day),  1 choice for coffee - no other options, and the TV was mostly analog with some digital, no HD.
review.positiveRemarks: Great centralized location to major attractions via trolley, Uber, or dare I say, walking the steep hills. Very friendly staff - made us feel welcome.
review.negativeRemarks: More in-room coffee choices and better TV reception.
review.locationRemarks: Central location. Really close to China Town and a brisk down hill walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Trolley's across the street. Tour buses recommended.

review.reviewText: It was nice. Always is. Good value on Nob Hill. We stayed in a regular room, facing the street. Ding Ding of the trollies is a bit much for people from out of town, but it's part of the experience.

review.title: A great hotel in a great city.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay in the Stanford Court. Concierge gave us some good tips on restaurants.  This hotel is very close to everything.

The hotel seemed fine if you were there for business and dressed nice. My boyfriend and I are in our 20s and dressed casual and that made us feel unwelcome. The bartender did not give us good service even though no one else was at the bar. If I'm paying 15 dollars for 2 beers I at least expect a "how are you?" We would not stay again. The valet and outside staff was extremely friendly and welcoming.

review.title: Very nice hotel. Very centrally located
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  Very comfortable beds. Noise level from the street was kind of bad but other than that everything was great. Michael at the front desk when we checked in was excellent. Will definitely stay there again

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Overall experience is great! Free high speed wifi covers both lobby and guest rooms.

review.title: Wonderful weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Three excellent nights of luxury.  Very polite and helpful staff.  Great room overlooking California Street.  We will come bach to the Stanford Court whenever we're in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff were VERY helpful but I was not impressed by the new 'informal' dress style.   'Expected a black jacket with crossed keys of the profession.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect of the Order of St. John Investiture weekend.

review.title: Very good value for ur money
review.reviewText: Exceedingly comfy bed, clean room, very adequate gym, friendly staff, central location. Keeping in mind this is the City, u can't do much better than this within the 209-300 dollar price range. Book it I say !
Nice location and nice, clean lobby and rooms. Expensive to park you car, though.
only real drawback is that the hotel is at the top of a steep hill which by the end of 4 days became quite tiring!

review.title: Last minute find.
review.reviewText: Found this place a few days before arriving. Great deal for the location and walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown.  Accommodations were excellent and friendly, professional staff.

review.title: The Centre Of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed in San Fran for 6 nights and we picked the perfect spot to stay. This hotel was right in the heart of Nob Hill and the best place to catch the cable cars in all directions. We left the car in parking for the 6 nights it was that good. We had a hiccup at the start with Concierge and Alcatraz, but the manager quickly sorted that out and everyone was happy again. The hotel is looking a bit dated inside, but overall was very clean and confortable. Be aware though that parking in San Fran is expensive and should be calculated into your budget before hand. PLenty do to, see and eat and all easily accessible from this Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Central Location, Very Comfortable Room and Bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: the interior is looking a bit dated, but really, who cares when your on holidays. Ice Machines on each floor would be a great improvement
review.locationRemarks: The Big Bus Tour, The Golden Gate Bridge, Coit Tower, Japanese Gardens, China Town, The Exploratorium, Pier 39, Union Square, Cable Car Museum

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Staff were excellent. Always very helpful and going the extra mile.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff were both great.

review.title: Good hotel, well located.
review.reviewText: Pleasing hotel, well located, standard rooms not that exciting but does the job. Would be nice to have option of room service. However, front desk made good recommendations for dinner / takeout.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service! Food options.

review.title: Very nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: I just stayed here one night after the 49ers -vs- Chiefs game. Very clean, swanky and comfortable.
Wonderfully friendly staff and nice rooms with large comfy beds!

review.title: Nob Hill excellence
review.reviewText: Stanford Court was a wonderful surprise. Very high tech in amenities-the free WiFi was excellent. The rooms had comfy beds. The Staff was very attentive and helped us with storing our bags both on arrival and departure. Our flight out wasn't until 8 PM, so they held onto our bags while we continued sightseeing. They also helped us with tours, sightseeing, & booking a shuttle to the airport. We loved it & will definitely return!

review.title: Not the standard expected
review.reviewText: Lobby is nice. First room we had the bathroom was not clean as should be expected. Pubic hair in the shower and soap on shower curtain. We got a free room upgrade and it seemed like a different hotel, much nicer. But then there was some dry chewing gum on one of the pillow covers. Also if you leave your car more than 15 minutes for check in or check out it will cost $10 an hour up to $52 a day.

review.title: Close to shopping, cable cars and restaurants.
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautifully presented and staff were friendly. Concierge helped with great recommendations for restaurants and cocktail bars. Transportation was convenient with easy access to taxis and cable cars. Walking distance to great cafes and shops, and the hills provided some much needed exercise! The hotel is on top of a hill so provides fabulous views of San Francisco. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was great
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a downhill walk for shopping, restaurants, tour buses and entertainment. Catch cable car back up the hill. China Town is close by.

review.title: Nice/Central Location
review.reviewText:
First, I would stay at this hotel again --although their definition of "room with a view" was different than mine.  I had an early check-in request sent to me via email --and it prompted options for my room.  I chose "room with a view" --and my view was another building and looking down, was an industrial top of another.  The room was clean and comfortable.  There is no room service --which I surprised by --it's always a fun perk to order some room service one time when I stay at a hotel.  

Although all the other staff was quite friendly --I found the valet/parking staff not to be very friendly --I don't like when staff comes across indifferent, if they can't make money off of you.  I didn't have a car to park or they didn't have luggage to help me with --so, oh, no need to be friendly with you --so, we'll overt our eyes and offer no greeting.  I walked out of the side door several time to meet friends/ go for a walk ---and every time, didn't receive any greeting --just indifference.
review.positiveRemarks: location; the room was nice and; the bed comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet/Parking staff that are nice to all guests -to lend themselves to an overall friendly environment of the hotel.  Room service!

review.title: Nob Hill hotel
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, friendly helpful staff especially the concierge.
We were upgraded to a very large room on 4th floor. 
Noise not a problem.
Vast bed very comfortable which included firm sit up pillows in addition to softer sleeping ones.
We didn't have the breakfast so can't comment.

Strangely there is no room service menu and the bar menu is very limited.
However, we ordered in from an Italian place on Bush/Powell Sts.
Uncle Vito's Pizzeria (ph 391 5008) salads and pasta rocked - delivered to our room.

There is also a wine/food shop a couple of blocks downhill.
review.negativeRemarks: Availability of food
review.locationRemarks:
At top of two of incredibly steep hills 
Cable cars nearby sts ($6 a ride and long queues)
Grace Cathedral nearby

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: This hotel is generically nice, clean, and well tended.  We experienced no issues with arriving or departing and the room was clean and comfortable.  Great location albeit atop a steep hill.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators are slow.  No big deal though.
review.locationRemarks: Near the Financial District and Chinatown and on the cable car line.  You can walk everywhere but the walk back is quite steep.

review.title: Excellent location at the top of Nob Hill
review.reviewText: I stayed here with my wife and two children and we all enjoyed our stay.  The hotel comfortable, clean, and bright.  The staff is courteous and very helpful.  We would stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel, central location.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff provided us with free upgrade and were very pleasant to deal with.

Bath tub is damaged and needs replacing. 
Hotel had us wait 15 minutes for cab to airport even with another cab company at hotel curbside.

Good and safe location.  Clean rooms and comfortable beds.  Rated 4 stars due to no room service offered and extremely slow elevators.  I would stay again, but on a lower level.  If you plan on walking down to the Market Street area be prepared for a steep walk back up California.  Though there is a trolly that can get you up the hill for roughly $6.00 a trip.

review.title: Review of stay at Stanford Court
review.reviewText: Very hilly area.  Difficult for walking.  Close to China Town and Union Square.  Nice restaurants in the area.  Very expensive for eating.  Cost $60.00 a night to park a car.  Beds were very comfortable.  Staff was great.  Decent exercise room.

review.title: Nice quite 4 star
review.reviewText: Very nice stay at a nice hotel i give it 3 stars as it had no restaurant or room service,which to me for a hotel of this size seems rather strange!! Car parking very expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff comforst and very clean also close to shops and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service and a nice restaurant and less expensive car parking
review.locationRemarks: 15min walk to everything and right next to trolly stops for both routes

review.title: Great Location and Hotel
review.reviewText: I was in town for two days on business and was very pleased with the hotel. It's in a great location with a lot of great restaurants and other points of interest nearby. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and professional and the room was fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, amenities and quality of hotel are excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel should allow access to websites with conservative content on their lobby internet access
review.locationRemarks: Great location on what appears to be one of the highest hills in the city.  Some very good restaurants and historical sites nearby.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: upon arrival checking in was a pleasure. House keeping was rude restroom and bedding were dirty. Gross!!!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText:
This was a terrific hotel to stay in while in SF for a few days. It was a beautiful hotel in a great location, Nob Hill is pretty afluent and has alot of nicer hotels nearby while close to several neighborhoods that have a ton of cool resturants, etc.
The hotel staff was also great, very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, esp if they book early on so you get a good price.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location for all the things you want do in San Francisco , hop on one of the cable cars to take you back up the hill from Union square though as the hill is pretty steep.
review.positiveRemarks: Location Location Location & very friendly & helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: N/a
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square (bus tour is a must) 
Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz Tour, Golden Gate Bridge and so much more

review.title: The Hotel of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Check In to Check Out everything in between was an excellent experience! They definitely give their employees training, tools, and skills to use.  They take positive attitudes to another level with smiles on their faces!!!! No task is too small or large for them to accommodate! We all know ocation is everything where you can leave your heart in San Francisco!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location , hotel was comfortable , only issue is no hotel shuttle , would be more convenient to and from the airport, maybe next time if we stay their will be a shuttle...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The staff were courteous and willing to answer any questions we had about the town. Also arranged a transfer to the airport for us.  The trolley car stop was at the corner which made the location great.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, huge room, nice staff. Well located. Perfect.

review.title: The Stanford never fails
review.reviewText: Stayed here several times while visiting our daughter in SF. Upgraded us to a suite on the 6th floor when they realized it was my husband's birthday. Sent us to the room with 3 splits of champagne. Staff is helpful and attentive. Great location. You do need to bring your walking shoes for the hills. The Top of the Mark is near as well as the classic Grace cathedral. We'll keep coming back!

The hotel was very nice; perfect location!
The staff was very nice, friendly and very relax (no uniform: wearing jeans and some of them wearing a hut!)
Staff is extremely slow at accommodating needs: slow valet, slow checking in process, slow concierge assistance with the luggage- just overall very very slow.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We stayed one night at the Stanford Court and our only wish was that we could have stayed longer! The hotel is in a great location for tourists, like us. Cable cars that go down to Fisherman's Wharf (where you can shop Pier 39, see the sea lions & view Alcatraz) are right outside the door which allowed us to do several of San Francisco's most prominent sights in one easy trip. 

The hotel itself was beautiful and clean and the staff was very friendly. We arrived early and they allowed us to check in right away, even giving us an upgrade to a king room with a city view! Additionally, when they found out we were on our honeymoon, the manager himself ran champagne up to our room while we finished checking in.

The room itself was beautiful. It was roomy and clean with a lot of nice touches like towel warmers and reading lights.

We would definitely come back to the Stanford Court if we ever found ourselves in San Francisco again!

review.title: Gem on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: From the moment Raul the valet welcomed me to the hotel I knew this would be a good stay. Check in staff were friendly and warm, had a nice conversation with me. When he handed me room keys I'd been upgraded to a room with a view, which was unexpected and delightful. Room was fresh, comfortable. Bedding was exactly like home (feather down everything, melt into the sheets). Breakfast was affordable ($15) and delicious (smoked salmon, capers, cream cheese, bagel, good coffee - and that's coming from a lifetime Seattle native). Every staff person was friendly, and there was plenty of space to meet business contacts in the lobby. Great stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Tech chic. Great service from Raul the valet to check in to food service. Clean, well appointed rooms and amenities. Best location in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Everything is nearby. You're at the top of Nob Hill!

review.title: Spacious and clean room with a great view
review.reviewText: Spacious and clean room with a great view. Nice bed, desk and tv.

review.title: Top of the hill in the middle of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel at top of hill in downtown San Francisco. Easy to get to anywhere, but do prepare to climb hills, if you're traveling by foot.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi access in the room wasn't working - only available in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Quick trek to the convention center, Market St was just a short jaunt away, lots of stores, restaurants nearby

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a 3 star hotel. While the hotel's lobby and marketing campaign are very new and modern, the rooms are old and tired. The bathrooms are particularly dated. I expected more for the price (and I know that San Fran is expensive). The location is nice, though. 

I deducted a point for the way my booking was handled. I booked a queen deluxe room. When I arrived, a staff member told me "it was my lucky day" and "I had been upgraded". When I got up to the room, I discovered that they had put me in a handicapped room complete with sitting-only wheelchair-compatible shower etc. I went back down to ask whether I could have the room that I booked. Two staff members told me that the shower was adjustable and could be used standing. When I told them it wasn't, they admitted that they hadn't seen the handicapped rooms before and apologized. Finally they told me that they had overbooked so they needed to put me in a handicapped room because that's all they had available. The manager then told me I could swap rooms in the morning provided that I came down early enough and snared a room before someone else did. After I complained further, he agreed to guarantee me a new room in the morning. 

What really annoyed me was not the room itself so much as the dishonesty. If they had told me before I arrived that the room I had booked was unavailable I would have booked elsewhere

review.title: Nice hotel centrally locate to my needs
review.reviewText: Room was excellent. Only received one face cloth a day

review.title: excellent hotel -but no tea available at 4pm
review.reviewText: no faults with hotel but location at Nobs Hill is not ideal in transport terms - but you will have difficulty in finding as good an hotel at waterfront locations. avoid use of cable cars as means of travel - always full - better to use other public transport- bus and trams
review.negativeRemarks: tea/snacks available in late afternoon

review.title: stanford hotel well located
review.reviewText: easy access to many tourist destinations and taxi availability all the time
GOOD HOTEL, AND THE BEST VIEW TO LOOK THE DOWNTOWN.

review.title: Great location, but a little pricey for this hotel
review.reviewText: The employees were all great from the front desk to the cleaning staff
review.positiveRemarks: Location, pet friendly, nice staff, Tonga, a throwback restaurant, is just across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms do not have vents, and the renovation could have been done with higher end finishings.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, trolly's are just outside. Short walk to Union Square. Pet friendly ($50 flat fee) & there's an unofficial dog half a block away.

review.title: Great location!!  Very cozy
review.reviewText: Having all cable cars options just outside the hotel is th best! Beds are very comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel,close to attractions and transportation
review.reviewText: We had a 6 nights stay in a room with no view. It was very disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were extremely nice and helpful. The lobby was impressive and modern. The hotel is close to many attractions such Chinatown, Union Square and Pi
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel itself could use some updating in the room and bathroom.

review.title: Excellent Nob Hill Location!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, within good walking distance of local cafes and restaurants.  Room conditions are absolutely wonderful for a week-long stay.  Spectacular city view from my hotel room.  Being transit savvy is a must - cable cars can be useful, but busses are quite accessible nearby - just a matter of knowing exactly where those bus stops are and knowing where to get off when returning to the hotel.  A very enjoyable stay, indeed!
no room service, some rooms are very far from elevator, flat sheet was used as a mattress sheet

review.title: Convenient spot
review.reviewText: The hotel has a nice location near Chinatown and Union Square. A cable car station is right across the street outside the hotel. The guy at concierge (sorry I forgot his name) was being very helpful in giving me directions to the places I wanted to visit in the city!

review.title: Nice hotel, central location to most places
review.reviewText: This was a really good hotel to stay at, there were cable car stops right in front so it was easy access. Close enough to union square but far enough away from the noise. Fairly central location to most of the tourist attractions.
Overall experience was ok.  Our room was clean but a little small.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was good and close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant did not have enough staff .

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: Tony at the concierge desk was fabulous!   He arranged for a car to pick us up while shopping and take is to the airport!  Also, gave us coupons for some stores in Union Square. Very helpful!!!

review.title: Great hotel at an excellent location!
review.reviewText: I stayed at their deluxe room with two queen beds during family vacation for 6 nights. Room was large and very comfortable. Hotel location is excellent with two cable car lines right in front of hotel. Fishermen's Wharf, Union Square and financial district is all short cable car ride away. China Town right across street to boot. Great hotel and wifi is free too. Zipcar also parked right in front of main entrance. Staff friendly and efficient. Great all around experience!

review.title: Great hotel in great location!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at the Stanford Court. Great location as it is easy to get to major attractions/sights. The staff were wonderful! They were very helpful, cheerful and accommodating. They gave us fantastic recommendations for dinner! Would definitely stay again!
review.negativeRemarks: A few more items on their bar menu
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. You can catch the cable car right out front. Bus not far away. Walking distance to Chinatown, Union Square, financial district;

review.title: In the center of the city
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.  It is close to Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach.  Easy access to buses and the cable car.  Our room was on Powell, so you could hear the cable car but it didn't bother us.  They supplied ear plugs if needed.  Nice bar.

review.title: Central convenient location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in the center of San Francisco, close to China Town and Union square and on the intersection of two cable cars. It's located on a hill therefore not for elderly or carriage-ridden kids, unless taxes are used. Great breakfast! Not many selections for dinner but whatever they had was delicious! Old fashioned a bit with faulty locks on bathroom doors requiring verbal warnings to family members but at the same time clean bedding sets and towels. The fridge was catastrophically  small and coffee machine has not been used in ages - no coffee pot. The shower head was installed right above my head and I'm 5'1". Awfully inconvenient for anyone taller than me. However, overall it left a good impression on us. Replacement of outdated carpets, bathroom and an installation of a second sink would have improved it a lot.
review.negativeRemarks: We stayed for 9 days and would have hoped to get a room with a view of the street rather than a courtyard and other residents but alas ...
review.locationRemarks: Close to China Town, Union Square, walking distance to a pier market. Walgreen with all necessities is nearby on Powell street.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a great area. Friendly staff and a comfortable room. Great views of the city and bay.

review.title: Convenient location, well appointed hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was friendly and always greeted me when I came and went.  The room was clean and fairly spacious. The gym was nice and well stocked.  I'd say the only downside was that the hotel room shampoo didn't lather very easily.  It seemed a little noisy at night (the radiator or something?) but there are earplugs right there in the bathroom, by the soaps.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Location was VERY convenient to touristy stuff. The cable car stops right outside.  Hotel is on a hill, so fairly scenic.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Great location for my business trip downtown.   The room was clean and comfortable, reasonably priced, staff was very accommodating and responsive.  They offer breakfast in the lobby (not free) but no room service.  The trolly's run right outside and access to Powell street Trolley only a 1/2 block away if interested in that. Easy walk (downhill) to the Financial district.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
We loved where the location of the hotel is.  
Cable cars, great restaurants and shopping.  Even loved the fact that we had to hike up major steep streets.  I would stay here again. My only complaint was that the person/people in the next room tried to hide that they were smoking.  I could smell it a few times.  I called the front desk who said they would send someone up right away.  It seemed to stop after that.  People who smoke don't realize that non-smokers can smell cigarette smoke a mile away and it is completely disrespectful to smoke in a non-smoking hotel.  No fault of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators needed to be updated but still liked the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, china town, shopping.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice and even let us check out two rooms to decide which one we wanted (bigger beds over a view). View was not that great so we opted for the bigger beds. The hotel was reasonable clean, but I did find some dark hairs in the bathroom - we are all blonde. The bathtub didn't drain very well but it is an older building. The location is pretty good, right on the cable car line - not that it's easy to catch one. We walked to most of our destinations and by the end of our stay figured out alternate transit as well as route to walk that avoided the steep hills. This hotel is on the corner of Powell and California both of which are quite steep. I would recommend jogging over a few streets to avoid the steep hills. We enjoyed our stay! But if I went back I'd try a different hotel. Not that it is so bad is never go back I just wouldn't mind trying another one.

review.title: Nice Hotel and close to everything.
review.reviewText: its a nice upscale hotel and the room was very clean. The only problem is I had no where to park a small moving truck and the hotel staff wasn't very helpful with this. They told me to take it to a lot about 2 miles away and take a cab back. Other than this, my stay was nice.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is perfectly located and is on the corner of two cable car lines...  Staff was exceptionally helpful and they sent us to great local places to eat... all of which were awesome.  I would definitely stay here again.  The free WIFI was a plus.

Only problem, no room service nor hotel restaurant.  They have a kind of pick- up breakfast and a bar after 5 pm... which looked well used although we didn't go in.

Its a nice quiet place to stay.  The place is old but its been re-done and is very nice.  Rooms are odd shaped but that adds to the character of the place.  All in all, great place to stay.  I'd do it again!

review.title: Fantastic location on Nob Hill with great views
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was incredibly gracious.  We were upgraded to a room with a view - gorgeous panorama of downtown, the Transamerica Building and out to the Bay Bridge.  The staff gave great recommendations for a lunch cafe, and helped with transport to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, beautiful views, cool interior vibe, wonderful staff!
review.locationRemarks: Easy cable car access to all the tourist sites.  Don't miss the Cable Car Museum that is a short 3 block walk away!

review.title: Nice clean hotel
review.reviewText: First time visiting SF and hotel was clean and updated.  Central location of hotel was also very nice.

review.title: Good position near trolley
review.reviewText:
Room great
Female concierge Hopeles , male was helpful
Parking a rip off
Pity there was no food

review.title: Located adjacent to the trolley car line.
review.reviewText:
Due to the clanging noise of the trolley cars, the hotel offers a set of ear-plugs along with shampoo, lotion, etc. an indicator that the room is not going to be quiet.
The staff wasn't wearing uniforms or even corporate shirts so it was difficult to tell if the guy asking to help me with my luggage was a staff person or not...same with the desk staff....kind of odd. Not overly professional in behavior. The facility itself is nice looking and pleasant. Do not expect to have any room service or food available onsite between 10:30am and 5pm.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable, the towels were nice and the desk was accommodating for work.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could wear something that indicates they work there. Food and beverage service available throughout the day would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the trolley line, on a very steep street. Lots to do nearby if you're up for a strenuous walk, or a cab ride.

review.title: Top of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was clean and very quiet. The neighborhood was safe and close to many attractions and shops. Older guests might have trouble with the long steep climb up the hill.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The only complaint is the comfort of the pillows.
Wonderful Hotel. Clean, close to everything , quiet, exceptional staff.

review.title: Great location comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice in great location of san francisco.  Very nice places to eat nearby. Hotel was comfortable clean and quiet.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: Bright and upkept hotel and rooms, and staff was pleasant.  Easy to get in and out as you are also right on the cusp of Chinatown and the downtown area, you also have trolleys moving in each direction of the intersection.  Get a hotel here and a MUNI pass and you're all set.  This hotel was perfect, and would very highly recommend!

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Most staff were great but a few were very grumpy especially the lady at concierge.  Stayed for 12 nights and had to ask for extra towels, coffee shampoo etc  on 8 of those nights.

review.title: Comfortable room
review.reviewText: Check in time isn't until 4pm.  We arrived at noon and couldn't get checked in.  Hotel did safely store our luggage in the meanwhile.  Being in this area meant lots of noise which reduced the amount of sleep I got.   Conceige staff was very attentive upon check-in but of no help when asking for restaurant suggestions, answering the phone when attempting to get car from valet.
review.negativeRemarks: Conceige service
review.locationRemarks: Several area hotels were closed due to it being 4th of July but overall location is great.

review.title: Terrific view close to everything
review.reviewText: Enjoyed stay. Hotel close to china town and union square. Mother and daughter get away to remember.

review.title: Great hotel at great price.
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is a great hotel on nob hill. We had a great view of the city and bay from our room. The rooms clean and comfortable with all the amenities you could want. The staff was courteous and helpful. Right outside the hotel is thr cable car line giving you immediate access to union square, fishermans ward or the financial district. We will definately comeback.

review.title: Very comfortable!!!
review.reviewText: The room it self was very nice and comfortable. The staff and valet were helpful in anyway, not much of a view, but i would still recommend this hotel!!

review.title: very convenient nice hotel
review.reviewText: all great except an smell of dry cleaning chemicals coming from open window on one night
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast is a bit unhealthy
review.locationRemarks: perfect location

review.title: close to all the attractions
review.reviewText: my experience was something I would never forget my family loved it

review.title: Good, comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: Our room (two queen-size beds for two adults, one teen, one tween) was just what we ordered. Clean and comfortable. Desk staff, bellmen, concierge were efficient and pleasant. The restaurant had a small selection, but adequate, and the food was well prepared and appeared promptly.
review.locationRemarks: Almost the very top of Nob Hill. Few close restaurants, and they were down (& then up) the hill. But lots of good food & entertainment a cab-ride away

review.title: Nice Room but they overcharge for everything.
review.reviewText: Parking, food, room, everything was overpriced at this establishment. The beds were comfortable and the room was pretty nice and clean. I wouldn't give the place over 3.5 rating though, the corridor carpets are worn and spaztic and the room needed to be repainted and tastefully redecorated.
review.positiveRemarks: The employees were very nice and the beds were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet needs to be replaced and the food was overpriced.

review.title: Great hotel in Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Stanford court hotel has some great room and it's one of the best hotel I have stayed at in SF. It's in a really nice part of town with a good choice of restaurants around. I don't think there's any room service but it's not a big concern as a consequence.
nice rooms, nice lobby, and a really nice location.

review.title: Excellent hotel centrally located.
review.reviewText: Hotel is very close to Chinatown and walking distance to Union Square and Fishermen Wharf. We also managed to walk to Lombard St. and Coit Tower even with some steep climbing up roads and steps.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel room is very modern, neat and clean with very comfortable pillows. We appreciate a complementary bottle of water in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the concierge could be more helpful and sincere about options for transportation to the airport.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Pleasant and in nice area of city
review.reviewText: If you enjoy walking this hotel is perfect, the neighborhood is very quiet compared to the rest of the city so when you walk out you are never bombarded with people. It is on a hill so regardless of where you are going you will climb before getting back to the hotel. However, with all the calories my husband and I burned we felt way less guilty about over indulging on the fantastic food plus the beds are super comfortable so we got great nights sleep all four nights we were there. The cafe and bar seemed more geared to businessmen and less towards family but with all the amazing places to eat and drink in the city it was fine with us.

review.title: nice hotel that is centrally located
review.reviewText: we had a great time! Less than a mile to Market Street and about the same to Fisherman's Wharf. Only 2 blocks from Chinatown.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is lovely. On route I was told by fellow travellers and locals that it was a great hotel, so I had quite high expectations. When I arrived I was greatly satisfied and got myself booked in. I was upgraded to a city view room without even having to ask, which was a lovely bonus. The room was clean, tidy and spacious. The food and drink at the bar was slightly overpriced but this is to be expected at such a great location. I would recommend this hotel and also recommend that anyone visiting San Francisco wear comfortable shoes! Lots of hills and lots of walking!
review.negativeRemarks: It would be a nice option to have breakfast at the hotel, but this seems to be the case with all of the hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location with a cable car stop just around the corner. 5 minute walk from Union square with great shops such as Macys and bloomingdales.

review.reviewText: had a great time and realized that we had stayed at this hotel before and was a very pleasant stay
review.locationRemarks: great line to catch the cable cars, also many great places to eat nearby.

review.title: Location is the Best Part!!!!
review.reviewText: Modern, upscale hotel in the best location. At the intersection of 2 cable car lines, this hotel is a tourists dream. Within walking distance to Chinatown, Nob Hill, and Union Square. Clean, safe neighborhood to walk around in at night. Cabstand right out front with cabs to take you farther afield. Staff are friendly and attentive. The hotel bar and restaurant were too modern and lacked any sort of character, but there are plenty of other places within walking distance that have local character. If you are traveling and want a reasonable, clean, safe place to lay your head at night, this hotel is for you.

review.title: Great location but bed linens could be improved
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is located in a great spot for access to the cable car and downtown SF. The hotel has been updated and looks quite modern. My only issue is that the beds and pillows seem not to be of the same quality as other hotels of this class. Our beds were too soft and "saggy" and the pillows were either rock hard or much too soft.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great staff, very helpful, could use an all day bar and eatery.
review.negativeRemarks: Food availability.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, because two cable car lines intersect at the hotel entrance.

review.title: Great local
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel with a great location to the cable car route, Union Square & China town. Just be aware of the $50 additional charge per day for valet/parking hidden in your itinerary fin print.
Missed cleaning our room on the first night.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel & Location !
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the Standford, minutes away from Union Square (lots of shops) & great restaurants. Also loved access to the cable cars right out front. Room was very spacious & the bed was VERY comfortable! Free Wifi throughout the hotel & the also provided free breakfast every morning. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice accomodations. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We just wished that there would have been somewhere we could have sat outside. Rooms are nice, but there is nowhere to store your clothes if you are staying more than a few days.
review.negativeRemarks: dresser in rooms. An outdoor sitting area.

review.title: Good, clean hotel. Location might not suit all.
review.reviewText: The staff are wonderful and friendly, the rooms are large and exceptionally clean with very comfortable beds. The hotel is at the very top of nob hill which means it's a short walk to the fairmont for a posh breakfast or the mark Hopkins with it's top floor cocktail lounge. It also means you have a steep uphill walk back to the hotel from pretty much everywhere! But the location is better than the tacky touristy pomp of fisherman's wharf and the bustle of union square. One tiny note, the windows are not sound proofed and there are cable car tracks right outside so the bells will wake you up if you want an afternoon nap!

review.title: Nice Hotel....
review.reviewText:
My main concern with this hotel was during check in and check out.....Due to the fact that I had reserved through Expedia, the staff was not too keen on helping me. Even requesting a receipt for my stay was a problem.

Also no room service:(
review.positiveRemarks: The room and the location was lovely!
review.negativeRemarks: A hotel in this caliber should have room service!

review.title: Nice Hotel with Great Staff
review.reviewText:
Very good location with great rooms. The staff went out of the way to make our stay very nice.
I have no complaints. I would recommend this hotel to friends. Even the housekeeping staff were very
nice.
review.negativeRemarks: needs a better restaurant menu, needs a higher class dinning area to measure up to the other hotel standards.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the cable car line. Close to everything.

review.title: Great location atop Nob Hill
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location. On top of Nob Hill - close to trolley lines.

review.title: hotel with free bike rentals
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed here over memorial weekend. Our plane arrived 6 hours before check in time, but they had a room ready for us anyways, which was awesome! It's in walking distance to many places. However, they have a limited number of bikes that we could borrow without any extra cost, which made our visit infinitely better. We rode the bikes to the Golden gate bridge, the California academy of sciences, and just around the city in general. I would definitely consider staying here! However, there was no breakfast included, which we misunderstood, so that was a bummer.

review.title: Great location, excellent view and nice room.
review.reviewText: Will definitely return for business and pleasure.

review.title: Hotel in the center of town
review.reviewText: The room we were given was on the first floor overlooking the delivery entrance. Guess it was because we booked through Expedia and got a decent rate.

review.title: Thirtieth Birthday - 3 night stay in the city
review.reviewText: The staff were all amazing. The concierge saved us quite a few times, even managed to schedule a massage in my room with less than 2 hours notice! The elevator is a little slow and the shower head low - I'm 5' 9".

review.title: Excellent Stay Overall
review.reviewText: Our stay at Stanford Court SF was amazing. The hotel staff was amazing...super friendly and very helpful, they really know how to make guests feel at home. The location of Stanford Court was great...blocks from Union Square and in the center of everything else. Affordable, clean, safe and super friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows weren't great.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Nice Hotel, staff extremely helpful and pleasant
review.reviewText: Our stay was very pleasant. The concierge staff where more then helpful with all of our inquiries
review.negativeRemarks: The bar should be open earlier then 5 Would be nice to have the continental breakfast included
review.locationRemarks: Location was quiet but because of that had to walk up and down the hills to get anywhere or take transportation which was readily available in front o

review.title: The best staff we have ever experienced
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice but the helpful staff were far and away the best we have ever experienced. From the minute we arrived they guided our vacation and their recommendations were spot on every time. Upon check-in we were advised to obtain a seven day "muni" pass and where to buy. It was a fantastic bit of advice that saved us close to $100 during our stay.

One afternoon during a record heat we had returned from Fisherman's Wharf and sat in the lobby to talk about plans for the evening. Tony, came right over with four bottles of cold water for us and helped us decide where to dine that evening, where to get a cocktail and enjoy the city views.

The rooms are nice, the other services ok but I consider the staff on par with the Fairmont Gold Level...maybe a bit better.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We walked to our "big splurge" dinner at Quince, and to a super breakfast at Brenda's Soul Food. Clean, well decorated hotel. We would return.

review.title: #HASHTAG EVERYTHING
review.reviewText: Absolutely loved this entire hotel experience. Loved the modern twist to the hotel...all Apple products in the main lobby.

review.title: location - at intersection of 2 cable car lines
review.reviewText: excellent - good location - friendly staff - good value
review.positiveRemarks: staff was excellent - helpful, friendly, went out of their way to provide assistance and service. As a group, the best I have come across in years.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Went to San Francisco as a guest of a wedding. This hotel was the perfect location for the reception venue - right across the street! Was very quiet and comfortable. Bedding and bed was great. Bathroom was great; even had a heated towel rack! Only "complaint" (and I use that term loosely) was the view wasn't great and the room itself was a little small. But would definitely stay here again and recommend it to other people!
review.locationRemarks: Location is near North Beach and Chinatown.

review.title: Nice hotel but breakfast arrangements let it down
review.reviewText: Good location and the rooms are spacious and well appointed. The breakfast arrangements were disappointing.

review.title: Bargain Hotel on Nob Hill
review.reviewText: We were offered a room on a high floor because the trolley runs on California and can be noisy on lower floors, but the room was great. We had a beautiful view of the bay. There is no real restaurant, but breakfast pastries, sandwiches and coffee and other food items are offered for breakfast and lunch. One downside is that ice is only available at one machine on the first floor, but otherwise everything about the room was clean, quiet and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great. Across the street from the Fairmont on Nob Hill and right near a park.
review.locationRemarks: Grace Cathedral is a block away and worth seeing, and the Tonga Room at the Fairmont is across the street. Touristy, but fun.

review.title: Nice hotel in safe centralized location.
review.reviewText: Great friendly staff. We had a wonderful 5 day stay and were for the most part- very happy.

review.title: Great price for location
review.reviewText: When we arrived our room was upgraded at no cost. Staff was extremely welcoming and the room was very comfortable. Would stay here again!!!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The staff weren't very friendly, except one bell boy. I asked for 2 queens and got 2 full beds. Very modern hotel.

review.title: Excellent and Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and service was top notch. We had alot of questions in regards to the transportation and they were very helpful in providing rental cars, travelling tours, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Center point for both direction cable cars. Walking distance to chinatown. Excellent is comparable with Fairmont hotel since it is across the street

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: Personnel accueillant , gentil et avenant! Tout a été parfait !

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and location. The remodel was nice. Room was really big on 8th floor!

review.title: Among the best hotels in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying over at the Standford Court. It was a great experience. The staff is really nice and they can help you get the shuttle to the airport. It was a blast!! I recommend this place to anybody who wants comfort in a safe well rounded environment

review.title: Wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: All of the staff were nice and accommodating. We stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary and it was perfect.

review.title: Looks pretty, but not much for what you pay
review.reviewText:
Writing this whilst in an airport shuttle the hotel organized, said would take 30 mins, it's been 30 and still stuck in traffic, missing plane likely, concierge at the hotel not helpful with this. The hotel itself looks nice, but beds are lumpy, and the bathroom really needs a makeover. Don't get much for what you pay. The bar staff are nice...
Let's hope I make my flight Concierge lady...
If you do stay here, and get an airport shuttle, give yourself at least an hour not 30 mins like the hotel told us....

review.title: Anonymous
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great staff. Pricey for what you get, especially the food and only minimal amenities. Location was great.

review.title: Very nice location
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay. A very clean and beautiful hotel. Staff was very helpful..

review.title: Top of a hill...
review.reviewText: Our room was on the 8th floor but it was still very noisy (from inside and outside). Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very accommodating and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: It's at the top of a hill so be prepared for the climb.

review.title: Location, location, location. Nob Hill
review.reviewText: You can't beat this location at a more fair price. We stayed at the Stanford Court for three nights and found this hotel lovely. Deluxe Queen, paid in advance for a base price of $159/night. Generous sized room, nicely furnished, view of Bay & TransAmerica tower. Excellent lighting in living room and bath. Individual reading lights. Lighting is something we find is often ignored. Small dressing room, marble bath, all nicely appointed. Loved the cable cars going past our hotel and used them frequently. Get the 3 day pass for $23 at Walgreens. Everyone on staff was exceptionally helpful from registration to concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: We walked everywhere or took the cable car from this location: Wharf, Ferry Terminal, restaurants, Russian Hill, Presidio.

review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and in a great location, but our room wasn't ready for hours after check in. This was a problem for multiple guests he king in at the same time.

review.title: Well licated
review.reviewText: We had a great 3 day stay. The staff was awesome, so helpful with everything. The hotel was located in an area that was close to all the sights we wanted to see. We definitely will return. The only negative was there is no hot tub in the workout area to soothe sore muscles from all the walking.

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff, really good location.
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for 9 days at the beginning of April. The location is really good and only a short walk to Union Square. The staff at the reception and bar were all friendly and helpful. Doormen always said hello. The hotel is situated on a steep hill so if you don't like walking up and down hills then you may struggle. There is however access to the streetcar/tram which makes the hills easier. Located on Powell Street is a diner called Cosy Cable Car Cafe which does an amazing breakfast of pancakes, crepes etc. Overall the hotel was really nice and would definitely recommend to friends and stay there again. Free WiFi was really good and had no issues with using it.

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently located
review.reviewText:
Very good located, with a lot of transport nearby.
Rooms are fine, but the shower was ridiculously set at 5 feet tall, maybe they get too many visits from Hobbits, but for humans, washing the hair was a challenge.
Very bad experience with a package, that arrived under my name and asked for it 4 times, but wasn't until Fidel (the package manager) got involved by me that, the found it. The obvious thing was to believe it hasn't arrive and consider it lost.

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText:
Hotel on the corner or 2 cable cars. Going N,S,E,W. Walking distance to everything you want to see and do. Great hotel.

The con. To pricy. From the hotel down to the hotel food.

review.title: Great City Hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic location and great service, will definitely use again.

review.title: Great hotel next to everything
review.reviewText: Love it....recommend this hotel is a 10 out of 10...clise to fisherman wharf,Chinatown and downtown....next to TROLEY.

review.title: Accessible to everything
review.reviewText: Did not like the FIRST room as we are we are beside those BOILERS of another hotel. EXPENSIVE. FOR A FEE to have our room CHANGED. Regardless, we have a good time.

review.title: standford court
review.reviewText:
clean.
good food.
great customer service
right beside powell trolley and close to union square

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel within walking distance to most of the main attractions, though some are about a 20 minute walk, but a pleasant walk and gave us chance to see more at our leisure. Loved San Francisco, loads to see & do and plenty of organised trips could be booked. We had a day at Yosemite National Park, very long day but so worth it, it was absolutely stunning and cannot wait to go back. Alcatraz was amazing and well worth the trip. Cable car rides are a great experience and a must do. Hop on hop off bus tours of the city great value.
review.positiveRemarks: Great hotel and great location. Rooms are a good size and clean. Bed really comfy. Breakfast gave a reasonable choice and of a good standard.
review.negativeRemarks: Double glazing, main street outside was a bit noisy until about 11pm due to trams ringing bells etc.Only net curtains at windows, need proper ones.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to most major attractions, Alcatraz, Fishermans Wharf, Union Square etc. Trips can be booked further a field like Yosemite.

review.title: Middle of town... Great location
review.reviewText: Can hop on the trolley/cable car right outside the hotel which brings you too union square, fisherman's wharf, china town, etc. great if you wanted to check out all those locations.
review.negativeRemarks: Store for items such as toothpaste, snacks to be available
review.locationRemarks: Union square, china town, cafés, cable car, Fishermans wharf

review.title: Middle of town... Great location
review.reviewText: Can hop on the trolley/cable car right outside the hotel which brings you too union square, fisherman's wharf, china town, etc. great if you wanted to check out all those locations.
review.negativeRemarks: Store for items such as toothpaste, snacks to be available
review.locationRemarks: Union square, china town, cafés, cable car, Fishermans wharf

review.title: Nice location, Great views
review.reviewText:
CONS: For the most part it was good...but a few drawbacks: staff was a bit disappointing..they missed our room cleaning and when we called the front desk to at least have some coffee & bath condiments deliver to our room, they said to come get it from the front desk and this was all during the hours of when housekeeping was there on site. Then, when housekeeping did come, they picked up our dirty towels from the floor and hung it back on the towel rack instead of replacing them. Pick any hotel and they know the meaning of the towels being on the floor means kindly replace the towels please. Too much noise from the street from the cable car bell always ringing out loud and people yelling on the street. No microwave in the room :( and veryyyy expensive parking surcharge.
PROS: welcoming lobby, newspaper and coffee available, knowledgeable staff about the city and things to do, amazing views from the 7th floor with the view of both the city and the bay, comfortable bed, spacious rooms with King City view, and free WiFi :)
review.positiveRemarks: views, location, close to restaurants and shopping..
review.negativeRemarks: Please serve breakfast buffets included in the price you are charging the customers...i mean its a 4 star hotel and they don't serve breakfast buffet
review.locationRemarks: walk to shopping/restaurants, bike rentals, easy access to cable car, nice neighborhoods, cathedrals around the hotel, short drive to piers for ferry

review.title: Good location, clean & tidy... but not quite 4star
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean and tidy room and hotel. No room service, uneconomical Starbucks one cup coffee facilities in room (tea available only on request - and was given camomile only on initial request as had none of the desired black tea). Booked for room with a view - given a view of the rest of the hotel. Poor/minimal catering facilities. Good wifi signal and free air printing facilities. Housekeeping very noisy in the mornings (not great for jet lagged UK guests). Steep hill back up to hotel from Union sq area (be warned!). Bathroom slightly dated but functional... toiletries provided, but no amenity pack (cotton buds, emery boards, shower cap etc). Overall, was slightly disappointed given 4star rating, but nonetheless a handy, clean, friendly hotel with comfortable room.

review.title: Great SF hotel
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, comfortable and clean...great quality for the price. We all loved this hotel.

review.title: 27 Year Anniversary
review.reviewText: The employees of the Stanford are outstanding they treated us like Movie Stars.

review.title: A perfect stay in the Heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: A perfect upper mid class hotel. The staff was exceptional, particularly the concierge who took care of arranging for our rental car to be picked up from the hotel parking lot, saving me a lot of work.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. I will be staying here again for sure. The staff is great and help out with everything. The rooms are small but nice and wish I had a better view. Trolley stop right outside!! Easy to get anywhere in the city. My new go to spot.

review.title: Nice, but disappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and decent to stay at for the weekend. My best friend and I check in around 6 close to 7pm..past the 4pm check in time. We got there and the front desk lady said our room was not ready and it was gonna be an hour. We were already tired and wanted to rest before going out, so my friend ask for the manager because that was unacceptable especially since we took our time past check in time. The manager came out and was able to give us another room that was ready within 5 mins. I would stay here again, but they need to do something about those rooms not being ready in time for their guest when they arrive.

review.title: Posh and Pleasant
review.reviewText: really great hotel. i liked the energy. really inviting lobby to sit in. really great rooms, nice and spacious with comfortable furniture and beds. had a great check-in experience, all the staff were friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: i was sad there wasn't room service. we ate dinner in the restaurant one night and were a little disappointed in the food considering the prices.
review.locationRemarks: i was there for a conference, so i didn't really explore outside of chinatown.

review.title: Good location and Clean Rooms
review.reviewText: We were on the 6th flr and it was a little noisy. The rooms are not sound proof at all. Hotel staff was pleasant and courteous, but not too helpful for dinner suggestions. (We wanted to eat at a place other than the hotel.) Anyway it's passable.
review.negativeRemarks: Better sound proofing.

review.title: nice location close to union squire
review.reviewText: i liked the hotel and its room decoration and the view to the city

review.title: Good location, expessive parking
review.reviewText:
50per night parking is alot when youre already paying for a room.

Reception staff ok. Parking staff and restaurant staff need to be more friendly as everyone else is.

review.title: A great feel
review.reviewText: I liked the feel of the Stanford Court. Always greeted at the door and superb staff, classy and yet not stuffy. Lovely nob hill location, close to so much. Would definitely go again!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We love San Francisco. The hotel location is wonderful. The lobby was lovely but the halls and rooms a little tired. Carpeting was not clean!
review.positiveRemarks: We really like to the Concierge on Saturday afternoon (male) and the Concierge on Sunday (Elaine).

review.title: Great and Helpful Concierge Desk
review.reviewText: The staff was really helpful and excellent. The Concierge Desk folks earned the name

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel many years ago and was looking forward to returning. I enjoy the hotel experience and like my hotel to have certain amenities which were missing from the Stanford Court. There is no restaurant, there is no coffee service (lattes, espresso), and between 10:30 and 5 there is no place to have a snack or a drink.

The hotel lobby is very dark and the ceilings are low. I prefer a lighter environment, but if you like cocooning this may work for you.

Our room was also very dark and the housecleaning service missed a few things in the daily cleanup. I would consider requesting 2 beds as the rooms are larger.

I did like the free internet service and the registration process was very pleasant. The Nob Hill location is very good. The hotel is located on the cable car lines.
review.positiveRemarks: I did like the free internet and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The food and housecleaning service could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Good location on the cable lines near Union Square, Chinatown, and the financial district.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location. Room was loud, heard lots of street noise. Was a little annoyed they provided only 1 coffee in the room. Otherwise good.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide more towels and coffee. Hotel menu was uninspiring.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to China Town and Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Wonderful weekend!
review.reviewText:
I thoroughly enjoyed my recent stay at the Stanford Court Hotel - a restored heritage building located at the intersecting corner of two trolley car routes! How convenient!

The concierge staff was wonderful - extremely helpful no matter what my question!

My room was great - had windows that open (I need fresh air during the night!), and a comfortable bed. Bathroom wasn't as clean as home and one of my drinking glasses was dirty, however, overall it was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: A little more attention to cleaning detail....however that was minor.
review.locationRemarks: The location was very central to lots of tourist activities - trolley cars were great ($15.00 for a day pass) - hills were very steep!!

review.title: Great potential, disappointing overall.
review.reviewText: Great location and could be fantastic! The only member of the staff who was great was Todd at the front desk. The bellmen did not ever greet us, the woman at the concierge desk was rude, and the rest of the staff seemed very indifferent. The view from our room was AWESOME but the room itself was run down, with very date and worn amenities. Unfortunate since it has such potential. Would not recommend nor return.
review.positiveRemarks: Todd at the front desk, the location, the $1 bottled waters.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, paint, carpet, mini fridge with actual items in it, pillows...
review.locationRemarks: Fairmont, Nob Hilll, great location!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel had a great lobby full of MAC's and IPads available for use as well as free wifi. The room's furniture was a little dated and the pillows were horrible, as well as the grout could use a good cleaning. The beds were very comfortable though.

review.title: Really good hotel, except for the noise
review.reviewText:
I mean a lot of noise. My room faced the street with the cable cars and some parking. There were bells, car alarms, bums talking etc. at all hours of the night. Not sure if any room would be quieter but is probably worth asking. Also, the pillows were a joke. The hotel room was a decent size and comfortable otherwise. Staff were all really nice as well.

One other note, this hotel is uphill. Could be a negative depending on how fit your are or how much you want to take a taxi.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure how you could solve the noise problem, maybe provide noise machine or something? Could definitely provide better pillows
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown and Union Squate

review.title: Stanford Court Hotel
review.reviewText: My favorite thing about the Stanford Court Hotel is that it is ten minutes from China Town and Union Square and thirty minutes from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and Japan Town. The beg was big and fluffly, and the white linen was very clean. The housekeeping staff always finished cleaning the rooms by the early afternoon.

review.title: Refined quiet beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed on the 8th floor. The only problem I had was the shortage of the water pressure. It was not strong enough for shower in particular.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location, neat room, modern cafe on the lobby level, IT equipments, and devoted workers.
review.negativeRemarks: The weakness of water pressure.
review.locationRemarks: Hanging around Chinatown,waling down to Union Square, and so on.

review.title: Top of the hill so expect a climb. Nice hotel but
review.reviewText:
Overall it is a 4ish. But it's next to noisy road on top of the hill on California St. That means u need to request a quiet side if they have availability. Also the trolleys climb up to this corner street so the hotel 2 sides have this noise.

It's a good hotel with very good accommodations and people who work hard there. If u are OK with noise then this is a spot for you.

review.title: A wonderful updated hotel
review.reviewText: Great location on Nob Hill. Friendly staff. Lots of hi tech. Free wifi
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to reopen the hotel restaurant. It was not open.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill. Very centrally located in San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is huge located on top of Nob Hill and has been newly revamped with a more contemporary approach to serving guests. Skate boards, surf boards and colour popped photos of iconic city neighbourhoods adorn the walls.

The rooms are large and confirtable with well appointed amenities and large bathrooms. Ask for an inside room that faces the courtyard unless you want to hear the street cars hat pass on both cross streets. That alone will tell you that you are to the top of hill and your cordon work out can be done in a trip around the block.

As noted there is no room service per se but there is a lounge and restaurant and you can take your food to your room which suited me just fine as I have never been fond of paying room service rates.

This hotel has really dialed into a niche of travellers that are looking for a prime room in a central location with the right mix of necessities an have no need for old school stuffiness or pampering.

review.title: Ok but not a 4 star!
review.reviewText: Had a miserable guy at check in. Not welcoming at all. The people checking in next to us had a really nice welcome from the other guy on reception. Hotel is in nob hill... It's a huge hill. For tourists stay somewhere closer to fisherman a warf. You'll save £££ in taxis. Hotel is clean and tidy but more was expected from a 4 star. Walls were paper thin. I personally wouldn't stay here again. Ok if your on a business trip.

review.title: Friendly Staff and Nice, Clean Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel with our 15 month old daughter and really enjoyed it! The staff was more than helpful and always greeted us with a smile. The only complaints we had were the price of parking since we mainly traveled by vehicle, we also had to pay for public parking, total between hotel and trip can get expensive. There is no room service available and the hotel restaurant has a limited menu. And there is only one Ice machine in the entire hotel and it’s on the 1st floor minor inconvenience.
review.negativeRemarks: Add Room Service
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is within walking distance (or a trolley ride down).

review.title: Great Weekend
review.reviewText: Great Valentines weekend. Hotel was great, Staff was excellent. Restaurants around there were very difficult to get into but the neighborhood is Excellent. Would stay here again. Oh yea. heated towel racks impressed my wife.
review.negativeRemarks: Food available later in the evening
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants near by are excellent. Shopping near by- Just jump on a trolley on the corner, and you can go anywhere.

review.title: Great Staff, Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Welcoming, clean, cable car right outside. It is San Francisco so if you want to walk, remember those hills can be steep. Close to many attractions, and cable cars will get you to many others. Concierge staff very knowledgeable and other staff very pleasant.
The room was clean and well appointed, heated towel rack and complimentary water a nice touch.

Beautiful hotel from the exterior, lobby, and lounge area downtown and only about two blocks from Chinatown. I didn't appreciate that the restroom was smelly and especially that our comfortable had a 6" in diameter stain. The bartender was terrible and the drinks were overpriced. My rate 2/5.

review.title: Limited Food Service
review.reviewText: I was disappointed to learn that the hotel does not have any food service after the mid-day and no room service. I arrived at approximately 2:30 p.m. and could not order any food. Instead, I was told I could have pizza delivered. This was a bit disappointing.

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to everything, you can walk everywhere and cable car is just around the corner. Staff members were helpful and friendly and always with a smile.

review.title: disappointment
review.reviewText: My rating is a lot lower, based on several things not working like phone, heater, wake up calls, etc. and based on the manager, Mr. McGinnis, gypping me out of one night comp. His way of compensating is to count one night as a half price and the rest as a double, so the refund was just half a night. My rating is 2 out of 5.
review.positiveRemarks: The building is nice, some employees are nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Managers should not be gypping guests saying the first night is free but it costs 1/2 of other nights.

review.title: Ridiculous
review.reviewText: Arrived at 1:15 am and check in only to thave the manager come out and say sorry we are over booked. They wanted to put us in some junk hotel and then called the Fairmont (they said their were no rooms there) anyway ended up at the Fairmont for one night. No room service and a far cry from a hotel that was once great. Have been coming to the Stanford Court for over 35 years and will never come back again. Then when checking out they tried to overcharge us.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Good Location thats it

review.title: Car parking
review.reviewText: The hotel in General was good, the room comfortable and clean, good service , But Car parking very expensive value

review.title: Special location with exceptionally friendly and h
review.reviewText: It was really convenient for us and whenever we needed something the staff provided us with assistance.

review.title: Great firstime visit to San Fran
review.reviewText:
The Stanford Court is centrally located, so we were able to use public transportation to get everywhere we wanted to go. There were plenty of restaurants & shops within walking distance, so the walks downhill were easy..uphill, not so easy.

The concierge staff was wonderful. They were friendly, knowledgeable and really helped us plan a sightseeing itinerary that was perfect for our visit.

My only minor complaint: Housekeeping only left 1 washcloth in our room, on most days of our visit There were 2 of us in the room, 4-6 towels, but only 1 wash cloth. I had to call to request a second one. Minor issue, easily resolved, but why was it an issue to begin with..I guess no one's perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location, cleanliness, staff, open, relaxing lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - great shopping John's Grill - great steakhouse

review.reviewText: I'm used to the services of The Trump so this did not compare ! No in room dining available, concierge not as helpful and expect to be paid for the crap service and she had attitude !! Wanted a bucket of ice bought to the room and they didn't want to do it. Not part of their service... If you are hungry anytime of the night there wasn't even a snack machine. Overall not happy with the service but the hotel was clean and handy to everywhere I wanted to go to.

review.title: Very disappointing Nob Hill hotel.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this property in the past. When I stayed previously it was an elegrant property with all the services and facilities that one would expect from a 4 star Nob Hill hotel. In the interim they have clearly decided to reduce the "typical" things one would expect. No room service, limited breakfast (more liking a grab and go at Starbucks - but even more expensive). I should have realized that when the Front Desk associates are in jeans, the hotel has changed it business model. When I told them I did not have a Room Directory in my room, they referred me to a "desk calendar" on the desk in the room. As for lunch the DESK CALENDAR basically said just go to any of the 3000+ places in SFO. No gift shop or place to purchase basic items - went across the street to the Fairmont and got those items. I will definitely not return.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: My stay was excellent. Great staff, very clean and comfortable rooms, and great exercise facility. I had a room facing the street and the passing cable cars were a bit noisy. Nothing ear plugs can't fix! I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel. Great view.
review.reviewText: The only thing I didn't like is that it is on a very steep hill. My wife is pregnant so she had to take like 20 breaks just to go up one block. Thank God for the trolley!

review.title: Great Nob Hill location
review.reviewText: Very convenient location, away from the hustle and bustle (tourists) associated with SoMa and Embarcadero areas.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to a few nice local restaurants, Top of the Mark

review.title: Nice small hotel with many creature comforts.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed this hotel. Bar, lounge--everything.
review.positiveRemarks: Cozy, quiet, clean, friendly, nice common areas, free wifi, atomosphere
review.locationRemarks: Location is fine, just make sure you take the trolly up the hill if you have roller luggage. Quite neighborhood.

review.title: Nice location, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and welcoming. The room was nice and provided an excellent view of the city. The cable cars passed the hotel, but we did not find this to be bothersome. It is a great central location, making it easy for us to get around on foot and by cable car. The hotel does not have a fine-dining dinner restaurant, but with so many great restaurants in the city, this shouldn't keep anyone from staying at the Stanford.
review.negativeRemarks: Could use room service.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great! All bars and restaurants that interested us were nearby.

photos.caption: A beautiful morning sunrise from our room

review.title: Great gem in a beautiful location
