review.reviewText: We stayed in San Francisco on a Friday & Saturday night. We were pleasantly surprised at the location of the hotel and the beauty of the neighborhood. We had a great experience, the hotel was very clean, the staff was helpful and accommodating. Each front desk kiosk had a little board with an employee bio and entertainment/restaurant recommendations- which we actually used! We loved the hotel and would definitely stay there again. The only thing we would do differently is ask for an interior room because it was a bit loud at night with the cable cars. Other than that, we loved it!

review.title: Poor amenities
review.reviewText:
Very disappointed to arrive and not have room service or wet bar. Every time I wanted something to eat or drink (other than 2 cups of regular coffee - one day only 1 cup), I had to get dressed and to downstairs or out of hotel ( and down hill!) Restaurant only open for breakfast and dinner. Made it very difficult and inconvenient to work in room.

Also, very limited amenities in room. Only small bottles of shampoo, conditioner, body wash and lotion. No robe, slippers, Q-tips, pad of paper, pen, etc.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
close to Union squire, theatres....It has its own charm . Rooms are small but clean. Quite basic facilities (no swimming pool and spa) but ok for a short stay. Its a little bit noisy because of trams.

Overall - good value. I would stay again
review.negativeRemarks: Introduce a European style coffee place in the hotel or nearby where a good coffee could be offered in real coffee cups (alternative to Starbacks)

review.title: Nob hill life for a few days
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, modern yet charming, the room was large and cozy, and the neiborhood is upper class perfect location for walking to many famous bars and restuarants. Great deals on rooms also! I paid $127. Plus 20 Fee per night and got an overaized room with a view of the bay. Couldnt ask for more!

review.title: Nice and close to the beach
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay

review.title: Nice Hotel Worth the Money
review.reviewText: Had a pleasant stay. Walking distance to Union Square; a bit of uphill walk is a good daily exercise; railcar stop is right outside the hotel so very convenient to go to Fisherman's Wharf. Rooms are clean and quite; a good selection of news papers. Breakfast was not included in the rate but it is easy to find a few nearby local dinners.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wireless internet.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square and many shops, not far away from Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, and China Town.

review.title: Wasn't sure what to expect
review.reviewText: It was great from beginning to end.. We got a great view of union square on the 8th floor. Front desk was fantastic. The room was chic with a nice marble tub. Will stay again!
had a great time walked close enough for all food and beers

review.title: Nice place in great neighborhood
review.reviewText: The only complaint we had was no room service, (sometimes you just need that), and the menu in the downstairs bar was very limited.

review.title: Not Again
review.reviewText:
At a change of plans and decided to stay in San Francisco. We arrived at the hotel after 10:30 and checked into the room. What a disappointment!
The last time I saw a room the small was when I first traveled to New York. The bathroom was in need of maintenance. At least, the grout could have been much cleaner. My lady friend detected some body hairs in the tub. A real turnoff.
The king size bed had a pillow top which did not fit. Halfway through the evening we realize were sleeping on the top of the mattress rather than the pillow top. We woke up and readjusted the pillow top. Amazing!
So while the price point was goo the room quality, cleanlines and comfort were extremely disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Room quality, cleanliness and comfort.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square and restaurants.
review.reviewText: We had a great time. We took the cable cars some days; the cable cars stops within a few feet from the hotel. But most of the time we walked to union square from the hotel. China town, which was next to little Italy; both in walking distance from the hotel as well. This was a great location for us to stay...walking distance from shopping and restaurants!!

review.title: Great Nob Hill Location
review.reviewText: Easy to get to everything in Downtown SF. Staff was friendly and helpful. I'd certainly stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: in room desk could be more comfortable
review.locationRemarks: Easy to go anywhere using the cable car right outside.

review.title: Hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice.
review.reviewText:
My travel happiness is determined by bed comfort, fitness facilities and cleanliness. The hotel was great on all of those. The only downside I saw was the expense of a cup of coffee in the AM. $3.60 for a coffee in a small cup is a bit excessive, but when you sit down there long enough you can take advantage of the refills.

Overall, it's a great location and easy to get to and from. Definitely great place to stay in SF!
review.negativeRemarks: prices in the restaurant
review.locationRemarks: location is central to everything.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Valley parking is expensive! Location is great,not far from union square

review.title: Exceeded our expectations
review.reviewText: We found the hotel on Expedia and were very pleased with the hotel. Check in was easy, the staff was extremely friendly. We received an upgraded from Queen to King. The hotel room was very clean. Lots of free cable channel. Bathrooms, showers were very nice. The hotel was near Chinatown but it was very clean and quiet. We did not hear any street traffic and the area was extremely safe. We will definitely come back and stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: It was quiet and safe. The hotel staff was very friendly. They have free internet service, nice restaurant. It was an awesome experience.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of a thing!
review.locationRemarks: It's close enough to Chinatown where you can walk there. I enjoyed that it was a safe area and we did not hear street noise.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel is steps to the cable car and a short walk to Union Square. We parked the car and use public transportation for the whole day and evening. It was perfect - costly for the parking, but worth it. The deluxe room was very comfortable. I would like to have breakfast included in the cost, but not a necessity.
review.negativeRemarks: I would like to have breakfast included.
review.locationRemarks: Union square was walking distance, as was the cable car stop (which takes you to Fisherman's Wharf). The California and Geary buses were also close.

review.title: Great hotel to be close to the action!
review.reviewText:
Blocks from Union Sq. and Chinatown and great restaurants. It sits on the cable car line which makes it truly a San Francisco experience and easy transportation.
The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms large, mixing old world and new convenience.
The staff was all friendly and nice, from our reservation person to the doormen.
There is no room service, but coffee in the room and a restaurant downstairs, plus great restaurants all around the city.

review.title: A great place but maybe not for everyone
review.reviewText:
We had stayed at the Stanford Court years ago and decided to try it again. It has since been remodeled with the big downside being the wonderful restaurant (Fourneau's Oven) is now gone.
We had a room on the corner of Powell and California, which provided a stunning view, but the clatter of the cable cars all night was extremely noisy. However, that was an easy fix: all we had to do was ask the concierge for ear plugs, and the kind they have actually work.
That being said, it is still not as noisy as staying on Union Square. We really prefer the residential feel of Nob Hill to the hustle and bustle of the square.
One thing that might not make some people happy is that since it is a "court", the elevators are on one side only. Our room happened to be at the exact opposite of the building, which meant walking the equivalent of about 2 half blocks every time we went to the elevator. This did not bother us, but we could see where it would bother some people. If is does, ask for a room near the elevators.
review.positiveRemarks: Very well appointed rooms. Very clean. Good amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: The food service needs improvement. The breakfast items felt like fast food.. This impression could be mitigated by tasteful plating.
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq. is a walk down a steep hill, not to mention walking back up again. But this was fine with us. The cable car but it is right out the door.

review.title: The delightful staff
review.reviewText: While the hotel is lovely the staff is stellar! Each person was helpful, cheerful and quick to accommodate my needs. My room was very comfortable and clean. I don't travel a lot so perhaps some of the things that impressed me are routine these days but I loved the safe and the towel warmer. My bed was extremely comfortable. The extra bed that was brought in for my granddaughter the first night was amazing bit of technology. When I requested the bed be removed it was done quickly and cheerfully.
review.locationRemarks: The Stanford Court in at the top of Nob Hill and very conveniently located. I fell in love with a little cafe down on Powell Street where I had brunch

review.title: Good location. Check in and out was quick.
review.reviewText: Overall it was good. Check in was quick. No problem with anything during our stay. The only thing to complain about is how slow the elevator was.
review.locationRemarks: Walkable to numerous restaurants and bars.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: This hotel it's located in a fantastic spot of the city!, very central good views, no homeless or sketchy people, definitely I wanna stay there again, me and my Girlfriend had a fabulous time in the City.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.positiveRemarks: Central Location and generous sized room.
review.negativeRemarks: Knowledge of staff of surrounding areas.
review.locationRemarks: Really central. About 4 blocks downhill to union square district and right on the cable car route.

review.reviewText: The only complaint that I had was that we had to wait till 3:45 to check in despite having other rooms available, but not for Expedia reservations

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: I hadn't stayed at the Standord Court in about 15 years. The place was not as good as it used to be but still decent. The bell and front desk staff were very friendly but the concierge was terribly unfriendly and not helpful at all. There used to be a full service resturaunt there, but now there's just a bar lounge. To sum up my experience, the hotel is a good enough place to sleep and shower at but it's not a 5 star experience. Definitely a 3 star hotel in my opinion.

Not super clean, but I am a clean freak! I think this is as good as it gets for a hotel there. That's based on reading reviews of the orher 4 star hotels. Not great toiletries. I thought the beds were great and had feather pillows. I asked for an interior room so I had no problem with the noise. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Great deal...great location
review.reviewText: Had a wedding to attend so with three rooms and two nights to pay for we were happy with the deal and how close it was to the Presidio as well as shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great and the rooms were comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a great breakfast available.
room size is pretty small
review.locationRemarks: shopping at union square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in s great lovcstion.easy to walk to restaurants, very close to Chinatown, right on the trolley stop and close to shopping! The hotel staff recommended a nice Italian restaurant called Firenze by night on Stockton - great food, great service. She also recommended to stop by a fortune cookie factory in Chinatown _ it was located in a dark alley and only locals would know. It was small but a really neat place to see how fortune cookies are made. They gave lots of samples and the bags were cheap. The only negative it is the noise from the trolleys and the bed in our room was horrible_ a queen size bed that sagged horribly in the middle_ this was in room 421. Other than that, it is a lovely hotel

review.title: convenient to union square and many si g h t se ei
review.reviewText: perfect except parking
We were given teh key to a room that was already occupied. The AC unit in the eventual hotel room was very loud.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: I got a pretty good deal on this hotel and was not disappointed! The staff were all great and the room was pleasing with a great king bed and great linens. This is an older hotel, so the room layout was a bit old fashioned with the closet in the bathroom, but that isn't much of a problem. The only other thing of note is the refrigerator is not stocked. You can't even ask for it to be stocked. Would be nice if they could have a menu for these items to be brought up (although I didn't check the room service menu which generally doesn't stock snacks.) But for the price I paid, I have no real complaints, The hotel delivered a great experience. They even give you a comp bottle of water which is a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Availability of snack menu (although to be fair, I didn't check the room service menu)
review.locationRemarks: It's a short cab ride away from Union Square, and you can do everything there (I work downtown.)

review.reviewText: As much as they charge you to stay here they don't give you complimentary anything, staff is not very helpful or informative on the city. The nicest people were the maids and the guys who open the doors all day. $3 for a cup of joe? Need I say more

review.title: Nice and comfy, Great location.
review.reviewText:
We're a young couple who stayed at the Stanford and our overall experience was good. It is worth it because it's in a great location! You can visit most of the main attractions by walking from the hotel. The room is clean and the bed is comfortable.
The only issue we had was the noise. Our bedroom was by an alley and you could hear the delivery trucks and garbage trucks at 5am.

review.title: Old school SF hotel; very reasonable rate.
review.reviewText: Stately old school hotel; got a great rate. Dated decor and some glitches in cleaning, but friendly staff. Parking is $50 a night, though!
review.negativeRemarks: Decor and cleaning
review.locationRemarks: Near the top of California street, so be prepared to do a lot of treking up and downhill. But with that in mind it's close to everything.

review.title: Beautiful hotel marginal service.
review.reviewText: Doormen got us a cab (gypsy cab)-an expensive (double what we paid on other trips to and from Union Square) one and the driver was very rude. It seems like the pursuit of gratuities and cab referal fees comes ahead of the customer's requests. Upon check out, we left bags with front desk to shop and site see after check out. Upon return the front desk insisted they would take them to our vehicle after we had requested them ourselves.

review.title: Location is great!!
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this property before when it was a Marriott. The hotel has since departed from the Marriott and is now managed by Highgate Hotels. The change was made a few months ago. The quality appears lower. There was nothing in particular wrong - just an overall impression. It seems as if it is not being maintained at the same level. The bed was made poorly - they sheets were wrinkled and the bed seemed quickly put together. The front desk staff's uniforms were too causal and appear unprofessional. We didn't try the restaurant -it was empty. However, the location is still fantastic and the property is "ok" - just not at the level it was before.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - interior color choice - very soothing. Valet and bellmen were great!
review.negativeRemarks: New uniforms - cleaner property

review.title: Great hotel with a lot of history.
review.reviewText: Only there two nights but very enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location, staff, and reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: Open the old restaurant that used to be there on the corner.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to trolley and China Town

review.positiveRemarks: Good location. Very opulent. Impressed with the facilities.

photos.caption: View from Room 845 at the Stanford Court Hotel

review.title: Fantastic luxury deal
review.reviewText: We got a great rate for a very nice hotel in a great location--and with a fantastic view. The staff was friendly and helpful. Of course, it did not hurt that the mid December weather in San Francisco was fantastic. And the fact that we had a spacious room with a terrific view made the experience all that much sweeter.
review.negativeRemarks: The hallway carpet is not to our taste.
review.locationRemarks: Walk or take the cable car to North Beach and Fisherman's wharf, Union Square or down to the Financial District and the Ferry Building.

review.title: Nice stay in SF
review.reviewText: When Expedia put San Francisco hotels on sale, rooms started filling up quickly. I booked the Stanford Court based on price and location. Both proved excellent. Walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown. We stayed actually twice...once on the way to Napa and on the way back. Our rooms faced the interior court or the building next door, but our friends were right on the cable car route, and they were awakened at dawn. As usual...location, location, location
review.positiveRemarks: Good bar and restaurant. Staff was friendly and very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: More ice machines on the upper floors. Parking was too expensive.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: A great nights rest...
review.reviewText: I will definitely go back to this hotel. The staff was fantastic and the location is perfect if wanting to explore that part of the City. Close to Grace Cathedral as well as the Big Four (a super place to grab a nightcap). In the morning your steps away from Chinatown and major shopping. SF is not your typical walking city but this location makes it possible.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This is right in the center of everything. Great restaurants all around and lots of fun stuff to see and do.
review.negativeRemarks: The coffee downstairs was 3.50 for an 8 ounce cup! CRAZY. Most hotels have complimentary coffee.

review.title: Positive and negative points
review.reviewText: Driving up to the hotel was an excellent experience with friendly and helpful valet parking attendant Joshua and bellhop. The front desk and concierge desk staff, however, we're very dry and unfriendly. No smiles or welcoming greetings at check-in, checkout, or upon returning from our event in the evening. Suggestion: desk staff should look up and be friendly, not keep their heads down waiting for guests to initiate greeting. Positive points: Joshua in valet parking, comfortable and clean room, great location, nice and very helpful housekeeping staff, umbrellas provided by hotel on rainy day.

review.title: Moderately priced comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Moderately priced comfortable hotel close to union square and public transportation.

review.title: California Street hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was located near other higher end hotels. Room price per night was the same as what we paid for a nights stay at a lower end hotel in Venice, California the same week and the Stanford Court property was much nicer. Although, we booked a queen bed room @San Francisco and a king bed in Venice Beach. The room cleaniness was very comparable. However, the room was rather small for the amount of furnishings in the room. Kept running into the desk or the over sized chair in the room. Nice furnishings but really needed to be in a larger sized room. The website offered a good rate...however we missed the fine print about no street or free parking. Only valet service for parking and it was $60 per night.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was really friendly, helpful and courteous at each encounter. Valet service even greeted us by name.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer more parking options
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Grace Cathedral and cable car routes were located within the same block and very easy on and off the cars.

review.reviewText: Enjoyable
review.locationRemarks: We like walking down to Union Square

review.reviewText: The room is clean and comfortable. But I could not find any food room service. The hotel is located on a hill so you need to climb when coming back from union square.

review.title: Clean. Comport room.
review.reviewText: Small room. But quiet. Nice staff. Very good hotel.

review.title: Very beautiful hotel on Nob Hill.
review.reviewText: This is a very beautiful hotel on Nob Hill close to Union Square and lots of fine dinning within walking distance. It is at the intersection of two cable car lines which can take you to other locations such as Fisherman's Wharf or Ghirardelli Square. My only downgrade as to room comfort was because our room, although beautiful with a view of the bay faced the two cable car lines. Cable cars are very noisy, and we had difficulty sleeping the first night. The hotel staff cheerfully moved us to another very nice room (no view) which was peacefully quiet, and we slept well. All in all, a wonderful experience we would do it again, but ask for a room which is not next to the cable car lines.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful lovely large room.Located in Nob Hill area which is great to potter around on foot
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were excellent - we arrived really early after a cruise our room was ready for us.The room was large well equipped and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Very little except perhaps the carpets getting a bit tired
review.locationRemarks: We explored the area with its lovely buildings on foot.Grace cathedral well worth a visit as is the cable car museum which is free.

review.title: Central to Nob Hill & near Union Square
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay.

review.title: Stanford Court is the place to stay!
review.reviewText: Stanford Court is a wonderful hotel. Service was outstanding! The hotel staff recommended several nice places to eat and helped us with directions. We had a car and the valet parking was prompt when requesting our car. Very clean and for a large city the room was very quiet. Centrally located we could walk to the Masonic Lodge where we attended a concert. Walking distance to Union Station, Chinatown, and more. Cable Car stop right outside the hotel. Great views!
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing, everything was great.

review.title: very classy
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very good location, we,ll go back again.

Our stay was very brief so I can't add many details. Two areas of disappointment however; no one at the entrance to take the car to an offsite location for parking. We waited for some time for an attendant and finally someone showed. Breakfast on Sunday was not the pleasant sit-down restaurant we recalled from a few years back. This time a buffet /cafeteria style set up where you placed order and then it was brought to you at a dining area nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill is a real hill. you can walk a lot of places but the incline is steep going up and you fight gravity going down. Cable car is noisey.

review.reviewText: Great location. Beautiful view of the city from our room. Quiet on the fifth floor. Close to everything. On top of "Nob Hill" so be prepared to walk up and down hills. Trolley right outside of hotel. $6/one way or $14/day pass. Very helpful concierge. FYI: much cheaper to take shuttle to and from airport than taxi from hotel. $50/taxi, shuttle was $14/per person.

review.title: Great city view
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great! Location is good if you love a good view. The room was a bit smaller than expected for the price.
Hotel isn't what it used to be.

review.title: Very comfortable and pleasant hotel.
review.reviewText: Though the dark and low-ceilinged lobby is not very welcoming, our room was extremely comfortable and well equipped. Breakfast leaves something to be desired, with coffee in paper cups --more like the free breakfast in lower-ranked hotels - but charged for at higher rates. Overall, though, an excellent hotel in a prime location --right nect to the Mark Hopkins on Nob Hill.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Central location. Walk to financial district and Chinatown. On two cable car routes. No room service was a drawback.

review.title: Not a 4* hotel
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately this hotel is not worthy of the 4*s it has been granted.

We were not given the room we had booked, a double queen, consequently one member of our party was subject to sleeping 5 nights on an air bed.

The airbed was not made up for us, we had to make the bed up having had the bedlinen dumped on top - not what you expect when staying in any hotel

The bathrooms and rooms are small, the windows are single glazed and you can hear the street noise very loudly

There is no in-room service, you have to order from the bar and wait to collect, but there is no tea/coffee making facilities in room either.

There are nicer places to stay in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: A great deal!

review.title: Nice after check in problems due to overbooking
review.reviewText: Enjoyed stay after first night spent in small room due to having oversold larger rooms. Did not get into a room til 8pm. Other than that good fitness room, good bar and bar food. No restaurant. Definite hike uphill from downtown. Helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't over book rooms
review.locationRemarks: Prepare for cardio workout getting up Powell St from Union Square area.

review.title: Great hotel but no room service!
review.reviewText: Had a great time at this hotel- close to union square and all the shopping and commute. Only prob is no room service! I asked for some cutlery to eat my 'take away' meal but I was told that isnt provided.

review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary coffee, juice, beverages and continental breakfast in morning....

review.reviewText: I stayed 3 nights at the Stanford Court, visiting my son, who works in SF. It's my third time staying there -- the location, on Nob Hill near Chinatown, is great for me, the rooms are comfortable, and the staff is helpful, e.g. finding restaurant reservations.
review.negativeRemarks: The only downside, on rooms facing Calif and Powell streets, is the noise from the cable-cars, but you can ask for high-floor or interior-facing rooms
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, the Ferry building, the cable cars, Embarcadero and Nob Hill sights are all a short walk away.

review.title: Nice hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Great experience. The staff was very accomodating assisted us with a last minute request to stay an extra night and kept us in our same room. Looking forward to taking my family there.

review.title: Fantastic experience
review.reviewText:
The standford court hotel is located so that it is in walking distance of all of the great places (mainly tourist attractions) of San Francisco. Just a short walk to china town- try R&D Chinese restaurant (yummy but a bit pricey), the Ferry Building, the Exploratorium, the dock for Alcatraz, and the Bay Area. Not only is this hotel in a great location, it was friendly, the bed was probably the most comfy bed I have slept in and Internet access was free - with MACs and a printer in the hotel lobby. We didn't try the breakfast- so can't comment- we went to mama's instead - it's a must try - but be prepared to queue!
Overall 9 out of 10! Only downside that parking was v expensive in our opinion- $50 a night!
Enjoy!
review.negativeRemarks: Could offer bottles of water in the room. Improve service at the bar- it was a bit slow!
review.locationRemarks: Mamas for breakfast, shop in china town, Alcatraz is a must, go to the bottom of the golden gate, visit the bay for a snack,Exploratorium was good fun

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms were nicely appointed and facilities were very clean, but valet parking was very pricey.
review.negativeRemarks: better parking for guests
review.locationRemarks: nice Nob Hill location

review.title: Top of the hill.
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, windows that open, huge bathroom (not sure why), but good, very soft linens throughout! On the hill which made for some extreme uphill climbs after shopping?? Try that after a couple drinks, cabs are plentiful though, with the exception of Chinatown at night (don't recommend that).
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, friendly staff. Concierge staff .
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in process rather painful, seemed like the first time. Noise from the entrance carried up through the courtyard (at least at the 3rd floor).
review.locationRemarks: All that San Francisco has to offer, shopping, Union Square, cable car stop right out the door.

review.title: clean, comfortable and reasonable value
review.reviewText: stayed here because it was the best price for the amenities during the nike women's marathon. staff is nice, professional but nothing memorable. room is clean and has everything you'd normally expect. they are configured differently from room to room. downside is that we got one that was a little smaller but it was in the interior so it was quiet. i suppose that is luck of the draw. they didn't have room service which was a definite downside and no hotel restaurants. they did have a morning bistro area and an evening lounge/bar which were both nice. it is almost at the very top of nob hill so in order to eat, most restaurants are down the hill at least a couple of blocks. be prepared to walk or take a cab. it is about a 6-7 block walk down powell street to union square and it only takes about 5 minutes but it is a serious hill. i consider myself pretty fit (i ran the half marathon) but my calves and hamstrings were tight after a couple of days of walking that hill, but i like that kind of stuff. it is conveniently located to chinatown, financial district, north beach, embarcadero, fisherman's wharf and of course union square. i think the most we paid in cab fare was to the wharf and that was around 8-ish dollars. i would definitely stay again as it was worth the value.
review.positiveRemarks: clean rooms, comfortable beds, professional staff. quiet rooms, very little to no outside noise.nothing out of the ordinary but what you would expect.
review.negativeRemarks: dining options in the hotel & room service.
review.locationRemarks: top of nob hill close to Grace Cathedral, easy to jump on the cable cars right outside, great location as it is close to everything.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We only stayed a day but had such a great time. The hotel is in a great neighborhood a few blocks walk from everything. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. Will definetly return.

review.title: No Room Service!
review.reviewText: I liked everything about my stay with the exception of no room service. As a result I will not be booking again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bring back room service !

review.title: Late Check In
review.reviewText: Arrived at 630 pm, but was told room would not be ready until 830 pm. Other travelers were waiting the the lounge for check in as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Ability to check in with no delays after stated check-in time

review.title: Good location, easy distance from key attractions
review.reviewText: Good food, well-appointed gym, clean, but could do with better tea/coffee making facilities in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Tea making facilities in the room, breakfasts a bit limited
review.locationRemarks: Near Union square and Lori's 50s Diner (for Breakfast) as well as easy access to the cable car for travel further afield.

review.title: Comfortable, central location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay the Bellman Henry was very helpful!

review.title: Hotel location is good but the hotel rooms are sma
review.reviewText: They charge a lot for what you get rooms were small parking price a joke. One small elevators on one side of Building and it took forever to go up or down.

review.title: Great location. Service lacking.
review.reviewText: Location is nice. Facilities are cramped and the people at the desk are not very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: People. Elevators are too slow. Stairs are locked.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Great location, close to Chinatown, union square, cable cars! Be prepared to walk uphill. We bought a three-day passport so we took the cable cars all the time, which ran both directions at the intersection. Hotel and room was nice, my only complaint was that you can hear everything in the hallways.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Great location great facilities decorated with amazing taste, could not have been happier!

review.title: Enjoyed stay in Stanford Court
review.reviewText: Late changes to our travel plans meant that we had to make a late booking . At the time all other hotels were full but Stanford Court was able to accommodate us at late notice.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to center of city. Cable cars near by.
review.locationRemarks: Good location and close to piers and Embarcadero in general. America's Cup on at time we stayed so able to be close to race.

review.title: What Happened to this Premier Hotel?
review.reviewText: The room was small and dated and cost almost $700 for one night. No amenities. No restaurant in hotel other than a bar with food service, no room service, and no in-room honor bar. BYOB, BYOF, BYO Everything. I realize it was Oracle World week, but the value was not there. My wife and I have stayed at the hotel in the past and it was a first rate hotel then. Not anymore, or maybe I simply didn't get the best treatment.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was courteous and I feel fortunate to have a room during Oracle World week.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities needed such as Room Service, a restaurant, and in-room honor bar.
review.locationRemarks: Lots nearby but I needed to stay in and work

review.title: Terrible Place This is not 4 Stars
review.reviewText: I dont know how Expedia has this hotel listed at a 4 star hotel this place was far from evan a 3 star hotel.

review.title: Very easy to find and very clean
review.reviewText: Clean, dont like paying over 200.00 a night and frig and parking extra NOT GOOD
review.negativeRemarks: paying extra for parking and refrig
review.locationRemarks: union square trolly

review.title: going downhill
review.reviewText: a once elegant hotel now without dining facilities; mediocre furniture in rooms

review.title: Fancy Nob Hill Hotel in Need of Service Training
review.reviewText:
Given the price point and location of this hotel I would expect superior customer service. The front desk staff could benefit from a refresher course on hospitality and service minded performance. From the start they appeared unconcerned in how they presented themselves.

Be prepared for small rooms which feel more cramped then cozy and an athletic endeavor climbing the 45 degree inclined hill just to get to them. This would not be a first choice accommodation for SF.

review.title: overpriced
review.reviewText: the room was 3xs expensive as other places I stay but due to a large conference that week I guess they found it appropriate to jack the price by over 100% the room didn'y have 1 thing in it other than a bottle of water. mini bar fridge, all empty. not even a pen
review.negativeRemarks: the price
review.locationRemarks: union square

review.title: On top of the Hill
review.reviewText: Great vacation while staying at this great facility. Great rooms and attentive staff. Quiet location and close to everything in bay area.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was perfect. Close to downtown shopping , restaurants and transit hub for easy access to San Francisco and the bay area.
review.negativeRemarks: All is good.
review.locationRemarks: Blocks away from Union Square, shopping & restaurants, MUNI / BART transit hub , Chinatown, Yerba Beuna Centre / SFMOMA, and on two cable car routes

review.title: Nice hotel, in a very nice area
review.reviewText: Our room was on the busy street side, not a "relaxing" room noise wise but it had a great view. The hotel staff was very friendly and attentive.

review.title: nice hotel, great location... would stay again
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night and stumbled upon it when most of the places I normally stay were either sold out or priced at 2x what we are used to paying... glad this worked out as I'll add this to the list of places I'll look for in the future. Location is convenient to Financial District as well as more touristy places... and overall a very pleasant place.
review.positiveRemarks: location, clean and updated, nice staff

review.title: Great location, central to many sites.
review.reviewText: Celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary at this hotel. Did not want to stay in the "usual" type of hotel. Wanted a more unique experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern decorating, bed comfort, and well equipped fitness room.
review.negativeRemarks: Let guests use the staircase. Elevators are slow. Food court is pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location. Cable car can be accessed from all four corners. Can walk to Union Square and ferry building if needed and. In shape.

review.title: Great location for the plrice
review.reviewText: All was great but the rooms facing the main street (whilst big) are a little noisy. Other than that could not fault the hotel.

review.title: Good location and friendly staffs
review.reviewText: Shon was very helpful at the Front Desk. He was friendly and extended warm recognition to the guests.

review.title: Great hotel, great location, staff excellent
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I took a long weekend getaway up to SF to sightsee, visit friends and watch Ohio St v Cal football game. We arrived at 9:30 AM and did not expect to be able to check in early, but the hotel was able to get us in our room right away. We were so pleased after travelling all morning to be able to unwind for an hour in our room. The room I booked was a Premier View King, and was exactly what I had hoped for. It was on the top floor of the hotel with a great view of the bay bridge, the bay and parts of the embarcadero. Staff was very helpful and the room was very clean. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very friendly and accomodating, clean room, great location, great 8th floor view room.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I was bummed about was the prices at the hotel bar. A Heineken in a bottle was $8.30 plus tip. I was not expecting to get hit that hard
review.locationRemarks: Grace cathedral, north beach bars and restaurants, financial district and union square all close

review.title: Excellent hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in good shape, clean and the staff is friendly. The location is at the intersection of 2 cable car lines, at the top of Nob Hill. We were lucky enough to get a room with a great view. Because the cable cars are so busy, I recommend checking out the MUNI routes for getting around SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, nice rooms, good beds. Breakfast is nice and affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, there really is none. Best not to have a car while in the city.
review.locationRemarks: At the intersection of 2 cable car lines. But be warned the cable cars are busy, and you can wait hours at the far ends to get home at night.

review.title: Great service!
review.reviewText: Great staff, warm welcoming, comfy beds!! Location was great, tons of places to see and do!
review.negativeRemarks: Prices's' for car lots!
review.locationRemarks: Everything was close by, shopping, restaurants, and site seen!!

review.title: Great Hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Excellent foyer and bar area, nice spot and very reasonably priced. Staff were excellent consistently. Rooms were a little dated, but for those intending not to spend much time in the room this is an excellent choice for San Fran!!

review.title: Worst room in the hotel
review.reviewText: Bottom floor near carport. Hotel noises all day and night. Staff said if we have complaint then we need to speak with Expedia
review.negativeRemarks: Better room location

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText:
Delightful hotel while we were in town to attend a baseball game.
Comfortable bed with luxurious linens. All staff were polite & helpful.
Checking in & out was quick & efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed linens were lovely. Breakfast price was reasonable with partial self serve items.
review.locationRemarks: Good location on Nob Hill on Cable Car route.

review.title: Great hotel with excellent customer service
review.reviewText: We stayed for four nights. We had a room at the back which was nice and quiet. Rooms were clean and serviced well. The staff are very friendly. The only negative is the hotels location which is on top of a steep hill, hence you need to be super fit to get back to the hotel , otherwise had a very pleasant stay.
review.locationRemarks: Is very close to the tourist area and union square and the cable car is out the front.

review.title: Not great for Nob Hill hotel.
review.reviewText: Snobby unfriendly service, especially from front desk crew. No smiles, just cold and uncaring. Special requests were ignored, as well. Would not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is not bad: Nob Hill and near Financial District/Embarcadero,
review.negativeRemarks: The service was awful. Unfriendly staff (other than Valet/Bell staff). Very unwelcoming.
review.locationRemarks: Location is not bad: Nob Hill and near Financial District/Embarcadero,

review.title: Nice hotel but expected more for the money
review.reviewText: Stanford Court was a lovely hotel located in the heart of the city, but I expected a little bit more for the cost of the stay at a four-star hotel. We had difficulty finding the hotel at night even with the address and GPS and valet parking was quite pricey at $50 a day. Despite presenting my reservation number the clerk could not find our room for several minutes but did eventually get help to figure it out for us. Our room was clean and bright but the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in. Since there was no room service we went down to the bar and had the slowest service for drinks and appetizers I can remember. Fortunately, the room was quiet and the king bed was comfy. My high expectations just weren't met.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice design of common areas, room was quiet and the king bed was comfy
review.negativeRemarks: Service, braakfast and parking included
review.locationRemarks: Grave cathedral, Glide memorial, union square, Brenda's French soul food

review.title: Great location and great staff
review.reviewText: Courteous staff, very helpful. Great views and location

review.title: It was ok - our bed was really uncomfortable.
review.reviewText: Our room was dirty and wasn't ready when we arrived. Our bed was truly uncomfortable and our room was very noisy. For 200 a night I was disappointed.
review.locationRemarks: Location was average - close to china town

review.title: One overnight stay
review.reviewText: Checked in at 8 pm and the room was not ready yet so they gave me a upgrade

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: Not worth the price. Paid for a 5 star, stayed in a 3 star

review.title: no nonsense hotel
review.reviewText:
although i was travelling solo, i was given a large room (no 510) facing to the courtyard and very quiet.
The hotel is in very good condition, understated elegance, elevators worked perfectly, wi-fi free everywhere, there were computer stations available for those who didn't carry their laptop or tablet.
Although the bathroom was rather small, however adequate; toiletries & towels as expected. Bed & mattresses perfect; although i periodically suffer from back problems, here i didn't notice anything.
There was only breakfast available and no room service, but for me that's OK.
The hotel is in a very posh area, Nob Hill, adjacent to two other very elegant hotels: Fairmont & Intercontinental.
The only annoyance for me that i didn;t spot eateries or convenience stores very close to the hotel. You have to walk one or two blocks away.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and friendly staff. Great location. Very clean.

review.title: Central
review.reviewText: Enjoyable.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Central to the waterfront and Union Square

review.title: Never again. Horrific management
review.reviewText: Poor check in, poor customer service, feels more like a package holiday hotel rather than a city centre spot
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service

review.title: Close to the Mark Hopkins for an event
review.reviewText:
I needed to be close to the Mark Hopkins for a bridal shower and was disappointed in the room. It was just mediocre...not bad, but nothing special for the price we paid. So for location, it was tops as it would be for tourists ( I am a local). But felt it was overpriced but it has always had a reputation for being a classy hotel and I felt let down by that.. It mentioned in a brochure on the desk that towel warmers were in the bathroom...we didn't have them. I would say it was comparable to a Best Western, not a $250+ a night hotel.
The doorman was very classy however, as we're the bellmen and staff.
Parking is nearby and a bit cheaper or you can pay $50 for in and out privileges, but I didn't need that so I parked half a block away in another garage for $40. This is SF, after all, and parking is EXPENSIVE everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and proximity to where I needed to go the next morning
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms, tho maybe some of the other rooms are nicer.
review.locationRemarks: It's right on the cable car line which is not cheap anymore, but as a native San Franciscan, if you come here for a vacation, you have to try it.

review.title: Terrible service
review.reviewText: Got at the hotel at 9pm check in was at 4 and still had to wait three hours to check in. Staff was not very friendly. They didn't get to cleaning our room until late in the evenings when we were getting ready to go out. Too expensive for the quality of hotel. Far from downtown parking way too expensive cheaper downtown in the heart of the city. Waste of money and nothing special included even their food was terrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do near by everything is far away from this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, walking distance to shopping trolleys
review.reviewText: Very nice experience. Hotel staff was very nice, attentive and very accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: The ugly yellow polka dotted carpet in the hallways.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to great shopping, and trolleys

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Most of the staff in this hotel is great. If you don't know the area and need help finding a good restaurant or things to do, they have tons of recommendations depending on your taste. The rooms are a decent size for business travelers, but the dressing area doesn't have much counter space. The ironing board in my room was very shaky so I asked them to replace it the very first day but was never replaced. I had a restaurant charge on my bill when checking out, and I never ate in the hotel restaurant; the front desk person was able to confirm and take it off.

Good stay overall!

My favourite part about this hotel was the location and the gym. Its a nice little gym with some cardio equipment and free weights. The location is as convenient as it gets. If you are there for business, financial district is 5-10min walk, and the cable car stops right outside the hotel. Union square (the main shopping area) is a 10minute walk. Lots of other restaurants close by as well!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, some of the staff members were very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Old dirty carpet in the hallways, and tiny dressing area counters
review.locationRemarks: Central to financial district and union square

review.title: Horrible hotel stay away.
review.reviewText: The staff are the most unfriendly people I have met in the hospitality business.
review.negativeRemarks: A couple of restaurants and maybe a new compliment of front office staff. the only nice guys were the car valets and the doorman.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Not the cheapest option but in a great area. Restaurant is currently closed which is unfortunate.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights and it was very plesant. The hotel staff was incredibly warming and was very welcome to assist you. The food was amazing, the bed was super fluffy and comfortable. The room was big but not overwhelming. All around a great experience at this hotel
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the warm, homey feeling you get when you enter the door. Everyone's friendly and inviting. The rooms are great as well
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was pretty pricey so we didn't eat there everyday
review.locationRemarks: Great location. We walked to everywhere. The pier is about 13 blocks away and shopping is 10 or so. Plus there's a cable car right by

review.title: Great hotel on top of a hill.....
review.reviewText: Can recommend the hotel. Great location, reasonable priced, friendly staff. Try to get a room toward the courtyard though, cable car and traffic can't be kept out by shut windows!!
review.negativeRemarks: Updating the hotel rooms, better windows to get rid of street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location. High up and central to most places one wants to go. Bring comfy shoes, hill is steep!

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was nice. This was a very nice area of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing missing was a nice place to eat inside the hotel. The hotel only had a small breakfast menu in the bar area.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is at the top of Nob Hill. Many restaurants and shops are within walking distance.

review.title: Not Horrible, but Disappointing for the Cost
review.reviewText:
Some observations...

Valet and bell staff were extremely courteous and pleasant - front desk and maintenance staff not so much (can you guess which group relies on tips to make a living?).

Asked for a refrigerator for the room and they brought us one that looked like it had survived the 1906 earthquake and fires. Amazingly it was barely able to chill a bottle of water (and so small we couldn't fit much else in it.

The room smelled - not the stale musty hotel room smell but more of a 'the carpets haven't been cleaned in ages' smell.

No room service and only bar food available in the one small restaurant they have.

This place acts and charges as a 4 - 5 star hotel, hence the tepid review. If this were a 2 star joint the expectations would not be so high. However, my wife and I really stepped up and paid for what is listed on Expedia as a 4 star hotel and we were very disappointed. Save your money and go with a Holiday Inn - it will not be luxurious, but then again neither was the Stanford Court.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square in the heart of San Francisco - fantastic city with countless things to do!

review.title: No complaints here
review.reviewText: From the circle driveway to my guest room, I found the hotel visually appealing. I had limited experience with the staff, but the valet and bellman were polite and professional. The room was clean and comfortable. I did not use the amenities, so I cannot comment on them.
review.locationRemarks: There is a cluster of retail stores at the bottom of the hill on which the hotel sits. Stores include Macy's, H&M, Forever 21, and the like.

review.title: Great location on Nob Hill
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at the Stanford Court many times and ejabe always enjoyed going back there. Although the hotel was recently renovated, they could improve more, eg bathrooms have old showers, the sliding doors between room and bathroom need to go, propert closets need to he installed. Layout of the room was odd, with TV and sideboard against the side wall and not facing the bed. The refridgerator in the room was empty, a minor inconvenience which I did not bring to the hotel staff's attention.
The have done away with the restaurant, at least for breakfast but offered a cafetaria like service, somewhat of a dissappointment. All in all a satisfactory stay this time, but it would be a shame if they don't keep up with expected standards of today, and I sense the hotel is falling behind neighboring properties in the area.

review.title: Ideal location to take it all in
review.reviewText: Lovely room, very helpful staff. Allowed us to check in extra early as we had arrived on an early flight which is rare with many hotels
review.negativeRemarks: Pool, jacuzzi, etc would have been perfect

review.title: NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL.
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel under the idea it was a Renaissance Hotel. When we got there as we are Marriot rewards members we were told that they were no longer a Marriot and we would not get points or upgrades. We were then told there were some other Marriots in the city if we wanted to try those. I was like hello we already bought this room what? Then we were told there was no restaurant and after climbing a massive hill and then try to relax with a little room service we were told they no longer had it. So we had to trek back down the hill for food. We specifically booked a higher grade hotel for its amenities. When we needed some q-tips as we forgot ours it took the staff over an hour to bring them up. When I went down for breakfast you had to order at the counter and the food presented looked like it had either been microwaved or look completely inedible especially in a city known for its cuisine. The gym was ok but had no water or towels available and when I called the front desk to get some the guy showed up leisurely a half hour later with a few towls and apples and when I asked him for water he said he would be back only to never return. I asked the young concierge for water when I went downstairs and he said I have to go to the bar. I had to repeatedly go downstairs to get things because the staff was completely incompetent. The only great staff member was a female concierge who of course had recently just come over from the westin so she knew what she was doing.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to other areas. But so is the Fairmont and Mark Hopkins.
review.negativeRemarks: I am not sure if with the loss of the Marriot the staff just no longer cares or they just are as fustrated as I was. This is a 3 star hotel at best.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill prepare for a trek up and down.

review.title: At intersection between all 3 cable car lines
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but expensive parking (parking is expensive throughout San Francisco)... so having no rental car is a plus.. and hotel is at the one intersection between the three cable car lines. A $14 all-day pass on the cable cars (and buses) makes convenient connections to BART, and major tourist artractions on the north shore
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is just a few blocks to the NE.

review.title: 5 stars for location, price and some luxury
review.reviewText: This hotel is central to everything, including several mass transit options to other locales. It was much nicer than I expected and the beds were simply clouds of heaven. It had plenty of amenities, felt very safe and had nice open windows. When we checked in, the desk clerk mentioned that he was giving us "a nice quiet room on the courtyard." I can see where open windows on the street side might be a little noisy, but our room was practically silent for a city room, and I definitely never heard another guest. I travel a lot and stay in a variety of places, from dives to the Ritz. Our room was decent sized, but we randomly got put in an Accessible room, so I don't know how it might compare to others. There were quite a few luxury touches and a helpful and obliging staff. I highly recommend this place for tourists, especially those looking for big brand shopping as part of their trip. We aren't into that stuff so we used our feet and all manner of mass transit to see every part of the city we wanted. The California Street cable car right outside brought us right "home" many nights during our stay. I recommend buying a three day transit pass and a lot of adventures! AT&T Park isn't far either (The Giants ballpark). Amazing.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
Last weekend I booked a room at this hotel and although it was only a 1 night stay, I felt no worries.

The room was clean with a classic and modern style mashup. Marble table and counter tops.

It baffled us why it took 3 times talking to hotel staff to get 2 small wash towels. They kept bringing us the middle sized towel (whatever it is called.)

Due to it's location, do not expect convenient options for late night food. The kitchen closes at 11pm. When my wife and I returned to the hotel from our concert after 12am, I was HIGHLY delighted that the concierge had the menu of a local 24 hour dinner that delivered. This put the cherry on top as we did not want to take the hills on again.

Which brings me to my next point.. unless you want to get a serious hill workout, know that this is a location best accessed by taxi. It is on the TOP of a hill.

Neighborhood felt safe and if you are really feeling it, the Starlight Ballroom is about 3-4 blocks away... down the hill.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a shuttle to and from locations such as the Bart.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco... enough said. Everything is a taxi ride away. Concerts, festivals, restaurant, entertainment, the pier, shopping.. you name it.

review.title: Great Staff, close to everything in SF
review.reviewText: My son just moved to SF and this hotel was close to his apartment and centrally located to China town, Union Square etc. The concierge staff was wonderful in helping us find restaurants and sights.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff. Clean and great location.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to have access to snacks or food during the day.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on Nob Hill, close to China town, Union Square

review.title: Wonderful hotel in many respects but......
review.reviewText: We enjoyed many things about this hotel..... the location, the friendliness and efficiency of the staff, the cleanliness of the rooms and the comfort of the bed. The bellmen were exceptionally helpful and knowledgeable about local restaurants. However, we booked a "premium view" room and when we arrived we were given a room with a view of a wall in the inner courtyard. When I asked about this I was told all rooms with 2 queen beds face the inner courtyard and that is the view! Are you kidding me?????? A hotel located on the top of Nob Hill in San Francisco, one of the most beautiful cities in the world and they consider a "premium" view a view of the inner court yard??? If you are needing a room with 2 queen beds and want a view of the city, this is not the hotel for you!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The false advertising!

review.title: Water hard to get (!), rude desk staff, dirty room
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is lovely - nice location, interesting mix of stuff in the neighborhood, nice building, close to cable cars & muni. The room was also nice - comfortable bed, great linens, Aveda products in the bath, big flat screen TV, etc.
Unfortunately, their front desk staff is lacking, my room wasn't cleaned thoroughly and the beverage situation is terrible and they are stingy about it. Re: front desk staff / beverage situation. They are phasing out the minibar system, so there is no water or anything in the room. No complimentary bottles on the nightstand, nothing. The front desk referred me to a vending machine, which only had Muscle Milk in it. I went to the front desk, who acknowledged that the vending machine only had Muscle Milk, and asked for a bottle of water. They said no. Clearly, I should have brought my own water to an allegedly 4 star hotel. I asked for the hotel manager's card. No one would give me one, tho a man did emerge from the back with a bottle of water, sets it on the counter and says "we're supposed to charge" before turning on his heel and huffing back into the office. Had they even offered to sell me a bottle of water, I would have bought it - but they didn't. The room also was not cleaned properly. There were visible splatters of something brown on the floor in the bathroom and the baseboards were dirty. Also, my desk was dusty and had blonde hair on it (I am brown-haired.) There were dried leaves tracked on the floor. Not good.
review.positiveRemarks: The linens were nice and their bath products are Aveda. Close to cable cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Proper hospitality training for front desk staff, make water readily available for guests. Clean rooms completely. Or at least vacuum.
review.locationRemarks: Almost atop Nob Hill - close to Grace Cathedral, Powell & California Street cable cars, close to Chinatown, Union Square, Financial District, etc.

review.title: a
review.reviewText: The food in the bar / dining room seemed over priced - $5+ for a packet of Carnation Hot Chocolate is one example.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText:
1. The hotel is located at right in front of the intersection where all (all directions) cable cars stop.
2. It is just a couple of minutes to get to China Town by foot.
3. There are restaurants and cafes near hotel.
4. Very quiet and safe throughout the day - No people from tenderloin around the hotel like other hotels in the Union Square area.
5. It is easy to walk down to Fisherman's Wharf and walk back to the hotel if you are wearing the right shoes!
6. Walking distance to some major places like China Town, Ferry Terminal (markets, restaurants, etc), Pier 33 - 39 and Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, etc.

My husband and I (30s and 40s) visited SF and stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, and we have no complain about this hotel at all. I cannot speak about all other rooms, but our room was just right for two people. The gym in the hotel was clean and nice with enough equipment for workouts, the bar area was quiet although there are people around, staff members were very friendly, and the room was always kept clean and tidy.

It is true that it is located on almost top of a steep hill and that it is tiring walk back to hotel from the town; however, it is worth it to walk everywhere from this hotel and walk back by foot. The views are good, and it is not too tired to walk up into the hill if you are wearing the right shoes!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, safety and very friendly staff members.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, China Town, Union Square, Pier 39, Ferry Terminal (markets, restaurants, local artists, etc), Alcatraz, Bus Tours, Cable Cars

review.title: Great area
review.reviewText: Great location in beautiful neighborhood. Close to other eating areas and bars,near Chinatown. The only disadvantage is it's very hilly, going to and from, if walking.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, good price for location and accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: The reception staff was not very friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by first class hotels, near Chinatown, within walking distance to Union Square, great Italian cafe nearby, called Nob Hill Cafe, cable car

review.title: Relaxing environment
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely attentive especially the doormen and the valets.

review.title: Thank you so much Standford Court!
review.reviewText:
Booked our hotel 2 nights before our arrival. The hotel was really clean and the staff was very nice.
The room was beautil with the view of the Bay and city lights. The bed was very comfortable, definetely one
of the best I've slept in. I would highly recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: It is located in Nob hill, Union Square is not too far of a walk.

review.title: Greay place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfect place to spend our last night in the US. Walking distance to all the places we wanted to go on our last day, location was spot on and we had no issues walking back from downtown late at night. All the staff were helpful and friendly. Our room had a city outlook which I worried might be a bit noisey at night but we didn't hear a thing. Will hopefully be back to stay again!
review.locationRemarks: Close to shops, the square and some really nice places to eat. Room had a really nice view of the city.

review.title: Confused
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel thinking it was a Renaissance with the Marriott chain. I had called before I booked and no one said that the hotel changed two days before our arrival. I was unable to get points,but I was more disappointed of the lack of communication. We checked in and was told that there no longer was a restaurant or wait staff. The first room we had was at the corner of California and Powell. Ding, ding, ding went the trolleys at 6 am. When my husband went down to change rooms , the woman was very nice and found a lovely room. When we went to get keys, the machine was down and had to wait for someone to let us in our room. They were able to give us keys later, but the staff person laughed when he inquired on why we changed rooms! The other room was much nicer. We stayed for 5 nights. It was fine after that but I'm wondering if a hotel knows you are staying a number of nights, why would they place you in a smaller, noisier room.
I realize that this is a transitional stage for the hotel and the staff seemed quite frustrated. It's in a great location and gives you a good workout. It's location is on a steep incline and the parking is outrageous. There are more reasonable garages in walking distance from the hotel.
Ironically, we will try this hotel again. Hopefully, things will be smoother.
review.positiveRemarks: Location! Second room room was more spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: Communication between staff and guests.

review.title: Wonderful San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court Hotel has stood the test of time. It is a classic SF Hotel. Great rooms, great staff. It is centrally located on top of Nob Hill. Doesn't get any better than that. Great staff!
review.negativeRemarks: It is unacceptable to pay $25 for breakfast and have it served on a paper plate with plastic knives and forks. Paper coffee cups. No thank you! My com
review.locationRemarks: Top of Nob Hill. Both Cable Cars come right by the hotel to take you anywhere.

review.title: Stanford Court in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The room was not ready when we checked in which was problematic since our family was heading to a Giants' baseball game, and needed to change clothes. They said they would call when the room was ready, but failed to do so. The employee's were very nice about storing our belongings, but I really don't like doing that. Another problem I had was that there was no informational book in our room. After wandering our floor looking for an ice machine, I tried calling the front desk to no avail.

The parking attendant was super nice, and assisted us in getting a cab. The employees were friendly. And, the beds were very comfortable, and the room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Making sure the room is available upon check-in.

review.title: awful experience of the hotel staff!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText:
even I Palace hotel which is same level of star hotel allows early check in
however, this hotel staff is very unfriendly and even they had room, they say check in time is 4pm...
according to the statement it said check in time was 3pm.
very unprofessional staff !!!!!!!!

I would recommend to stay @ Palace Hotel !!!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: staff !!!!!!1

review.title: Located on top of a hill
review.reviewText:
Fine location as long as you don't mind the walk.

Our first encounter with the staff person checking us in was not pleasant. He was a bit rude towards us. We wished he would have been more friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: more friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to restaurants and union square.

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco for a Thursday and Friday night. Rooms were great , clean, beds very comfortable and had a beautiful view of the Bay. Herman and Josh are concierge at this hotel and were extremely helpful and went above and beyond for us!! Hotel located on top of Nob Hill and close to many great restaurants, union square, China Town ect... We will definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room Comfortable beds great location Nice staff
review.negativeRemarks: Need to open restaurant back up
review.locationRemarks: China town Little Italy union square Ferry Building

review.title: Nice hotel, expensive amenities
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the staff was friendly. The pillows are too flat, which I find to be a common problem. Why are hotels using pillows that go completely flat as son as toy lay down??. The hotel does not have room service, but the food from the bar was good, but expensive. $55 for two sandwiches and bloody Mary's- which were delicious. The room wa clean except under the bed looked as If it had never been vacuumed. Overall, ok+
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows! Get some that aren't completely flat!!
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do near by.

review.title: recommendation of Standford court hotel to freinds
review.reviewText: This hotel is the city centrel of San Fransisco which is very convenient to go shopping and siteseeing in San Fransisco.
review.negativeRemarks: parking is too expensive!
review.locationRemarks: very near to China town

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The beds are very comfortable. I usually have a hard time falling asleep in hotel beds but not this one. As soon as we lay down, we fell asleep. We wanted to stay in walking distance of all the attractions and we did. Steps from China Town, museum, and shopping. We rented a car but regretted because we didn't use it. One day valet parking at the hotel costs us $56. I would recommend public transportation if you have to go to the other attractions such as fisher man wharf and Golden Gate Bridge, we had to pay for parking every where. The public transit is really good and the price not bad. The trolleys run often and to the main attractions plus a few tour busses. The hotel is very clean and quite. We didn't have much interaction with the staff because we didn't spend much time there.
review.locationRemarks: China town, shopping, dining and museum

review.title: SF business trip for elvis
review.reviewText: I travel to SF monthly on business and stay at many hotels in the area. for this time frame, this was the best hotel for the money. location on nob hill- fine- not optimal for sight seeing etc - but can be done with a short walk. be prepared for up and down hike if using feet for primary mode of transport. no levels spots in this area. hotel itself- a solid 7/10. clean and comfortable- up to date. utilitarian facilities. staff was courteous but did not go out of their way to help out- eg I asked for toothpaste one am - the front desk did not have any, made no effort to help further. also, calling the front desk was problematic- they do not pick up at all at times and then did, on to hold you went - seem a little understaffed at front desk. exercise facility was better than the usual but not outstanding - at least they had a few free weights, bikes, and treadmills. nothing special but adequate. you get the point by now- solid, function and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: exercise facility. staff service.
review.locationRemarks: nob hill. hike down and up to union square etc. no homeless in the immediate area a big plus.

review.title: A Fine Hotel
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is a classic. It is located on Nob Hill, a premier location centrally located with outstanding views of San Francisco. The staff was first rate as were the facilities.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, but the new management's decision to close the restaurant and completely shut down food service for remodeling.
review.negativeRemarks: I do not understand why the new management decided to shut down the restaurant and food service for remodeling in the summer season.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square; North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Very nice older hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. The beds and bedding were wonderful. Loved the heated towel racks! Great breakfast. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: no pool or hot tub
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. Only 2 miles from AT&T Park. Not far from Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown.

review.title: very nice close to all major Museums and parks .
review.reviewText: we had free breakfast for three days and our room was up graded to a suite. very friendly staff .
review.positiveRemarks: very clean and friendly staff and a nice location.
review.negativeRemarks: long walk to the lift.
review.locationRemarks: excellent location within walking distance to every thing tourism .

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Booked two nights, stayed one. Arrived late on a Sunday after a flight from the East Coast.

First experience was that the room was extremely far from the elevator. Not insurmountable, but a little bit of an inconvenience.

Woke early to prepare for meetings. Coffee not available in the breakfast area until 6:30am. I was given inaccurate directions to the Starbucks.

Needed to print materials for business meeting. Business center was closed and no other method for printing was provided. Staff instructed access to other PCs was not allowed. (They did print a boarding pass however - just no access by customers.) Very inconvenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Get the business center open, open the breakfast area earlier

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: The Stanford Court is a very nice hotel in the old style of elegance but not to elegant, just very pleasant not pretentious. It is close to many the tourist attractions, but I chose it because of it's proximity to the financial district. Located on the top of Nob Hill, just a short walk to Little Italy, China Town, Coit Tower, the waterfront is walkable but wear good shoes and two cable cars just out the front door. The staff were always helpful and available. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable, everything I am looking for when traveling.

review.title: Nice hotel in the city
review.reviewText: I have an excellent experience in this trip st the hotel the service since the begin to the end

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Took my husband for a weekend birthday getaway. Initially had some delays getting checked in, but staff and management did their best to ensure that everything worked out to our satisfaction.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and management were hospitable and friendly. Great atmosphere.
review.locationRemarks: Well located, close to lots of attractions. Cable cars and picturesque views of the city at your doorstep.

review.title: Nice hotel and very convenient access to cable car
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and in a great location for us, not in a hustle & bustle area. Really like the convenient access to cable car. Room is clean, good size for two, not dark or stuffy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient access to cable car & room is clean & comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Softer bath towels.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great for us and the cable car stop right at the hotel which was excellent!

review.title: Stanford Court worth the stay
review.reviewText: The hotel shuttle/sedan that is available is a tremendous asset for guests, especially those having trouble navigating the steep streets. The front desk and the concierges, notably JOSH, were outstanding. I can't say enough about the help that Josh gave us in sightseeing, restaurants, getting ice, printing boarding passes, etc. He was awesome. Room was very clean although it overlooked a grungy backlane full of garbage containers, but other than that was very good. Location was excellent in terms of proximity to Union Square, Westfield, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Josh, the concierge and the shuttle/sedan.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was expensive
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to Union Square and Westfield and main transportation. Lots of cabs.

review.title: Excellent experience and good location
review.reviewText: Breakfast coudl have been better if some standard meals like beacon, toast bread and sramble eggs or noodle provide woudl be excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Service staff excellent and clean room
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: location near Chinatown and shopping mails

review.title: Location,location,location
review.reviewText: First time at this location and totally impressed with room, amenities and views
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent view of downtown and bay!
review.negativeRemarks: Eggs for breakfast
review.locationRemarks: North each has the best Italian food,espressos and people watching a few blocks away. The waterfront a few blocks in the opposite side fishermawharf.

review.title: Good hotel, great Nob Hill location.
review.reviewText: Stayed for 2 nights, and was very happy with the quality and service. Continental breakfast was included in the price (not sure if that's a permanent thing though) - breads, cereals, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee. Hotel is located pretty much at the crest of Nob Hill, but right on a street car line if you're feeling lazy. Close to many great restaurants and bars.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was a bit expensive at $60 a day.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk (10-15 mins) north down the hill to North Beach - loads of good bars and restaurants.

review.title: INSTALL SAFE'S IN THE ROOMS!
review.reviewText: It's always questionable to me when a hotel does not provide a lockable safe in the room. Carrying an iPad, phone, cords, etc. is cumbersome when the expectation is that you have a safe place to put them while you're traveling.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds and pillows were comfortable. Rooms are clean. It's quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Get a safe!

review.title: Pleasant stay except for....
review.reviewText: The room is spacious and bedding is comfortable. It would have been a better stay if Not for the poor Wi-Fi connectivity and the poor service of front desk.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Good stay. Location is unbeatable. Close to everything. No view in the room, but instead court side rooms are very quite. Room is clean.Staff was very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Court side rooms are very quite. Nice beds. Climate control.
review.negativeRemarks: NO DRINKING WATER IN THE HOTEL! Vending machine was empty. Only supply was $10/bottle in the bar (!)
review.locationRemarks: Nob hill location is great. Close to shopping, entertainment.

review.title: "Premier" View Room was NOT premier, no city views
review.reviewText: Great and grand BUT Expedia listed room as Premier but room booked through Expedia was view of courtyard with view of roof on 2nd floor - No City view such as pictures in offering
review.positiveRemarks: Location and classy full service and friendly valets
review.negativeRemarks: Offering of city views through Expedia
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco on top of Knob Hill - there is nothing finer

review.title: Nice area and hotel.
review.reviewText: On top of nob hill and across from Fairmont. Nice hotel.. Parking was $57 a night. Continental breakfast was good. Get a room away from the street. I could hear the trains early in the morning. Street noise could be heard but it wasn't unbearable. Couldn't hook up my laptop to the tv since the input button wouldn't work. Small sized tv.

review.title: Great location, facilities and price
review.reviewText: The location is great.. Just a few blocks from everything including parking garages that are much cheaper than the hotel. View from queen was perfect. Price was the cheapest I found for a holiday weekend for the location. Trolleys run right next
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the hallways and carpets are dirty but the place is a bit older and expected. Plus, how much time do you really spend at the hotel?

review.title: Great location, nice facilities
review.reviewText: Great location for tourists. Right in front of cable car station and close to everything. Nice, clean facilities. Breakfast yogurt parfait was delicious. But some staffs in the front desk were not very kind. I felt they were too busy for me and hurried away. I asked if breakfast was included then he told me to ask the restaurant next morning. WTH? Parking staffs were very helpful and accommodating tho.
